original: gang gi mdun du ltung ba bshags pa des kyang khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam ma bcad dris shig / ma dris par bshags pa byas sam nyams su blangs na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang gi mdun du ltung ba bshags pa des kyang khyod kyis dngos po de bcad dam ma bcad dris shig / ma dris par bshags pa byas sam nyams su blangs na nyes byas so //
translated: If one confesses or practices without asking, there is an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ltung ba de yang slar bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba de yang slar bshags par bya'o //
translated: That downfall should be confessed again.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
translated: Downfall means falling into the three lower realms.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis gding ba srid du khru phyed dang lnga dang / zheng du khru do sor drug las lhag par byas na ci tsam gyis lhag par byas pa ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis gding ba srid du khru phyed dang lnga dang / zheng du khru do sor drug las lhag par byas na ci tsam gyis lhag par byas pa ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Regarding offense, if a monk makes a sitting mat that is more than one cubit and five fingerbreadths long and more than two cubits and six fingerbreadths wide, he commits a downfall to whatever extent it exceeds those measurements.

original: dge slong gi g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'das par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'das par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The origin story for the prohibition against monks making a rain cloak that exceeds the proper size took place in Śrāvastī.

original: de'i tshe na dge slong dag la g-yan pa byung nas chos gos la reg pas na chos gos kyang ma rung sbrang ma dag 'du bas /
analyzed: de'i tshe na dge slong dag la g-yan pa byung nas chos gos la reg pas na chos gos kyang ma rung sbrang ma dag 'du bas /
translated: At that time, the monks developed rashes, and when they touched their robes, the robes were ruined and flies gathered.

original: skye bo dag 'phya ba las g-yan pa dgab pa chongs shig ces bka' stsal te /
analyzed: skye bo dag 'phya ba las g-yan pa dgab pa chongs shig ces bka' stsal te /
translated: The Blessed One said, Wear a loincloth to avoid people's criticism.🔽Since the loincloth was not washed, flies gathered and it became smelly. He said, Wash it. When you wring it out, do so without twisting it.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa yang ma bkrus pas sbrang ma dag kyang 'du shing mnam pa las khrus shig 'bud pa'i tshe na gsher bar byos la phung cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong dag gis ha cang ma 'os par tshad las 'das par byas pa dang /
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa yang ma bkrus pas sbrang ma dag kyang 'du shing mnam pa las khrus shig 'bud pa'i tshe na gsher bar byos la phung cig ces bka' stsal pa dang / dge slong dag gis ha cang ma 'os par tshad las 'das par byas pa dang /
translated: The monks twisted it too much.

original: don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: don nyung ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks with few concerns criticized them, saying, How can the monks twist the loincloth too much?🔽The Blessed One rebuked them, saying, Foolish men, how can you twist the loincloth too much?

original: dge slong rnams la mang du 'dod pa mgu mi myong ba zhes smad nas g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'dar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la mang du 'dod pa mgu mi myong ba zhes smad nas g-yan pa dgab pa tshad las 'dar mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: He criticized them in many ways and established a training rule for the monks: The loincloth should not be twisted too much.

original: g-yan pa dgab pa zhes bya ba ni nad kyi gos so //
analyzed: g-yan pa dgab pa zhes bya ba ni nad kyi gos so //
translated: The text says loincloth and so on.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni chos 'di la zhugs pa'o //
translated: The text says monk and so on.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: The text says twist and so on.

original: tshad bzhin du gyis shig ces bya ba ni g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshad bzhin du gyis shig ces bya ba ni g-yan pa dgab pa'i tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: “Make it the right size” means that this is the size for covering scabs.

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bzhi'o //🔽zheng du mtho do'o //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bzhi'o // zheng du mtho do'o //
translated: In length it is four times the height of the Sugata.🔽In width it is two times the height of the Sugata.

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bzhi la khru drug go //🔽zheng du @133a * //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bzhi la khru drug go // zheng du @133a * //
translated: In length it is six cubits of the Sugata.

original: mtho do la khru tshad ma gsum mo //
analyzed: mtho do la khru tshad ma gsum mo //
translated: In width it is three cubits.

original: de las lhag par byas zhes bya ba ni de las 'das par byas pa'o //
analyzed: de las lhag par byas zhes bya ba ni de las 'das par byas pa'o //
translated: “If you make it larger than that” means if you make it larger than that.

original: bcad nas ltung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po sngar bcad nas ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bcad nas ltung ba'o zhes bya ba ni dngos po sngar bcad nas ltung ba bshags par bya ba'o //
translated: “You commit an offense entailing confession” means that you should confess the offense after cutting off the excess.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba'o //
translated: “Offense” means falling into the three lower realms.

original: nyes pa ni chur khru drug zheng du khru gsum las lhag par byas na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyes pa ni chur khru drug zheng du khru gsum las lhag par byas na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Finesse” means that if you make it more than six cubits in length and three cubits in width, you commit an offense entailing confession.

original: gang gis mdun du ltung ba bshags pa des bcad dam ma bcad ces dris shig / ma dris par bshags na nyes byas so //
analyzed: gang gis mdun du ltung ba bshags pa des bcad dam ma bcad ces dris shig / ma dris par bshags na nyes byas so //
translated: “Ask whether it has been cut or not” means that you should ask whether the excess has been cut off or not. If you confess without asking, you commit an offense of wrong conduct.

original: ras chen tshad las lhag par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng bzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: ras chen tshad las lhag par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng bzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The four topics of discussion about not permitting the use of a large bathing towel are as follows.

original: dge slong dag sbren mor skyabs med pa na khrus byed pa ri dags dgra'i ma sa gas mthong nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag sbren mor skyabs med pa na khrus byed pa ri dags dgra'i ma sa gas mthong nas /
translated: In Śrāvastī, the mother of Mṛgāra saw the monks bathing naked.

original: skye bo ma dad pa rnams 'phyar dogs nas /
analyzed: skye bo ma dad pa rnams 'phyar dogs nas /
translated: Fearing that non-Buddhists would criticize them,

original: slan chad skyabs med par khrus mi byed par bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar gsol lo snyam nas /
analyzed: slan chad skyabs med par khrus mi byed par bslab pa'i gzhi bca' bar gsol lo snyam nas /
translated: she thought, “I will request that they establish a basis of training not to bathe naked.”🔽The lay vow holder offered a curtain and a large summer towel to the monks while they were bathing.🔽The Blessed One permitted the monks to use a large towel in the future.

original: dge bsnyen mas gnyid kyis dge slong khrus kyi tshe ni yol ba dbyar gyi ras chen du phul nas phyin chad ras chen 'chang bar bcom ldan 'das la gsol bar bkas gnang ba dang / dge slong dag gis ha cang ma 'os par chen por byas pa dang /
analyzed: dge bsnyen mas gnyid kyis dge slong khrus kyi tshe ni yol ba dbyar gyi ras chen du phul nas phyin chad ras chen 'chang bar bcom ldan 'das la gsol bar bkas gnang ba dang / dge slong dag gis ha cang ma 'os par chen por byas pa dang /
translated: The monks used it too large.

original: don nyung ngu ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: don nyung ngu ba'i dge slong dag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The monks who had few concerns criticized this.

original: gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba zhes smad nas tshad las 'das par byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: gso dka' ba dgang dka' ba zhes smad nas tshad las 'das par byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: It is difficult to cure and difficult to fill means that it is not permitted to make it exceed the measure from below.

original: dbyar gyi ras chen zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i gos dang khrus kyi skyabs so //
analyzed: dbyar gyi ras chen zhes bya ba ni char 'bab pa'i gos dang khrus kyi skyabs so //
translated: The great rain-retentive cloth means the cloth for the rainy season and the cloth for bathing.

original: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The monk means many monks, and the same applies to others.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //
translated: To make means by oneself or by others.

original: tshad bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tshad ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: tshad bzhin du zhes bya ba ni tshad ni 'di yin te /
translated: According to the measure means the measure is as follows.

original: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug go //
analyzed: srid du bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug go //
translated: In length, six cubits of the Sugata.

original: zheng du mtho phyed dang gsum mo //
analyzed: zheng du mtho phyed dang gsum mo //
translated: In width, one cubit and a half.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug la khru dgu'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho drug la khru dgu'o //
translated: Six cubits of the Sugata is nine cubits.

original: bde bar gshags pa'i mtho phyed dang gsum la khru tshad gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
analyzed: bde bar gshags pa'i mtho phyed dang gsum la khru tshad gsum dang sor bco brgyad do //
translated: One cubit and a half of the Sugata is three cubits and eighteen finger-widths.

original: lhag pa zhes bya ba ni de las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa zhes bya ba ni de las 'das pa'o //
translated: Excess means beyond that.

original: bcad nas ltung ba zhes pa ni dngos po bcad nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: bcad nas ltung ba zhes pa ni dngos po bcad nas ltung ba bshags par bya'o //
translated: Having cut, one confesses the downfall means having cut the material, one should confess the downfall.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du'o //
translated: The downfall is to the three lower realms.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong gis srid du khru dgu /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong gis srid du khru dgu /
translated: The fault is that if a monk makes a mat that is more than nine cubits long

original: zheng du khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad las ltag par byas na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //🔽gang gi mdun du bshags pa des kyang dngos po bcad dam ma bcad dris shig ma dris par bshags na nyes byas so //
analyzed: zheng du khru gsum dang sor bco brgyad las ltag par byas na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro // gang gi mdun du bshags pa des kyang dngos po bcad dam ma bcad dris shig ma dris par bshags na nyes byas so //
translated: and three and a half cubits wide, he commits a downfall.

original: dge slong gis chos gos @133b bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dang de las lhag par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis chos gos @133b bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dang de las lhag par byed du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The person in front of whom the monk confesses the downfall should ask whether the mat has been cut up or not. If the monk confesses the downfall without being asked, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.🔽The Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī.🔽At that time, Upāli asked a craftsman, “Make a Dharma robe for me the size of the Blessed One’s Dharma robe.”

original: de'i tshe bsnyen dga' bos bzo mkhan zhig la bdag gi chos gos bcom ldan 'das kyi chos gos kyi tshad du gyis shig ces bcol ba dang / de lta bu'i chen pos ci bya zhes byas na /
analyzed: de'i tshe bsnyen dga' bos bzo mkhan zhig la bdag gi chos gos bcom ldan 'das kyi chos gos kyi tshad du gyis shig ces bcol ba dang / de lta bu'i chen pos ci bya zhes byas na /
translated: The craftsman said, “What should I do with such a large robe?”

original: khyod la ni gla rngan dang zas dgos su zad mdo //
analyzed: khyod la ni gla rngan dang zas dgos su zad mdo //
translated: “You will be paid for your work and you will be given food.”

original: tshad dri ci dgos zhes byas pa dang / bzo mkhan gyis bsams pa de ni kho zer ba bden no snyam nas drubs te byin pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo yang chos gos de gyon te ji snyed ma rdzogs pa phrag pa la bkal nas /🔽gtsug lag khang gcig nas gcig tu byung ba dang dge slong gzhan dag gis mthong ste /
analyzed: tshad dri ci dgos zhes byas pa dang / bzo mkhan gyis bsams pa de ni kho zer ba bden no snyam nas drubs te byin pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo yang chos gos de gyon te ji snyed ma rdzogs pa phrag pa la bkal nas / gtsug lag khang gcig nas gcig tu byung ba dang dge slong gzhan dag gis mthong ste /
translated: When Nanda put on the robe, he carried the unfinished parts on his shoulders.

original: phrag pa la bkal ba 'di ci zhig dris na /
analyzed: phrag pa la bkal ba 'di ci zhig dris na /
translated: He went from one temple to another, and the other monks asked him, What is that you are carrying on your shoulders?

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i na bza'i tshad do zhes byas pa dang / de dag na re ci khyod de lta bu gyon du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / dbang yang rung mi dbang yang rung dgra'i phrag par rdog pas brdzis te dbang ngo zhes byas pa dang /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i na bza'i tshad do zhes byas pa dang / de dag na re ci khyod de lta bu gyon du dbang ngam zhes byas pa dang / dbang yang rung mi dbang yang rung dgra'i phrag par rdog pas brdzis te dbang ngo zhes byas pa dang /
translated: He said, It is the size of the Sugata's robe. They said, Can you wear it? He said, Whether I can or cannot, I will step on the shoulders of my enemies with my foot and wear it!

original: dgra su zhes byas na de skad zer bas khyod nyid nga'i dgra'o zhes zer ba las snyan du bdas nas bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du bgyid du mi gnang bar bcas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo de bas kyang lhag par byas te gyon pa las don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ste /
analyzed: dgra su zhes byas na de skad zer bas khyod nyid nga'i dgra'o zhes zer ba las snyan du bdas nas bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du bgyid du mi gnang bar bcas pa dang / bsnyen dga' bo de bas kyang lhag par byas te gyon pa las don nyung ba'i dge slong rnams 'phya ste /
translated: The Buddha said, Who is your enemy? Nanda replied, You are my enemy! The Buddha said, You are my enemy because you do not allow me to make robes the size of the Tathagata's robes.🔽 Nanda made robes even larger than that.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi chad du ma byed cig ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi chad du ma byed cig ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: The monks who had few concerns criticized him, saying, The Blessed One said, 'Do not make robes the size of the Tathagata's robes.'

original: nga dge slong gis ci'i phyir de bas kyang lhag par byed ces mi snyan par zer ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: nga dge slong gis ci'i phyir de bas kyang lhag par byed ces mi snyan par zer ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: Why do you make robes even larger than that?

original: bkas rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
analyzed: bkas rnam grangs du ma'i sgo nas smad nas /
translated: The Blessed One censured Nanda in many ways and said,🔽Do not make robes the size of the Tathagata's robes or larger than that.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dang de las lhag par byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad dang de las lhag par byed du mi gnang bar 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: He then laid down rules of training for the monks.

original: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The monk is Nanda, and others like him.

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos zhes bya ba la /
translated: The robe of the Sugata is explained as follows.

original: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa la bya ste /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa ni ston pa la bya ste /
translated: The Sugata is the Teacher.

original: de'i chos gos kyi srid du ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu la khru tshad ma bco lnga'o zheng du mtho drug ni khru tshad ma dgu'o //
analyzed: de'i chos gos kyi srid du ni bde bar gshegs pa'i mtho bcu la khru tshad ma bco lnga'o zheng du mtho drug ni khru tshad ma dgu'o //
translated: The length of his robe is fifteen cubits, and the width is nine cubits.

original: chos gos zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnam pa bdun po'i nang du gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: chos gos zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnam pa bdun po'i nang du gang yang rung ste /
translated: The robe is any one of the seven types of cloth:

original: gso ma dang bal dang zar ma dang du gu la dang ko tam pa dang / shing bal dang / srin bal dang / srin bal gyi'o //
analyzed: gso ma dang bal dang zar ma dang du gu la dang ko tam pa dang / shing bal dang / srin bal dang / srin bal gyi'o //
translated: cloth made of flax, cotton, silk, wool, coarse cloth, mixed cloth, or linen.

original: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so //🔽lhag ces bya ba ni de @134a * //
analyzed: byed ces bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyis so // lhag ces bya ba ni de @134a * //
translated: To make means to make it oneself or to have someone else make it.

original: las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: las 'das pa'o //
translated: The excess means more than that.

original: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba la bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba ni ngan song gsum du ltung ba la bya'o //
translated: To fall means to fall into the three lower realms.🔽The offense is to make a robe the size of the Sugata’s robe,

original: nyes pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas sam /
analyzed: nyes pa ni bde bar gshegs pa'i chos gos kyi tshad du byas sam /
translated: The fault is that it is not the size of the Sugata's robe.🔽

original: de las lhag par byas na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las lhag par byas na thams cad du ltung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If he does more than that, he commits an offense in all cases.

original: ltung ba dgu bcu pa mi brjed pa'i tshig rdzogs so /
analyzed: ltung ba dgu bcu pa mi brjed pa'i tshig rdzogs so /
translated: The ninety-first downfall.

original: // / so sor bshags pa dang po ste grong du dge slong ma'i lag nas zas slong du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
analyzed: // / so sor bshags pa dang po ste grong du dge slong ma'i lag nas zas slong du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: The first chapter on individual confessions. The background for the prohibition against monks receiving food from the hands of nuns in a village is as follows.

original: de'i tshe dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog bsod snyoms snga ma ni spangs shing dge 'dun la phul bar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong ma autpa la'i mdog bsod snyoms snga ma ni spangs shing dge 'dun la phul bar gyur to //
translated: At that time, the nun Utpalavarna had given up her previous alms and offered them to the Sangha.

original: phyi ma blangs pa ni dge slong bsod snyoms pa zan ma rnyed pa zhig dang lam du phrad nas de la byin te de'i nyin mo dge slong ma de'i zan chang do //
analyzed: phyi ma blangs pa ni dge slong bsod snyoms pa zan ma rnyed pa zhig dang lam du phrad nas de la byin te de'i nyin mo dge slong ma de'i zan chang do //
translated: She received later ones, and on the road she met a monk who was begging for alms and had not found any food. She gave it to him, and on that day the nun did not get any food.

original: bsod snyoms pa'i lag na autpa la'i mdog gis zas byin pa bzang po zhig khyer ba bsnyen dga' bos mthong nas khyod la 'di sus byin zhes dris na autpa li'i mdog gis byin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: bsod snyoms pa'i lag na autpa la'i mdog gis zas byin pa bzang po zhig khyer ba bsnyen dga' bos mthong nas khyod la 'di sus byin zhes dris na autpa li'i mdog gis byin no zhes smras so //
translated: The nun Subhadra saw Utpalavarna carrying in her hand excellent food given by a lay person. She asked, “Who gave this to you?” Utpalavarna replied, “It was given by Utpalavarna.”

original: de'i phyir de nyin yang bsod snyoms blangs nas snga ma dge 'dun la phul phyi nas blangs pa dag bza' zhes byas na bsnyen dga' bos lam du bsgugs te zan bslangs pas na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyin yang bsod snyoms blangs nas snga ma dge 'dun la phul phyi nas blangs pa dag bza' zhes byas na bsnyen dga' bos lam du bsgugs te zan bslangs pas na /
translated: Since Upacelā waited on the road and begged for food,

original: de nyi ma gnyis su zan chad pa la nyi tshan gyis phog pas lus rmya ste /
analyzed: de nyi ma gnyis su zan chad pa la nyi tshan gyis phog pas lus rmya ste /
translated: he went two days without food. Since he was struck by the sun, his body wasted away.🔽When he was unable to walk, he collapsed in the street.

original: 'gro ma nus na srang du 'gyel ba dang / 'jig rten pa dag na re dge slong ma sh'akya gzhon nu dag mthong bas 'dod chags kyis brgyal lo zhes 'phya ba las /
analyzed: 'gro ma nus na srang du 'gyel ba dang / 'jig rten pa dag na re dge slong ma sh'akya gzhon nu dag mthong bas 'dod chags kyis brgyal lo zhes 'phya ba las /
translated: Worldly people said, “The bhikṣu saw young Śākyas and fainted from desire.”🔽They ridiculed him.

original: phyin chad dge slong ma grong du 'gro ba la bsod snyoms slong du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: phyin chad dge slong ma grong du 'gro ba la bsod snyoms slong du mi gnang bar bslab pa bcas so //
translated: After that, it was not permitted for bhikṣuṇīs to go to town and beg for alms.🔽The rule was established.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni bsnyen dga' bo ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: “A bhikṣu” refers to Upacelā and others like him.

original: gnyen ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i zung bdun rgyud tshun chad do //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni pha ma'i zung bdun rgyud tshun chad do //
translated: “Not a relative” means not within seven generations of one’s father and mother.

original: dge slong ma zhas bya ba ni autpa la'i mdog ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhas bya ba ni autpa la'i mdog ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: The nun is Utpalavarna, and others like her.

original: mal zhes bya ba ni srang ngo //
analyzed: mal zhes bya ba ni srang ngo //
translated: A bed means a bed, and so on.

original: grong du bsod snyoms spyod ces bya ba ni gang na srang dang / sum mdo dang / bzhi mdo yod pa'i grong ngo //
analyzed: grong du bsod snyoms spyod ces bya ba ni gang na srang dang / sum mdo dang / bzhi mdo yod pa'i grong ngo //
translated: To go for alms in a village means to a village where there are streets, crossroads, and intersections.

original: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag nas lag tu len pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni lag nas lag tu len pa'o //
translated: With one's own hands means from hand to hand.

original: bca' ba dang bza' zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga la bya'o //
translated: Food and drink means the five foods and the five drinks.

original: blangs zhes bya ba ni byin len byas pa'o //
analyzed: blangs zhes bya ba ni byin len byas pa'o //
translated: To receive means to accept.

original: 'chos sam zos zhes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
analyzed: 'chos sam zos zhes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
translated: To eat or consume means to swallow.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni gang yin pa'o //
translated: That monk means the one who is the subject.

original: phyi rol gyi kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi kun dga' ra ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: An external monastery means:

original: phyi rol du gyur pa ni gtsug lag khang ste /
analyzed: phyi rol du gyur pa ni gtsug lag khang ste /
translated: An external monastery is a temple.

original: gtsug lag khang du song shig pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang du song shig pa'o //
translated: Go to the temple.

original: dge slong rnams kyi gan du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang de na dge slong du 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi gan du zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang de na dge slong du 'khod pa'o //
translated: In the presence of the monks means in the presence of the monks in that monastery.

original: @134b shogs shig ces bya ba ni de na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa de la mthol zhing bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: @134b shogs shig ces bya ba ni de na dge slong ji snyed 'khod pa de la mthol zhing bshags par bya'o //
translated: One should confess means that one should confess to all the monks who are present.

original: smad pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa byung ba de smad par rigs pas na smad pa'o //
analyzed: smad pa zhes bya ba ni nyes pa byung ba de smad par rigs pas na smad pa'o //
translated: Reproach means that it is proper to reproach one who has incurred a downfall.🔽Improper means that it is a contradiction.

original: mi rigs zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i so sor bshags zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po la bshags pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs zhes bya ba ni 'gal ba'i so sor bshags zhes bya ba ni dge slong mang po la bshags pa'o //
translated: Confession means confessing to a number of monks.

original: de la ltung ba ni dge slong gis gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma lam na 'dug pa'i bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro ba la gnyen ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang / bza' ba blangs nas 'chos sam zos na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ltung ba ni dge slong gis gnyen ma yin pa'i dge slong ma lam na 'dug pa'i bsod snyoms kyi phyir 'gro ba la gnyen ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang / bza' ba blangs nas 'chos sam zos na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The downfall is that if a monk, with the perception that a nun is not a relative, takes with his own hand food for a nun who is not a relative and who is on the road, and then eats it, he incurs a downfall that requires confession.

original: gnyen ma yin pa la the tshom na yang bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyen ma yin pa la the tshom na yang bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is unsure whether she is a relative, he incurs a downfall that requires confession.

original: gnyen yin pa lam yin par 'du shes pa dang / the tshom na yang nyes byas re rer 'gyur ro //🔽so sor bshags pa dang po'o //🔽so sor bshags pa gnyis pa ste /🔽dge slong mas dge slong zan za ba la stobs pa dang snga nas sbyor du bcug pa zar mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni mnyan du yod pa na ste /

translated: If he perceives one who is a friend as being a path, and if he is in doubt, there is one offense of wrong conduct.🔽The first confession.🔽The second confession.🔽The origin story for the prohibition against a fully ordained nun serving food to a fully ordained monk who is eating, or having it prepared beforehand, took place in Śrāvastī.🔽🔽

original: des kyang de bzhin du byas te bshams nas yon bdag zan 'drim pa'i tshe sgom dga' mo rgan rims su 'dug nas khyim bdag la 'phags pa 'di ni sh'akya'i rigs las rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum smra ba rigs pa la grol ba'i spobs pa can yin
analyzed: des kyang de bzhin du byas te bshams nas yon bdag zan 'drim pa'i tshe sgom dga' mo rgan rims su 'dug nas khyim bdag la 'phags pa 'di ni sh'akya'i rigs las rab tu byung ba sde snod gsum smra ba rigs pa la grol ba'i spobs pa can yin
translated: The householder did as he was asked, and when he was serving the food, the nun Bhadra, who was the most senior of the nuns, said to the householder, “This noble one is a monk who has gone forth from the Śākya clan. He is a proponent of the Tripiṭaka and has the eloquence of one who is liberated in reasoning.

original: gyis / de la yang byin cig de bzhin du drug sde po kun gyi yon tan brjod cing zas kyis stobs su bcug pa nas /
analyzed: gyis / de la yang byin cig de bzhin du drug sde po kun gyi yon tan brjod cing zas kyis stobs su bcug pa nas /
translated: Please give him some food, too.” In this way, she had the householder give food to all six of the groups of monks, and she had him give them the best food.

original: de na dge slong kha cig ni zan chad /
analyzed: de na dge slong kha cig ni zan chad /
translated: Some of the monks had no food.

original: kha cig ni khur ba chad kha cig ni ye nas zan ma thob pas /
analyzed: kha cig ni khur ba chad kha cig ni ye nas zan ma thob pas /
translated: Some had no bread. Some had never received any food.

original: de na dge slong nyon mongs pa ma spangs shing 'dod pas gzir ba rnams kyis khyim bdag la spyos te /
analyzed: de na dge slong nyon mongs pa ma spangs shing 'dod pas gzir ba rnams kyis khyim bdag la spyos te /
translated: The monks who had not abandoned their afflictions and who were tormented by desire scolded the householder,

original: rgyu med na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dang dge song gi dge 'dun bshos gsol zhes byas na /
analyzed: rgyu med na ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das dang dge song gi dge 'dun bshos gsol zhes byas na /
translated: saying, “Why did you feed the Blessed One and the community of monks if you had no food?”

original: yon bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: yon bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The householder said,

original: bdag gis zhal zas mang zhig sbyar na /
analyzed: bdag gis zhal zas mang zhig sbyar na /
translated: “I prepared a great deal of food.

original: sbom dga' mos dge slong drug sde po la yang nas yang du bstabs pas de ltar 'chad par gyur to zhes smras pa dang / de ltar dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas de ltar na dge slong @135a * //
analyzed: sbom dga' mos dge slong drug sde po la yang nas yang du bstabs pas de ltar 'chad par gyur to zhes smras pa dang / de ltar dge slong dag gis snyan du gsol nas de ltar na dge slong @135a * //
translated: The nun Utpalavarṇā said, The nun Sthūlanandā has repeatedly served the group of six monks, and so she explains it.🔽 When the monks reported this, the Blessed One said, Therefore, monks, you should tell the nuns, 'While the monk is eating, the nun who is preparing the meal should remain silent.'

original: dag dge slong ma shom pa la dge slong zas zos zin gyi bar du kha rog 'dug zhig ces bsgo shig / de nas dge slong 'khod bdag sus kyang ma smras na /
analyzed: dag dge slong ma shom pa la dge slong zas zos zin gyi bar du kha rog 'dug zhig ces bsgo shig / de nas dge slong 'khod bdag sus kyang ma smras na /
translated: Then, if no one among the assembled monks speaks,

original: dge slong thams cad la bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong thams cad la bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: all the monks will have confessed.'

original: zhes 'dul ba bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: zhes 'dul ba bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: Thus he established a rule of training for the nuns.

original: dge slong mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis yan chad la mang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis yan chad la mang po zhes bya'o //
translated: As for many monks, two or more are called many.

original: khyim ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim mo /
analyzed: khyim ni bram ze dang khyim bdag gi khyim mo /
translated: A house is a house of a Brahmin or householder.

original: mgron du pos zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga la bos pa'o //
analyzed: mgron du pos zhes bya ba ni bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga la bos pa'o //
translated: To invite means to invite to the five foods and five non-foods.

original: de na gal te dge slong ma zhig bsgo zhing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' mo ste /
analyzed: de na gal te dge slong ma zhig bsgo zhing 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' mo ste /
translated: If there is a nun who is instructing there, means Sthūlanandā.

original: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: And it is the same for others.

original: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni de na 'khod pa dag go //
analyzed: dge slong gis zhes bya ba ni de na 'khod pa dag go //
translated: “Monks” refers to those who are present there.

original: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' mo dang gzhan yang rung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong ma zhes bya ba ni sbom dga' mo dang gzhan yang rung ngo //
translated: “Nuns” refers to Thullanandā and others.

original: de la 'di skad ces bsgo shig ces bya ba ni mo zer ba bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bsgo shig ces bya ba ni mo zer ba bzlog pa'o //
translated: “You should tell her this” means that you should stop her from speaking.

original: zan zos kyi bar du sdod cig ces bya ba ni zan zos kyi bar du zer du mi gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: zan zos kyi bar du sdod cig ces bya ba ni zan zos kyi bar du zer du mi gzhug pa'o //
translated: “Stay until you have eaten” means that you should not speak until you have eaten.

original: dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la smra ra ma spobs na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dge slong gcig gis kyang dge slong ma de la smra ra ma spobs na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Not a single monk should speak to that nun” means

original: dge slong zan zab gcig gis kyang ma smras pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong zan zab gcig gis kyang ma smras pa'o //
translated: that not a single monk should speak.

original: dge slong de dag thams cad phyi rol kun dga' ra bar deng shig ces bya ba ni grong las phyi rol du gyur pa zhig gtsug lag khang ste /
analyzed: dge slong de dag thams cad phyi rol kun dga' ra bar deng shig ces bya ba ni grong las phyi rol du gyur pa zhig gtsug lag khang ste /
translated: “All those monks should go to the outer courtyard” means that the monastery is outside the town.

original: der deng la de na dge slong ji snyed pa la bshags par bya'o //
analyzed: der deng la de na dge slong ji snyed pa la bshags par bya'o //
translated: Go there and confess to all the monks there.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong kha cig yang thog na za zhing 'khod /
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong kha cig yang thog na za zhing 'khod /
translated: Some monks were eating on the roof.

original: kha cig ni bar khang na za zhing 'khod na dge slong ma de skad zer ba dang / dge slong dag gis dge slong ma ma zer cig ces bsgo shig / de skad ma byas na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni bar khang na za zhing 'khod na dge slong ma de skad zer ba dang / dge slong dag gis dge slong ma ma zer cig ces bsgo shig / de skad ma byas na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The monks said, “Don’t say that, nun!”🔽If they do not say that, then each one must confess.

original: dge slong kha cig ni 'og khang na zan za kha cig ni sgo khang na za zhing 'khod pa las de na dge slong ma zhig bsgo zhing 'dug na /
analyzed: dge slong kha cig ni 'og khang na zan za kha cig ni sgo khang na za zhing 'khod pa las de na dge slong ma zhig bsgo zhing 'dug na /
translated: Some monks were eating in the lower story, and some were eating in the gateway.🔽A nun was there, and they said to her, “Don’t say that!”

original: de la ma zer cig cas bsgo shig / dge slong gcig gis kyang ma bsgo na dge slong kun la so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ma zer cig cas bsgo shig / dge slong gcig gis kyang ma bsgo na dge slong kun la so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If not a single monk says that, then each one must confess.

original: dge slong ma de yon bdag yin nam go rims su bab pa la sbyin du bcug pa ni nyes pa med so sor bshags pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma de yon bdag yin nam go rims su bab pa la sbyin du bcug pa ni nyes pa med so sor bshags pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: If that nun is the patroness, or if she is made to give in turn, there is no offense. This is the second confession.

original: so sor bshags pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: so sor bshags pa gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the third confession.

original: dge slong gis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim du slong du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul yangs pa can na ste /
analyzed: dge slong gis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin pa'i khyim du slong du mi gnang ba'i gleng gzhi ni yul yangs pa can na ste /
translated: The monks were not allowed to beg in the house where the precepts were given.

original: de'i tshe na khyim bdag ded dpon seng ge zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
analyzed: de'i tshe na khyim bdag ded dpon seng ge zhes bya ba zhig yod de /
translated: At that time there was a householder named Siṃha-sēna.

original: de sngon chad mu stegs can la mos dad cing dga'o //
analyzed: de sngon chad mu stegs can la mos dad cing dga'o //
translated: He had previously been devoted to the tīrthikas and had taken pleasure in them.

original: phyis bcom ldan 'das kyis ded dpon de la chos bshad pas na bden pa mthong bar gyur te /
analyzed: phyis bcom ldan 'das kyis ded dpon de la chos bshad pas na bden pa mthong bar gyur te /
translated: Later, the Blessed One explained the Dharma to that merchant, and he saw the truth.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun la mngon @135b par dad pas mu stegs can 'ong na yang sgo gcod do //
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun la mngon @135b par dad pas mu stegs can 'ong na yang sgo gcod do //
translated: He had great faith in the community of monks, so when the tīrthikas came he closed the door.

original: sh'akya'i dge slong dang / dge sbyong dag 'ong na nang du bos te ci 'dod pa byin zhing rgyun du sbyin gtong la zhugs te /
analyzed: sh'akya'i dge slong dang / dge sbyong dag 'ong na nang du bos te ci 'dod pa byin zhing rgyun du sbyin gtong la zhugs te /
translated: When the Śākya monks and ascetics came, he invited them inside and gave them whatever they needed. He constantly engaged in giving and🔽abandoned farming work such as trade and cultivation.

original: tshong dang zhig gi las la sogs pa so nam ni btang bas na khyim bdag de yang longs spyod 'gribs te dbul por gyur to //
analyzed: tshong dang zhig gi las la sogs pa so nam ni btang bas na khyim bdag de yang longs spyod 'gribs te dbul por gyur to //
translated: So that householder's wealth diminished and he became poor.

original: de nas dus phyi zhig na sh'akya'i mi rnams phongs na spyod pa la zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas dus phyi zhig na sh'akya'i mi rnams phongs na spyod pa la zhugs te /
translated: Then at a later time, when the Śākya people were in distress, they engaged in commerce.

original: ded dpon seng ge 'di ni sngon chad mu stegs can la dad pa'i tshe na ni phyug cing nor dang ldan /
analyzed: ded dpon seng ge 'di ni sngon chad mu stegs can la dad pa'i tshe na ni phyug cing nor dang ldan /
translated: The heretics said, This captain Siṅgha was formerly rich and had much wealth when he believed in the heretics.

original: da ni chos la dad par gyur nas dbul por gyur to zhes mu stegs can dag 'phya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: da ni chos la dad par gyur nas dbul por gyur to zhes mu stegs can dag 'phya'o zhes bcom ldan 'das kyi snyan du bdas nas /
translated: Now that he has become a believer in the Dharma, he has become poor, and they reviled him.

original: de nyid nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa phyin chad khyim bdag dad pa bden pa mthong ba de'i khyim du 'gro bar mi bya /
analyzed: de nyid nyes pa'i dmigs su gyur nas dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa phyin chad khyim bdag dad pa bden pa mthong ba de'i khyim du 'gro bar mi bya /
translated: The Buddha heard about this and said to the monks, From now on, do not go to the house of that householder who has seen the truth and has faith.

original: zan mi za bar sngom pa chos shig ces gsungs nas dge 'dun rnams kyis gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las gyis sdom pa bcas so //
analyzed: zan mi za bar sngom pa chos shig ces gsungs nas dge 'dun rnams kyis gsol pa dang zhu ba'i las gyis sdom pa bcas so //
translated: You must observe the vow not to eat food. Then the saṅgha made a vow.

original: sdom pa ma bcas pa'i sngon rol du tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu gnyis ljongs su song ba'i tshe /
analyzed: sdom pa ma bcas pa'i sngon rol du tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bu gnyis ljongs su song ba'i tshe /
translated: Before the vow was made, the venerable Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana went to the countryside.

original: ded dpon seng ges dge slong de gnyis phyin chad pa'i der bshos gsol cig ces spyan drangs so //
analyzed: ded dpon seng ges dge slong de gnyis phyin chad pa'i der bshos gsol cig ces spyan drangs so //
translated: The captain Siṅgha invited those two monks, saying, Please come and eat at my house.

original: sdom pa bcas pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa de gnyis ded dpon seng ge'i gan du 'gro ba drug sdes mthong nas /
analyzed: sdom pa bcas pa'i 'og tu 'phags pa de gnyis ded dpon seng ge'i gan du 'gro ba drug sdes mthong nas /
translated: After they had taken the vow, the group of six saw the two noble ones going to the house of the merchant Siṅgha.

original: 'phags pa gar bzhud ces dris na /
analyzed: 'phags pa gar bzhud ces dris na /
translated: They asked, “Noble ones, where are you going?”

original: der zan la 'gro'o zhes byas so //
analyzed: der zan la 'gro'o zhes byas so //
translated: They replied, “We are going to eat.”

original: de dag na re de'i khyim du mi 'gro bar sdom pa bcas na /
analyzed: de dag na re de'i khyim du mi 'gro bar sdom pa bcas na /
translated: The group of six said, “You took a vow not to go to his house.

original: da der 'gro ba la dbang gnam zhes byas na /
analyzed: da der 'gro ba la dbang gnam zhes byas na /
translated: Now you are going there. Do you have the power to break your vow?”

original: de gnyis na re sangs rgyas la zhus na /
analyzed: de gnyis na re sangs rgyas la zhus na /
translated: The two noble ones said, “If we ask the Buddha,

original: sdom pa ma bcas pa'i sngon rol du bos pas na gnang ngo //
analyzed: sdom pa ma bcas pa'i sngon rol du bos pas na gnang ngo //
translated: he will say that since we were invited before we took the vow, it is all right.”

original: de ltar sngar bos pas gnang na ni ded kyang khyim bdag bden pa mthong ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de ltar sngar bos pas gnang na ni ded kyang khyim bdag bden pa mthong ba'i tshe /
translated: If it is all right to go because we were invited before,🔽then we will go.”🔽The group of six also went there.

original: bos kyis 'gro'o zhes drug sde po yang der dong ba dang / sngar dge slong gnyis kyi zan las ma sbyar ba las drug sdes bsnan pas zan kun gtugs la /
analyzed: bos kyis 'gro'o zhes drug sde po yang der dong ba dang / sngar dge slong gnyis kyi zan las ma sbyar ba las drug sdes bsnan pas zan kun gtugs la /
translated: The group of six added their portion to the food that had already been prepared for the two monks.

original: de'i byis pa rnams zan chad de bkres pas 'phral du sbyin du med pas ngu zhing tsa tsi'i 'don pa las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: de'i byis pa rnams zan chad de bkres pas 'phral du sbyin du med pas ngu zhing tsa tsi'i 'don pa las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The children of that householder were crying from hunger, because he had no food to give them immediately.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas smad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas smad nas /
translated: The Blessed One rebuked him,

original: de ltar dge 'dun gyis sdom pa byin par shes bzhin du song ste zas zos na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: de ltar dge 'dun gyis sdom pa byin par shes bzhin du song ste zas zos na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: and laid down this training rule: “If a nun knows that a householder has given a training-day precept, and she goes to that householder’s house and eats food there, she must acknowledge it: ‘I have done a bad thing in that I have eaten food after going to a householder’s house, knowing that they had given a training-day precept. I confess this bad thing.’”

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos so //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos so //
translated: The Saṅgha is the Tathāgata’s disciples.

original: bslab pa'i khyim zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad /🔽dgra @136a * //🔽bcom pa man chad slob pa'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i khyim zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i rgyun du zhugs pa yan chad / dgra @136a * // bcom pa man chad slob pa'o //
translated: A training-day precept is the training of the noble stream-enterers and so on.🔽A householder is one who has gone forth.

original: khyim zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag dang bram ze'i khyim mo //
analyzed: khyim zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag dang bram ze'i khyim mo //
translated: A house is a house of a householder or a brahmin.

original: bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin par shes zhes bya ba ni gsol ba'i las kyis so //
analyzed: bslab pa'i sdom pa sbyin par shes zhes bya ba ni gsol ba'i las kyis so //
translated: To give a training-day precept is to give it through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: A nun who knows is a nun who knows through her own mind or because it has been told to her.

original: de ltar dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin par shes zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar dge 'dun gyis bslab pa'i sdom pa byin par shes zhes bya ba ni bsgo ba'o //
translated: The phrase knowing that the community has given the precepts of training means the instruction.

original: sngar bos zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu lta bu dag go //
analyzed: sngar bos zhes bya ba ni sh'a ri'i bu lta bu dag go //
translated: The phrase those who have been invited refers to those like Śāriputra.

original: sngar ma bos pa ni drug sde dag gis phyis song ba'o //
analyzed: sngar ma bos pa ni drug sde dag gis phyis song ba'o //
translated: The phrase those who have not been invited refers to the group of six monks who arrived later.

original: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gis len cing za ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi lag gis zhes bya ba ni rang gis len cing za ba'o //
translated: The phrase with their own hands means that they themselves take and eat.

original: phyi rol du kun dgar dengs shig ces bya ba ni gtsug lag khang na dge slong gnas pa dag la mthol bar bya'o //
analyzed: phyi rol du kun dgar dengs shig ces bya ba ni gtsug lag khang na dge slong gnas pa dag la mthol bar bya'o //
translated: The phrase go outside to the feast means that they should confess to the monks who are staying in the monastery.

original: ltung bar 'gyur ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi slob ma'i khyim du gyur pa bslab pa'i sdom pa byin par shes ma thag tu sngar ma pos bar song nas rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang / bza' ba blangs te zos sam 'chos na thams cad du so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ltung bar 'gyur ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi slob ma'i khyim du gyur pa bslab pa'i sdom pa byin par shes ma thag tu sngar ma pos bar song nas rang gi lag gis bca' ba dang / bza' ba blangs te zos sam 'chos na thams cad du so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: The phrase there is an offense means that if a monk who is a disciple of the community of monks goes to the house of a disciple of the community of monks, and knowing that the precepts of training have been given, he eats food that he has taken with his own hands, whether cooked or raw, then in all cases he commits an offense of wrongdoing.

original: sngar mgron du bos pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: sngar mgron du bos pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: This does not apply to those who have been invited.

original: so sor bshags pa bzhi'i gleng gzhi ni grong khyer ser skya'i gnas na ste /
analyzed: so sor bshags pa bzhi'i gleng gzhi ni grong khyer ser skya'i gnas na ste /
translated: In the city of Kapilavastu,

original: de na dgon pa'i lha khang zhig tu sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun dag dbyar tshul du zhugs nas /
analyzed: de na dgon pa'i lha khang zhig tu sangs rgyas dang dge 'dun dag dbyar tshul du zhugs nas /
translated: in a temple in the forest, the Buddha and the Sangha entered the rainy season retreat.

original: dbyar tshul nas byung ba'i tshe sh'akya dag bcom ldan 'das la chos nyan du lhags te chos bshad pa na dad pa skyes te sang gi gdugs tshod bdag gis sbyor te gsol na sang gud du mi gshegs par ci gnang zhes gsol na cang mi gsung bas de
analyzed: dbyar tshul nas byung ba'i tshe sh'akya dag bcom ldan 'das la chos nyan du lhags te chos bshad pa na dad pa skyes te sang gi gdugs tshod bdag gis sbyor te gsol na sang gud du mi gshegs par ci gnang zhes gsol na cang mi gsung bas de
translated: When they emerged from the rainy season retreat, the Shakyas came to listen to the Dharma from the Blessed One. When the Dharma was explained, faith arose and they requested, If we prepare tomorrow's meal and offer it, please do not go elsewhere tomorrow. With his silence, he

original: bzhin du gnang ngo //
analyzed: bzhin du gnang ngo //
translated: granted it.

original: de dag gis de'i nub mo khyim zas zhim dgu sbyar te /
analyzed: de dag gis de'i nub mo khyim zas zhim dgu sbyar te /
translated: They prepared delicious food in their homes that evening.

original: nang par shing rta bkang nas bud med dag mdun du btang ba dang lam du rkun po dag gis bcom nas /
analyzed: nang par shing rta bkang nas bud med dag mdun du btang ba dang lam du rkun po dag gis bcom nas /
translated: In the morning, they loaded it in carts and sent the women ahead. On the road, they were robbed by thieves.

original: zas ni ma phrogs kyis bud med kyi gos dang rgyan dag phrogs pa dang / bud med dag gis phyir khyim bdag sbran te /
analyzed: zas ni ma phrogs kyis bud med kyi gos dang rgyan dag phrogs pa dang / bud med dag gis phyir khyim bdag sbran te /
translated: The thieves did not steal the food, but they stole the women's clothes and ornaments. The women returned and informed the householders.

original: skyes pa dag ni mi rgod snyegs su dong ngo //
analyzed: skyes pa dag ni mi rgod snyegs su dong ngo //
translated: The men went off in pursuit of the brigands.🔽The women hid in the forest.

original: bud med dag ni shing khrod na gab cing 'khod zas dang skom ni shing rta bkang sta la mkhan bzhag go //
analyzed: bud med dag ni shing khrod na gab cing 'khod zas dang skom ni shing rta bkang sta la mkhan bzhag go //
translated: The food and drink were loaded on a cart and left there.

original: de nas drug sde rnams kyis bsams pa sh'akya dag lta phyug pas /
analyzed: de nas drug sde rnams kyis bsams pa sh'akya dag lta phyug pas /
translated: Then the group of six thought, “The Śākyas are rich.

original: de tsam ston mos ra ro bar 'khod kyis /
analyzed: de tsam ston mos ra ro bar 'khod kyis /
translated: They will be drunk on the feast.🔽They will forget about us. Let’s go for alms.”

original: 'u bu lta brjed kyis bdag cag bsod snyoms la dong zhes nas dong ba dang / lam kha na shing rta zas kyis bkang bdag mthong nas bud med dag kyang btsal te rnyed pas /
analyzed: 'u bu lta brjed kyis bdag cag bsod snyoms la dong zhes nas dong ba dang / lam kha na shing rta zas kyis bkang bdag mthong nas bud med dag kyang btsal te rnyed pas /
translated: They went off, and on the road they saw a cart loaded with food. They looked for the women and found them.🔽They forced them to come along, naked, and made them distribute the food.

original: nan gyis ma dang bzhin du bkug nas gcer bur zas 'drim du bcug cing de dag gis kyang kha ngan gyis 'phyas @136b 'dogs shing zan zos nas phyir lha khang du song ngo //
analyzed: nan gyis ma dang bzhin du bkug nas gcer bur zas 'drim du bcug cing de dag gis kyang kha ngan gyis 'phyas @136b 'dogs shing zan zos nas phyir lha khang du song ngo //
translated: The women cursed them and ate the food. Then they went back to the temple.

original: de nas phyis mi rgod dag zin nas mi rgod ni slar btang ste /
analyzed: de nas phyis mi rgod dag zin nas mi rgod ni slar btang ste /
translated: Later, the brigands were caught. The brigands were released,

original: sh'akya rnams lha khang du lhags nas zan 'drim pa la zhugs pa dang / bud med dag drug sde rnams la mi 'drim nas /
analyzed: sh'akya rnams lha khang du lhags nas zan 'drim pa la zhugs pa dang / bud med dag drug sde rnams la mi 'drim nas /
translated: The women did not distribute to the group of six.

original: ci'i phyir de dag la mi 'drim zhes khyim thab dag gis byas na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag la mi 'drim zhes khyim thab dag gis byas na /
translated: The husbands asked, “Why don’t you distribute to them?”

original: de dag gis da ci yang zos zin pa'i steng du nged la mi snyan pa zer gyis mi 'drim mo zhes 'drim du ma btub po //
analyzed: de dag gis da ci yang zos zin pa'i steng du nged la mi snyan pa zer gyis mi 'drim mo zhes 'drim du ma btub po //
translated: “They have already eaten and they say bad things about us. We won’t distribute to them.”

original: de nas gzhan dag gis dris na zos pa bden no zhes khas blangs so //
analyzed: de nas gzhan dag gis dris na zos pa bden no zhes khas blangs so //
translated: Later, when others asked, they admitted that they had eaten.

original: de nas dge slong dag na re de ltar bu'i 'jigs pa na /
analyzed: de nas dge slong dag na re de ltar bu'i 'jigs pa na /
translated: Then the monks said, “When there is such danger,

original: dge slong zan za ba'i mi rigs so //
analyzed: dge slong zan za ba'i mi rigs so //
translated: it is not right for monks to eat.”

original: zhes ma dad pas na /
analyzed: zhes ma dad pas na /
translated: The non-believers said,

original: phyin chad de lta bu'i 'jigs pa na zan za na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro zhes bcas so //
analyzed: phyin chad de lta bu'i 'jigs pa na zan za na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro zhes bcas so //
translated: “From now on, if you eat when there is such danger, you will be confessing an offense.”

original: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos so //
analyzed: dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos so //
translated: “Saṅgha” means the disciples of the Tathāgata.

original: dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags gcig ste /
analyzed: dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni gzhu lnga brgya la rgyang grags gcig ste /
translated: “A wilderness dwelling” is an area beyond the range of a bow shot of five hundred.

original: de tsam gyis na grong nas de phan chad ni dgon pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na grong nas de phan chad ni dgon pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The place beyond that is called a forest.

original: de na gtsug lag khang ci yod pa ni dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya'o //🔽dogs pa dang bcas par shes zhes bya ba ni rkun po dang g-yon can yod par shes pa'o //🔽'jigs pa dang bcas par shes zhes bya ba ni seng ge dang stag gzig yod par shes so //
analyzed: de na gtsug lag khang ci yod pa ni dgon pa'i gnas zhes bya'o // dogs pa dang bcas par shes zhes bya ba ni rkun po dang g-yon can yod par shes pa'o // 'jigs pa dang bcas par shes zhes bya ba ni seng ge dang stag gzig yod par shes so //
translated: Whatever monastery is there is called a forest dwelling.🔽One should know that it is dangerous means that one should know that there are thieves and rogues there.🔽One should know that it is fearful means that one should know that there are lions, tigers, and leopards there.

original: 'jigs shing nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang rlung dang sbrul dag gis reg pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs shing nyam nga ba zhes bya ba ni sha sbrang dang / sbrang bu mchu rings dang rlung dang sbrul dag gis reg pa'o //
translated: One should know that it is frightening and terrifying means that one should know that there are mosquitoes, gadflies, wind, and snakes there.

original: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste /🔽gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: yang dge slong gang zhes bya ba ni drug sde ste / gzhan yang de dang 'dra ba'o //
translated: As for if a monk, it refers to the group of six monks, and so on.

original: nags ma brtags zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis nags rtogs par byed pa'i dge slong zhig skos shig ces byung ba las /
analyzed: nags ma brtags zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis nags rtogs par byed pa'i dge slong zhig skos shig ces byung ba las /
translated: As for a forest that has not been inspected, it means that a monk who inspects the forest by means of the procedure of announcement and the procedure of asking for permission should be appointed.

original: nags rtog pa'i dge slong des kyang brtags na ni nyes pa med kyis ma brtags na nyes par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nags rtog pa'i dge slong des kyang brtags na ni nyes pa med kyis ma brtags na nyes par rig par bya'o //
translated: If the monk in the forest examines, there is no offense. If he does not examine, he should understand that there is an offense.

original: kun dga'i phyi rol zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol to //
analyzed: kun dga'i phyi rol zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang gi phyi rol to //
translated: “Outside the monastery” means outside the temple.

original: bza' ba dang bca' ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bza' ba dang bca' ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “Food and drink”

original: bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: bza' ba lnga dang bca' ba lnga la bya'o //
translated: refers to the five foods and the five drinks.

original: blangs zhes bya ba ni byin len byas pa'o //
analyzed: blangs zhes bya ba ni byin len byas pa'o //
translated: “Taken” means that the food has been received.

original: zos pa zhes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
analyzed: zos pa zhes bya ba ni mgrin par mid pa'o //
translated: “Consumed” means that it has been swallowed.

original: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong des zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang yin pa'o //
translated: “That monk” refers to the monk who has eaten.

original: dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la zhes bya ba ni dge slong gang 'khod pa'o //
translated: “The monks” refers to the monks who are present.

original: so sor bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mthol bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: so sor bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni mthol bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Confess individually” means to confess one by one.

original: smad pa'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs mi tshul ba'o //
analyzed: smad pa'i gnas su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs mi tshul ba'o //
translated: “A basis for criticism” means that it is improper and inappropriate.

original: nyes pa ni dge slong nags ma brtags par 'du shes bzhin du kun @137a * //
analyzed: nyes pa ni dge slong nags ma brtags par 'du shes bzhin du kun @137a * //
translated: The offense for the monk in the forest is that, without examining the food, he eats it with the perception that it is permissible.

original: dga'i phyi rol du bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs te 'chos sam zos na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dga'i phyi rol du bca' ba dang bza' ba blangs te 'chos sam zos na so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he takes food or drink outside of the proper time and then eats or drinks it, he commits an offense that is to be acknowledged individually.

original: ma brtags par the tshom na yang so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma brtags par the tshom na yang so sor bshags par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he is unsure whether he has examined it, he commits an offense that is to be acknowledged individually.

original: brtags pa la ma brtags par 'du shes sam /
analyzed: brtags pa la ma brtags par 'du shes sam /
translated: If he has examined it, but perceives that he has not,

original: the tshom na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: the tshom na yang nyes byas su 'gyur ro //
translated: or if he is unsure of this, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: nags rtog par byed pa de shi'am bros na ltung ba med do //
analyzed: nags rtog par byed pa de shi'am bros na ltung ba med do //
translated: If the person who is examining the forest dies or flees, there is no offense.

original: so sor bshags pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa lnga las so sor bshags pa mi brjed pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: so sor bshags pa'i mdo 'don pa rnam pa lnga las so sor bshags pa mi brjed pa'i tshig go /
translated: This is the rule for acknowledging individual offenses, the fifth of the rules for settling legal issues.

original: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo'i don pa lnga pa las brtsams te tshe dang ldan pa dag bsrab pa mang po chos 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i mdo'i don pa lnga pa las brtsams te tshe dang ldan pa dag bsrab pa mang po chos 'di dag ni zla ba phyed phyed cing so sor thar pa'i mdo 'don pa las 'byung ngo zhes bya ba smras so //
translated: “Venerables, the many minor rules that are recited every half-month in the Monastic Code are now recited.

original: bslab pa mang po zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis yang dag par bslab cing 'dul ba phran tshegs la sogs te /
analyzed: bslab pa mang po zhes bya ba ni dge slong gis yang dag par bslab cing 'dul ba phran tshegs la sogs te /
translated: The many minor rules are the minor rules that a monk should train in and follow.

original: bslab pa'i gnas thams cad nas 'byung ba'i nyes byas thams cad kyang bslab pa 'di nyid du bsdu bar lta zhing grangs gcig tu ma chad pa'i phyir bslab pa mang po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gnas thams cad nas 'byung ba'i nyes byas thams cad kyang bslab pa 'di nyid du bsdu bar lta zhing grangs gcig tu ma chad pa'i phyir bslab pa mang po zhes bya'o //
translated: Since all the faults of all the trainings are included in this training, it is called the many trainings, because they are not counted as separate.

original: dge slong gis glu gar rol mo mi bya ba dang brdung bar mi spyad pa dang mtshal mi nyug pa dang / rgyan gyis lus la mi klub pa dang / skra so mangs kyi sa bshad par mi bya ba dang / me long la sogs pa la gdong mi lta ba dang /
analyzed: dge slong gis glu gar rol mo mi bya ba dang brdung bar mi spyad pa dang mtshal mi nyug pa dang / rgyan gyis lus la mi klub pa dang / skra so mangs kyi sa bshad par mi bya ba dang / me long la sogs pa la gdong mi lta ba dang /
translated: Bhiksus should not sing, dance, or play music, should not beat drums, should not apply red dye, should not adorn their bodies with ornaments, should not shave their pubic hair, should not look at their faces in mirrors,

original: 'thab mo'i nang du 'gro zhing 'dug par mi bya ba dang / rtsed mo sna tshogs kyi nang du mi bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'thab mo'i nang du 'gro zhing 'dug par mi bya ba dang / rtsed mo sna tshogs kyi nang du mi bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: should not go to or stay in places of fighting, should not engage in various games and so on.

original: 'dul ba phran tshegs dang gzhung bla ma dag las 'byung ba'i bslab pa rnams kyang dge slong gis phyi phyir bslab cing bsrung ba yin mod kyi 'dir ma smos kyi /
analyzed: 'dul ba phran tshegs dang gzhung bla ma dag las 'byung ba'i bslab pa rnams kyang dge slong gis phyi phyir bslab cing bsrung ba yin mod kyi 'dir ma smos kyi /
translated: Although the trainings that arise in the Ksudraka Collection and the Higher Teaching are also to be trained in and guarded by bhiksus, they are not mentioned here.

original: gzhan nas 'byung bar rig par gyis shig 'dir ni re zhig sham thabs dang / chos gos ji ltar bgo ba dang / grong du ji ltar 'jug cing khyim du 'dug par bya ba dang / bsod snyoms bslangs pa dang / bza' ba dang / chos 'chad cing bstan pa'i thabs dang /
analyzed: gzhan nas 'byung bar rig par gyis shig 'dir ni re zhig sham thabs dang / chos gos ji ltar bgo ba dang / grong du ji ltar 'jug cing khyim du 'dug par bya ba dang / bsod snyoms bslangs pa dang / bza' ba dang / chos 'chad cing bstan pa'i thabs dang /
translated: You should know that the other [rules] are found elsewhere.🔽Here, I will briefly collect a few of the immediate trainings, such as how to wear the lower and upper robes, how to enter a village and sit in a house, how to beg for alms, how to eat, how to teach the Dharma and the methods of instruction,

original: bshang gci bab bab tu mi bya ba la sogs pa 'phral gyi bslab pa la sogs pa nyung shas shig bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: bshang gci bab bab tu mi bya ba la sogs pa 'phral gyi bslab pa la sogs pa nyung shas shig bsdu ba'o //
translated: and how not to defecate or urinate while standing, and so on.

original: sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bya zhes bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das grong khyer khor mo 'jig gi drang srong gi gnas ri dags rgyu ba na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sham thabs zlum por bgo bar bya zhes bya ba'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das grong khyer khor mo 'jig gi drang srong gi gnas ri dags rgyu ba na bzhugs so //
translated: The basis for the statement The lower robe should be worn evenly is that the Blessed One was dwelling in the sage's abode of Rājagṛha in Mṛgāramātṛvihāra.

original: nam bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong lnga po rnams skyon med de rab tu phyung nas dngos por byas pa de na de dag kyang sngon goms pa'i tshul du khyim pa bzhin du gyon pa bram ze dang khyim @137b bdag gis mthong nas 'phags pa dag de lta
