translated: “You should not go to town with your head covered,” the Blessed One decreed.🔽“You should not go to a layperson’s house with your lower robe hiked up,” the Blessed One decreed.

original: mi brdze ba zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams sham thabs brdzes te khyim du 'dong ba dang / khyim bdag rnams kyis 'phags pa dag skyes pa bshang gci bya ba'am /🔽'dam rdza ba dang chu yod na de ltar bya'i de lta bu med pa la ni mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /🔽mi brdze bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: mi brdze ba zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams sham thabs brdzes te khyim du 'dong ba dang / khyim bdag rnams kyis 'phags pa dag skyes pa bshang gci bya ba'am / 'dam rdza ba dang chu yod na de ltar bya'i de lta bu med pa la ni mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas / mi brdze bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One decreed this training rule: “You should not go to a layperson’s house with your lower robe hiked up.”🔽“You should not go to a layperson’s house with your robes hiked up,” the Blessed One decreed.

original: gos mi gzar bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams chos gos gyon pa slar gzar te dang ba las /🔽khyim bdag na re rgyan po pa dang / nal gyi bu dag ni de ltar 'dong gis 'phags pa dag ci'i phyir de ltar dong zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: gos mi gzar bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams chos gos gyon pa slar gzar te dang ba las /🔽khyim bdag na re rgyan po pa dang / nal gyi bu dag ni de ltar 'dong gis 'phags pa dag ci'i phyir de ltar dong zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas /
translated: The Blessed One decreed this training rule: “You should not go to a layperson’s house with your robes hiked up.”

original: chos gos mi gzar bar khyim du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: chos gos mi gzar bar khyim du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: Do not enter a house with the upper robe unevenly arranged.🔽The group of six monks entered the village with their robes unevenly arranged.

original: chos gos gnya' gang du bsnol zhing 'gro ba ni drug sde rnams chos gos bgos nas gnya' gang du bsnol nas grong du dong ba dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
analyzed: chos gos gnya' gang du bsnol zhing 'gro ba ni drug sde rnams chos gos bgos nas gnya' gang du bsnol nas grong du dong ba dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
translated: Brahmins and householders ridiculed them,

original: 'phags pa dva dang nal gyi bu dag ni de bzhin dong ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dva dang nal gyi bu dag ni de bzhin dong ste /
translated: “Noble ones, the sons of the Śākya are going like this.🔽This is not right.”

original: de lta bu mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: de lta bu mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: They were scolded and criticized.

original: gnya' gong du bsnol te grong du mi 'gro bar bya'o zhes bcas so //
analyzed: gnya' gong du bsnol te grong du mi 'gro bar bya'o zhes bcas so //
translated: “Do not enter a village with the upper robe unevenly arranged.”🔽Do not enter a village with the upper robe unevenly arranged on both shoulders.

original: phrag pa gnyis kar mi gzar bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams gos phrag pa gnyis ka la gzar nas 'gro ba las khyim bdag rnams na re /
analyzed: phrag pa gnyis kar mi gzar bar 'gro zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams gos phrag pa gnyis ka la gzar nas 'gro ba las khyim bdag rnams na re /
translated: The group of six monks entered the village with their robes unevenly arranged on both shoulders.

original: 'phags pa dag g-yog byed pa ni de ltar byed de de lta bu mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas phrag pa gnyis ka la mi gzar bar grong du 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag g-yog byed pa ni de ltar byed de de lta bu mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas nas phrag pa gnyis ka la mi gzar bar grong du 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The noble ones serve as attendants in this way. It is not right to do it like that. They were embarrassed by the criticism and the rule was laid down: One should not walk in the village with both shoulders covered. One should train in this way.

original: brang bas 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams rkang pa'i brang bas khyim du dong ba dang / khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
analyzed: brang bas 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams rkang pa'i brang bas khyim du dong ba dang / khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
translated: Not walking with the soles of the feet turned up means the group of six went to the houses with the soles of their feet turned up, and the householders criticized them.

original: 'phags pa byis pa chung du shing la rtse ba dang / rkang pa'i mthil sa pa rnams ni de ltar 'gro ste /🔽de lta bu ni mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa byis pa chung du shing la rtse ba dang / rkang pa'i mthil sa pa rnams ni de ltar 'gro ste / de lta bu ni mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The noble ones walk like this: Children playing in the dirt and those with the soles of their feet on the ground walk like that.

original: brang bas grong du mi 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: brang bas grong du mi 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: It is not right to do it like that. They were embarrassed by the criticism and the rule was laid down: One should not walk in the village with the soles of the feet turned up. One should train in this way.

original: 'jal thabs su 'gro bar mi bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams gom pa 'jal thabs su grong du dong ba la /
analyzed: 'jal thabs su 'gro bar mi bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams gom pa 'jal thabs su grong du dong ba la /
translated: Not walking with the soles of the feet turned out means the group of six went to the village with the soles of their feet turned out.

original: khyim @139b bdag dag 'phya ste de lta bu ni 'jig rten na bzo bo dang / phya mkhan rnams de ltar byed de de ltar ma bzhud cig ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: khyim @139b bdag dag 'phya ste de lta bu ni 'jig rten na bzo bo dang / phya mkhan rnams de ltar byed de de ltar ma bzhud cig ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The householders ridiculed them, saying, In the world, artisans and weavers do this. Do not go like that!🔽They were ridiculed, and so they went to the Buddha and he said, You should not go to the village in a manner of measuring the distance by stretching out your legs while walking.

original: grong du gom pa brkyang zhing 'jal thabs su 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //🔽mi mchod par 'gro bar bya ba ni drug sde rnams shing thags de dag la mchod zhing dong bas bram ze dang khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /🔽'phags pa dag 'jigs shing skrag pa ni de ltar dong ste /🔽de lta bu mi rigs kyis de ltar ma byed cig ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: grong du gom pa brkyang zhing 'jal thabs su 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so // mi mchod par 'gro bar bya ba ni drug sde rnams shing thags de dag la mchod zhing dong bas bram ze dang khyim bdag dag 'phya ste / 'phags pa dag 'jigs shing skrag pa ni de ltar dong ste / de lta bu mi rigs kyis de ltar ma byed cig ces 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The Buddha said, You should not go to the village without paying homage to the trees.🔽The Buddha said, You should not go to the village without paying homage to the trees.🔽The Buddha said, You should not go to the village without paying homage to the trees.

original: khyim bdag 'phya ba yus kyi gong bu dang / shing thags la mchong zhing ma 'gro bar lam du deng la mi mchong bar grong du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: khyim bdag 'phya ba yus kyi gong bu dang / shing thags la mchong zhing ma 'gro bar lam du deng la mi mchong bar grong du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Buddha said, You should not go to the village without paying homage to the trees.

original: tsog phur ma yin zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams tsog pur 'dong pas /
analyzed: tsog phur ma yin zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams tsog pur 'dong pas /
translated: Sitting like a butcher means that the group of six went sitting like butchers.

original: khyim bdag dag 'phya ste de lta bu ni rgan po dang rkang nad can dang / byis pa chung ngu rnams 'gro mi nus pa ni de bzhin du 'gro ste /
analyzed: khyim bdag dag 'phya ste de lta bu ni rgan po dang rkang nad can dang / byis pa chung ngu rnams 'gro mi nus pa ni de bzhin du 'gro ste /
translated: The householders ridiculed them, saying, This is how old people, those with leg pain, and small children who cannot walk go.

original: 'phags pa dag de lta bu ni mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag de lta bu ni mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: Noble ones, this is not appropriate. Because they were ridiculed, they were shamed.

original: tsog pur 'gro zhing grong du mi 'dong bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: tsog pur 'gro zhing grong du mi 'dong bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: One should train in not going to the village sitting like a butcher.

original: dkur mi brten par 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams dkur brten zhing 'gro ba dang khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
analyzed: dkur mi brten par 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams dkur brten zhing 'gro ba dang khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
translated: One should not go leaning on the hip means that the group of six went leaning on the hip, and the householders ridiculed them.

original: tshong dpon dang ded dpon dag ni de ltar 'gro ste /
analyzed: tshong dpon dang ded dpon dag ni de ltar 'gro ste /
translated: Merchants and caravan leaders go like this.

original: 'phags pa rnams de ltar 'gro ba mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams de ltar 'gro ba mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: Noble ones, it is not appropriate for you to go like this. Because they were ridiculed, they were shamed.

original: dkur mi brten par grong du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: dkur mi brten par grong du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: One should train in not going to the village leaning on the hip.

original: lus mi bsgyur bar 'gro bar bya ba ni drug sde rnams lus bsgyur zhing grong du dong ba dang / dad pa'i khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
analyzed: lus mi bsgyur bar 'gro bar bya ba ni drug sde rnams lus bsgyur zhing grong du dong ba dang / dad pa'i khyim bdag dag 'phya ste /
translated: The faithful householders ridiculed them,

original: 'phags pa dag gzugs kyis 'tsho ba dang / bal glang mo dag de ltar dong ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag gzugs kyis 'tsho ba dang / bal glang mo dag de ltar dong ste /
translated: “Noble ones, you live off your bodies, like female elephants.

original: de lta bu mi rigs so zhes zer ba las snyan du bangs te /
analyzed: de lta bu mi rigs so zhes zer ba las snyan du bangs te /
translated: It is not right to walk like that.”

original: lus mi bsgyur bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: lus mi bsgyur bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: They were shamed and complained to the Blessed One, who decreed, “You should walk to the houses of laypeople with your bodies straight.”🔽One should not walk with one’s hands on one’s hips.

original: lag pa mo kyog par 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams lag pa 'khyugs ka byed cing grong du dong bas khyim bdag dag 'phya bar gyur te /
analyzed: lag pa mo kyog par 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams lag pa 'khyugs ka byed cing grong du dong bas khyim bdag dag 'phya bar gyur te /
translated: The group of six walked to town with their hands on their hips. The householders ridiculed them,

original: 'phags pa dag byis pa chung ngu dang / dva dang smyon pa rnams ni de ltar dong ste /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag byis pa chung ngu dang / dva dang smyon pa rnams ni de ltar dong ste /
translated: “Noble ones, children, eunuchs, and madmen walk like that.

original: mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: mi rigs so zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: It is not right.”🔽They were shamed and complained to the Blessed One, who decreed, “You should not walk with your hands on your hips.”

original: lag pa'i 'khyugs ka mi bya bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bcas so //
analyzed: lag pa'i 'khyugs ka mi bya bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bcas so //
translated: One should not go to the house of a layperson with one’s arms swinging.

original: mgo mi bsgyur bar 'gro @140a * //
analyzed: mgo mi bsgyur bar 'gro @140a * //
translated: One should not go with one’s head turned around.

original: bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams mgo bsgyur zhing grong du dong ba las khyim pa dag 'phya ste /
analyzed: bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams mgo bsgyur zhing grong du dong ba las khyim pa dag 'phya ste /
translated: The group of six went to town with their heads turned around.

original: 'phags pa dag glang po che dang / rtsangs pa dag ni de ltar 'gro zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: 'phags pa dag glang po che dang / rtsangs pa dag ni de ltar 'gro zhes 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: Householders ridiculed them, saying, “Noble ones, elephants and lizards go like that.”🔽They were ridiculed and reviled.

original: mgo mi bsgyur bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: mgo mi bsgyur bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: “One should not go to the house of a layperson with one’s head turned around.”🔽One should not go with one’s shoulders hunched up.🔽The group of six went to town.

original: phrag pa mi sprad par 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams grong du dong ba dang / de na mi zhig spos kyis bskus me tog gis btags te /
analyzed: phrag pa mi sprad par 'gro'o zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams grong du dong ba dang / de na mi zhig spos kyis bskus me tog gis btags te /
translated: A man was going along anointed with perfume and wearing a garland of flowers.

original: 'gro ba drug sde dag gis mthong nas dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo bskran pa 'di mi dga' bar bya'o zhes nas phrag pa sprad de phul bas de yang sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug sde dag gis mthong nas dga' bo dang bsnyen dga' bo bskran pa 'di mi dga' bar bya'o zhes nas phrag pa sprad de phul bas de yang sa la 'gyel to //
translated: The group of six saw him and said, “Let’s scare Nanda and Upananda.” They bumped shoulders and knocked him to the ground.

original: de mi snyan par 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /🔽khyim pa 'phya ba ni rigs par 'phyas pas /
analyzed: de mi snyan par 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te / khyim pa 'phya ba ni rigs par 'phyas pas /
translated: They are like a snake that has shed its skin.

original: phrag pa sprad cing khyim pa'i khyim du mi 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: phrag pa sprad cing khyim pa'i khyim du mi 'gro bar bslab par bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: ” The Buddha heard the criticism of the householder and laid down a rule of training, saying, “You should not go to the house of a householder with shoulders touching and arms interlocked.”🔽“You should not go with arms interlocked” means: The group of six went to a village. A man who was adorned with flowers and incense came along, showing off to the world.

original: lag pa mi sprel bar 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams grong du dong ba dang / skyes pa zhig me tog dang / spos kyis brgyan nas 'jig rten la ngom bzhin du 'ong ba dang / drug sde dag gis mthong nas de mi dga' bar bya'o zhes nas /
analyzed: lag pa mi sprel bar 'gro bar bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams grong du dong ba dang / skyes pa zhig me tog dang / spos kyis brgyan nas 'jig rten la ngom bzhin du 'ong ba dang / drug sde dag gis mthong nas de mi dga' bar bya'o zhes nas /
translated: The group of six saw him and said, “Let’s make him unhappy.”

original: de dag lag ba sprel te phul ba dang sa la 'gyel to //
analyzed: de dag lag ba sprel te phul ba dang sa la 'gyel to //
translated: They interlocked arms and pushed him. He fell to the ground.

original: de yang bdag gis nongs pa ci bgyis zhes smod pa las snyan du bdas nas /🔽khyim pa 'phya ba ni yus te /
analyzed: de yang bdag gis nongs pa ci bgyis zhes smod pa las snyan du bdas nas / khyim pa 'phya ba ni yus te /
translated: He criticized them, saying, “What have I done wrong?”

original: lag pa sprel bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: lag pa sprel bar khyim pa'i khyim du 'gro bar mi bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: The Buddha heard the criticism of the householder and laid down a rule of training, saying, “You should not go to the house of a householder with arms interlocked.”

original: ma bsgo bar khyim pa'i stan la mi 'dug ces bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na bram ze zhig gtsang sbra la dga' ste /
analyzed: ma bsgo bar khyim pa'i stan la mi 'dug ces bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na bram ze zhig gtsang sbra la dga' ste /
translated: The rule not to sit on a householder's seat without permission was given in Śrāvastī. A certain brahmin was fond of cleanliness.

original: mal sgo khang du bcas nas der bu mo zhig bsrang yab thogs te /🔽sbrang ma skrod du bcug pa dang bsnyen dga' bo bsod snyoms la bram ze de'i mal sgor 'ongs te bu mo song ste /
analyzed: mal sgo khang du bcas nas der bu mo zhig bsrang yab thogs te / sbrang ma skrod du bcug pa dang bsnyen dga' bo bsod snyoms la bram ze de'i mal sgor 'ongs te bu mo song ste /
translated: He made a bed with a door and had a girl sit there with a fly whisk.🔽He told her, Drive away the flies. Upāli came to the door of that brahmin's house while collecting alms. The girl went and told the brahmin, Upāli is at the door. Please tell him to come in.

original: bram ze la bsnyen dga' bo sgo na 'dug gi sbron cig ces bsgo ba dang / bdag ni sbrang ma skrod pas mi mchi'o zhes smras pa dang / ngas skad cig bsrung gis song shig ces nas de song ba dang / bsnyen dga' bos rkang pa de'i mal gyi steng du bzhag ste 'dug go //
analyzed: bram ze la bsnyen dga' bo sgo na 'dug gi sbron cig ces bsgo ba dang / bdag ni sbrang ma skrod pas mi mchi'o zhes smras pa dang / ngas skad cig bsrung gis song shig ces nas de song ba dang / bsnyen dga' bos rkang pa de'i mal gyi steng du bzhag ste 'dug go //
translated: The brahmin said, I cannot go because I am driving away flies. Upāli said, I will protect you for a moment. Go. He went.

original: bram ze yang nang nas byung ste 'ongs pa dang / des rkang pa bzhag pa mthong nas de na re 'phags pa bdag ni gtsang sbra la dga' ba lags te /
analyzed: bram ze yang nang nas byung ste 'ongs pa dang / des rkang pa bzhag pa mthong nas de na re 'phags pa bdag ni gtsang sbra la dga' ba lags te /
translated: Upāli put his foot on the bed and sat down. The brahmin came out and saw the foot. He said, Noble one, I am fond of cleanliness.

original: ci'i phyir lhag ma dang bcas par nga'i mal na 'dug ces 'phya zhing smod pa las snyan du bdas te 'phya ba ni rigs par 'phyas pas /
analyzed: ci'i phyir lhag ma dang bcas par nga'i mal na 'dug ces 'phya zhing smod pa las snyan du bdas te 'phya ba ni rigs par 'phyas pas /
translated: Why do you sit on my bed with your leftovers?”

original: da phyin chad khyim pas ma bsgo bar stan la mi 'dug par bya'o @140b zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: da phyin chad khyim pas ma bsgo bar stan la mi 'dug par bya'o @140b zhes bslab pa bcas so //
translated: “From now on, I will not sit on a seat without the permission of the householder.”🔽“You should not sit down without checking the seat.”

original: stan la ma brtags par 'dug par mi bya zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na 'char ka skabs skabs su gtum mo'i gnas der chos 'chad cing 'gro'o //
analyzed: stan la ma brtags par 'dug par mi bya zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na 'char ka skabs skabs su gtum mo'i gnas der chos 'chad cing 'gro'o //
translated: Udayī sometimes went to the place of Caṇḍā to teach the Dharma.

original: phyi zhig na gtum mo la bu gcig btsas te /
analyzed: phyi zhig na gtum mo la bu gcig btsas te /
translated: Later, Caṇḍā gave birth to a son.

original: de'i tshe ring bar 'dug pa'i phyir ras dkar pos g-yogs te /
analyzed: de'i tshe ring bar 'dug pa'i phyir ras dkar pos g-yogs te /
translated: Because he was a long-lived child, he was wrapped in white cloth

original: drang srong gi stan la bzhag pa dang / phis 'char ka 'ongs te /
analyzed: drang srong gi stan la bzhag pa dang / phis 'char ka 'ongs te /
translated: and placed on the sage’s seat. Later, Udayī came and

original: stan la ma brtags par 'dug pas bu de dus las 'das so //
analyzed: stan la ma brtags par 'dug pas bu de dus las 'das so //
translated: sat down without checking the seat. The child died.

original: de dag mya ngan byed cing mi snyan par zer ba snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: de dag mya ngan byed cing mi snyan par zer ba snyan du bdas te /
translated: They were miserable and said unpleasant things to Udayī.

original: khyim pa'i stan la ma brtags par 'dug tu mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: khyim pa'i stan la ma brtags par 'dug tu mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: It is not permitted to sit down without examining the seat of a layperson.🔽One should not sit down with the weight of the whole body.

original: lus thams cad kyi lcid kyis phab ste 'dug par mi bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub nas ser skya'i gnas na /
analyzed: lus thams cad kyi lcid kyis phab ste 'dug par mi bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das mngon par byang chub nas ser skya'i gnas na /
translated: After the Blessed One attained full enlightenment, he was in Kapilavastu.

original: btsun mo grags 'dzin ma'i der bshos gsol ba'i tshe /
analyzed: btsun mo grags 'dzin ma'i der bshos gsol ba'i tshe /
translated: When he was offered a meal by Queen Yaśodharā,

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas grags 'dzin ma bshos 'drim pa'i rkang pa la rkang pas brdegs te btang ngo //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas grags 'dzin ma bshos 'drim pa'i rkang pa la rkang pas brdegs te btang ngo //
translated: the venerable Udāyī kicked Yaśodharā in the foot with his foot while she was serving the meal.

original: de yang mi dga' ste phyin chad de lta bu mi byed par bya ba'i phyir grags 'dzin mas khri rgyud ma btags pa'i steng gos kyis g-yogs nas bzhag ste /
analyzed: de yang mi dga' ste phyin chad de lta bu mi byed par bya ba'i phyir grags 'dzin mas khri rgyud ma btags pa'i steng gos kyis g-yogs nas bzhag ste /
translated: She was displeased and said, “From now on, do not do that.” In order to prevent that from happening, Yaśodharā had a series of thrones set up, covered them with cloth, and sat down.

original: 'char ba bos shig ces bu mo zhig mngags nas 'char ka yang rnyed pa zhig grub snyam ste myur zhing rengs par 'ongs nas /
analyzed: 'char ba bos shig ces bu mo zhig mngags nas 'char ka yang rnyed pa zhig grub snyam ste myur zhing rengs par 'ongs nas /

translated: The rule to not expose the genitals was laid down because the group of six monks sat in the village with their genitals exposed and naked. Brahmins and householders criticized them, saying, “They are like animals.”

original: legs par zas blang bar bya zhes bya ba ni yul sbal dkar can na rgyal bu rtogs ldan gyis khang bzangs pad mo'i tshon brgya rtsa gcig gis sa gzhi la bris pa zhig brtsigs te /
analyzed: legs par zas blang bar bya zhes bya ba ni yul sbal dkar can na rgyal bu rtogs ldan gyis khang bzangs pad mo'i tshon brgya rtsa gcig gis sa gzhi la bris pa zhig brtsigs te /
translated: The rule to receive food properly was laid down in the country of Paṅkula. Prince Abhāya built a palace with a hundred and one lotus ponds.

analyzed: der dge 'dun rnams bshos la spyan drangs pa dang / rgyal bu nyid ni chos la dad 'khor rnams chos la ma dad pas de dag gis la du 'drim pa'i tshe la du bskyur bas lhung bzed chag ste drug sde rnams kyis de dag mi dga' bar bya'o zhes nas /

original: 'bras dang tshod ma 'drim pa'i tshe lhung bzed gang bas tshod ma de dag sa la bo nas /🔽de dag gis 'phags pa rgyal bu rtogs ldan gyi khang bzangs tshon sna tshogs brgya rtsa gcig gis bris pa ma rung bar gyur to //

original: drug sde rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: drug sde rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The six said,

analyzed: bkren pa khyed kyis ma rung bar sems na /

analyzed: dge 'dun da dag gi lhung bzed ji ltar bya zhes pa las snyan du bdas te /

original: mu dang khad chad du ma yin zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams rtogs ldan gyi khyim du lhung bzed gang bar blangs pas de dag kyang tshod ma gar blugs zhes byas pa dang de nyid du'o zhes byas te blugs pa dang bo nas de dag gis khang

translated: The vegetables were thrown into the bowls, and the bowls were filled to the brim.

original: bzangs ma rung bar byas zhes pa las rtogs ldan dang khyed cag nyid kyang 'di la chags pas na yi dags wa ba can du 'gyur ro zhes byas pa dang / de dag mi dga' zhing 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: bzangs ma rung bar byas zhes pa las rtogs ldan dang khyed cag nyid kyang 'di la chags pas na yi dags wa ba can du 'gyur ro zhes byas pa dang / de dag mi dga' zhing 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: They were displeased and criticized him.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

original: mu dang kha da chad du zas mi blang bar bya zhes bslab pa bcas so //
analyzed: mu dang kha da chad du zas mi blang bar bya zhes bslab pa bcas so //

analyzed: tshod ma dang mnyam par ma yin zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams rtogs ldan gyi khyim du lhags te /

analyzed: de dag gi sngon du tshod ma byin na lhung bzed gang bar blangs so //
translated: If the vegetables were given to them first, they took a full begging bowl.🔽Later, when rice was given, they held out the same bowl and it overflowed.

original: phyis 'bras byin pa yang de nyid du bzed pa dang / ma shong ste bo bas na khang pa ma rung zhes khyim bdag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: phyis 'bras byin pa yang de nyid du bzed pa dang / ma shong ste bo bas na khang pa ma rung zhes khyim bdag 'phya ba las snyan du bdas te /
translated: The householder criticized them, saying, You have ruined the house. They were displeased and criticized him.

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha said,

analyzed: tshod ma dang mnyam par mi blang bar bya'o zhes bslab pa bcas so //

analyzed: phyis ring du song ba dang 'bod cing tshod ma len pas tshod ma snga phyir @142a * //

analyzed: 'phrul bar gyur pa snyan du gsol nas / bka' stsal pa /
translated: The vegetables were distributed unevenly.🔽They reported this to the Blessed One.

original: zas mthar chags su blang bar bya'o zhes bcas so //
analyzed: zas mthar chags su blang bar bya'o zhes bcas so //
translated: The Blessed One said, One should take food in sequence.

analyzed: lhung bzed blta zhing bza' bar bya zhes bya ba ni mnyan du yod pa na /

analyzed: khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas 'khor dang bcas pa bshos la spyan drangs te /

original: yon bdag gis khur ba 'drim pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yon bdag gis khur ba 'drim pa'i tshe /
translated: When the householder distributed the pastries,🔽he said, “Noble ones, please take a lot of pastries because you have eaten delicious food.”

original: 'phags pa dag zhal zas zhim po gsol gyis phye mang du ma len cig ces byas pa dang / drug sdes phye mang du blangs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa dag zhal zas zhim po gsol gyis phye mang du ma len cig ces byas pa dang / drug sdes phye mang du blangs so //
translated: The group of six took a lot of pastries.

analyzed: rgan rims la khur bdag 'drim pa'i tshe drug sde dag gi 'og na rgan zhugs shig 'dug pa de gong du rgan rims la lta ba'i tshe /

analyzed: drug sdes zan chang chang pos lhung bzed bkang ngo //

analyzed: khyim bdag des khur ba 'drim pa'i tshe rgan zhugs la byin pa dang / lhung bzed lci bas sa la lhung ngo //
translated: When the householder distributed the food, he gave it to the old man. Because his bowl was heavy, it fell to the ground.

original: yon bdag gis smras pa /
analyzed: yon bdag gis smras pa /
translated: The patron said,🔽“Noble one, why did you take so much flour?”

original: 'phags pa ci'i phyir phye mang du len bdag gis ma blangs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa ci'i phyir phye mang du len bdag gis ma blangs so //
translated: “I didn’t take it.”

analyzed: 'o na sus blangs /

analyzed: de ltar gtol med do zhes byas pa dang / drug sde dag gis smras pa /
translated: The group of six said,

analyzed: rgan zhugs de la gang zan chang chang por char bab po zhes byas pa dang / de dag cang mi smra bar 'dug go //
translated: They sat there without saying anything.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: Having heard about this,

analyzed: de lta bas na lhung bzed la blta bar bya'o zhes bcas so //
translated: he decreed, “You should look at your alms bowl.”

analyzed: bza' bca' ma 'ongs par lhung bzed mi bzed par bya zhes bya ba ni drug sde rnams bsod snyoms la zhugs pa na zas ma byin par de dag lhung bzed sngar bzed cing 'khod pas dad pa'i bram ze dang khyim bdag dag 'phya ste / ci'i phyir na bca' ba dang bza' ba ma byin par lhung bzed bzed ces 'phya ba la snyan du bdas nas /
translated: “You should not hold out your alms bowl in anticipation of food and drink” means: The group of six held out their alms bowls in anticipation of food and drink before the meal was given to them when they went for alms.🔽Having heard about this,

analyzed: bca' ba dang bza' ba ma 'ongs par lhung bzed mi bzed par bya zhes bslab pa bcas so //

analyzed: yang 'dod pa'i phyir 'bras chan gyis tshod ma mi dag ba par bya zhes bya ba ni ma nyan du yod pa na ste /
translated: “You should not use rice to pick up vegetables” means: In Śrāvastī,

original: bsnyen dga' bo dal gyis 'ongs pa mthong nas /
analyzed: bsnyen dga' bo dal gyis 'ongs pa mthong nas /
translated: One should not urinate or defecate in a place where there is no path,

original: gzhir phyin pa la khyod kyis nga zan bcad par bsams te dal gyis 'ongs pa ngas shing la 'dzegs te bltas pas mthong ngo zhes smras pa dang / snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: gzhir phyin pa la khyod kyis nga zan bcad par bsams te dal gyis 'ongs pa ngas shing la 'dzegs te bltas pas mthong ngo zhes smras pa dang / snyan du bdas te /

original: shing la 'dzeg tu mi gnang bar bcas so //
analyzed: shing la 'dzeg tu mi gnang bar bcas so //
translated: He then prohibited climbing trees.

original: de ltar mi gnang ba dang / dge slong gos kha dog bsgyur ba dag las mi byed nas slad kyis mi gang tsam du 'dzeg tu gnang ba dang / mi gang tsam du 'dzeg tu gnang ba las dge slong zhig 'gron pa mang po dang 'grogs te lam du song ba las /
analyzed: de ltar mi gnang ba dang / dge slong gos kha dog bsgyur ba dag las mi byed nas slad kyis mi gang tsam du 'dzeg tu gnang ba dang / mi gang tsam du 'dzeg tu gnang ba las dge slong zhig 'gron pa mang po dang 'grogs te lam du song ba las /
translated: Since he prohibited this, the monks did not climb trees to get dyed robes. Later, he allowed climbing trees up to the height of a man, but when they climbed trees up to the height of a man, a monk traveling with a large group of people

analyzed: dgon pa'i lam du stag gis 'jigs nas mthor ma 'dzegs nas stag gis bsad do //
translated: was frightened by a tiger on a deserted road and did not climb a tree. The tiger killed him.

original: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
analyzed: de ltar gyur pa snyan du bdas nas /
translated: When this happened, they reported it to the Buddha.

original: gnod pa byung ba'i dus su mi gang las mtho bar 'dzeg tu gnang ngo //
analyzed: gnod pa byung ba'i dus su mi gang las mtho bar 'dzeg tu gnang ngo //
translated: He allowed climbing trees higher than a man when there is danger.

original: bslab pa mang po mi brjed pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: bslab pa mang po mi brjed pa'i tshig go /

original: // / so sor thar pa'i skabs nas 'dul ba'i dngos po bam po lnga bcu rtsa brgyad dang / lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa dang / drug cu'i nang na rtsod pa'i dngos po rgya cher 'chad kyis der ltos shig / rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba bdun smos pa las brtsams te smras pa /
analyzed: // / so sor thar pa'i skabs nas 'dul ba'i dngos po bam po lnga bcu rtsa brgyad dang / lnga bcu rtsa dgu pa dang / drug cu'i nang na rtsod pa'i dngos po rgya cher 'chad kyis der ltos shig / rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba bdun smos pa las brtsams te smras pa /
translated: The seven methods for resolving disputes are explained in the chapter on resolving disputes.

original: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: Disputes are of four types:

original: 'thab pa la rtsod pa dang / mi ston pas rtsod pa dang / nyes pa 'byung ba las rtsod pa dang / bya ba las rtsod pa'o /
analyzed: 'thab pa la rtsod pa dang / mi ston pas rtsod pa dang / nyes pa 'byung ba las rtsod pa dang / bya ba las rtsod pa'o /

analyzed: de la 'thab cing 'khrug pa'i gleng gzhi ni bcom ldan 'das grong khyer ser skya'i gnas na bzhugs te / phyi dro rgyal po zas gtsang ma dang / sh'a kya'i ming chen po la sogs pa la chos ston par mdzad do //
translated: The background to the dispute through fighting is that the Blessed One was staying in the city of Kapilavastu.🔽In the afternoon, he taught the Dharma to King Śuddhodana, Mahānāman of the Śākyas, and others.

original: snga dro ni skye dgu'i bdag mo dang / sh'a kya ming chen gyi chung ma la sogs te /
analyzed: snga dro ni skye dgu'i bdag mo dang / sh'a kya ming chen gyi chung ma la sogs te /

original: sh'a kya'i bud med rnams la de'i tshe na bu mo gcig cig rang gi mgul nas mu tig gi se mo do cig yod pa yang nas yang du rtog cing /🔽lag pas 'dzin pa skye dgu'i bdag mos mthong ste /

original: de'i nga rgyal bcag pa'i phyir rang gi mu tig gi se mo do mngag gzhug ma srung ma zhes bya ba len du btang ba dang / bu mo yang chos nyan pa'i bar chad du byas te /
analyzed: de'i nga rgyal bcag pa'i phyir rang gi mu tig gi se mo do mngag gzhug ma srung ma zhes bya ba len du btang ba dang / bu mo yang chos nyan pa'i bar chad du byas te /
translated: The girl, thinking it would be an obstacle to listening to the Dharma, went reluctantly.

original: mi dga' bzhin du song ba lam du bas brdungs te dus las 'das so //
analyzed: mi dga' bzhin du song ba lam du bas brdungs te dus las 'das so //

analyzed: de yang de ma thag tu sing ga la'i rgyal po'i bu mor skyes te de nam skyes pa'i tshe /

analyzed: de'i yul mu tig gi char bab pas de'i ming yang mu tig mar btags so //🔽dus @148a * //

analyzed: phyi zhig na tshong pa lnga brgya tsam zhig rgya mtshor zhugs te dong ba rlung gis bdas pas shing ga la'i gleng du phyin to //

analyzed: de dag srod dang tho rangs la gsung rab rnams dbyungs su bklags pa dang bu mo des thos te /

original: ae ma ho //
analyzed: ae ma ho //
translated: Oh!🔽🔽

analyzed: de lta bu'i glu snyan yul sing ga la'i mi zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: de ni glu ma yin gyis sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab kyi chos so zhes byas nas /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan rgya cher bstan pas bu mos tshong pa la /
translated: She taught the qualities of the Buddha extensively. The girl said to the merchants,

analyzed: phrin dang yi ge sangs rgyas la gsol te /

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ri mo dang / yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshigs su bcad pa tshong pa la bu mo mu tig ma'i drung du bskur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku'i ri mo dang / yan lag bcu gnyis kyi tshigs su bcad pa tshong pa la bu mo mu tig ma'i drung du bskur te /

original: de yang bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
analyzed: de yang bden pa mthong bar gyur to //
translated: She also saw the truth.

original: de nas bu mo des skyes lan du sangs rgyas la sogs pa dkon mchog gsum la mu tig bre gsum bskur ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi sku skal ni dri gtsang khang du skyang nul byas so //

analyzed: dge 'dun gyi sku skal ni so sor bgos so //
translated: The share of the Sangha was distributed to each member.🔽The share of the Dharma was given to the Dharma teacher.

analyzed: chos kyi rnyed pa ni chos smra ba dbang ngo zhas byung ba dang / 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang / mdo sde dang / ma mo 'dzin pa rnams so so nas de dbang ngo zhes 'khrug pa las 'thab cing rtsod pa'i dbang por bcas pa dang /
translated: The Vinaya holders, Sutra holders, and Vinaya holders all said, “It is given to us.” They argued and fought over it.

original: phyis mnyan du yod pa na sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: phyis mnyan du yod pa na sangs rgyas bzhugs pa'i tshe /
translated: Later, when the Buddha was staying in Śrāvastī,

analyzed: yul yangs pa can na dge slong dag 'thab cing rtsod par gyur pa las /

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bus de dag sdums pa snyan du bdas te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / mood gal gyi bus de dag sdums pa snyan du bdas te /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas mngags nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bkas mngags nas /
translated: They were sent by the Blessed One

original: dge slong dag gzhan yang rtsod pa 'di lta bu zhi bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal te /
analyzed: dge slong dag gzhan yang rtsod pa 'di lta bu zhi bar bya'o zhes bka' stsal te /
translated: Bhikṣus, there is another way to pacify such disputes.

analyzed: mdor rtsod pa'i chos dang chos ma yin pa dpyod pa las phyogs gnyis su chad de 'thab mor gyur pa'o //
translated: In brief, disputes arise from the analysis of what is Dharma and what is not Dharma, and they are settled by the two sides becoming divided.

original: 'khrug cing rtsod pas na /
analyzed: 'khrug cing rtsod pas na /
translated: Because of conflict and dispute,

original: 'khrug pas rtsod pa zhes bya ste 'khrug pa de'i rtsa ba ni drug ste /
analyzed: 'khrug pas rtsod pa zhes bya ste 'khrug pa de'i rtsa ba ni drug ste /

original: rtsa ba drug dang dbyen du smra ba'i dngos po bcu bzhi'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba drug dang dbyen du smra ba'i dngos po bcu bzhi'o //

original: 'khrug pa'i rtsa ba drug po gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'i rtsa ba drug po gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six roots of conflict?

original: khro zhing khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab cing 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog cing 'jungs pa dang / sgyu byed cing g-yo byed pa dang / ngo mi tsha zhing khrel gyis mi dogs pa dang / sdig pa la 'dod cing log par lta ba la bdag tu lta ba bsnyems pa'o //
analyzed: khro zhing khon du 'dzin pa dang / 'chab cing 'tshig pa dang / phrag dog cing 'jungs pa dang / sgyu byed cing g-yo byed pa dang / ngo mi tsha zhing khrel gyis mi dogs pa dang / sdig pa la 'dod cing log par lta ba la bdag tu lta ba bsnyems pa'o //
translated: Anger and resentment, concealment and spite, envy and stinginess, deceit and fraud, shamelessness and lack of conscience, and the view of sin as a means of livelihood and the view of wrong views as supreme.

original: dbyen du 'byed pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi ni /
analyzed: dbyen du 'byed pa'i dngos po bcu bzhi ni /
translated: The fourteen bases of schism are:

original: 'di ni chos so zhes pa dang / 'di ni chos ma yin no zhes @148b pa dang / 'di ni 'dul ba dang / 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin no zhes pa dang / 'di ni nyes pa'o 'di ni nyes pa ma yin no zhes pa dang /
analyzed: 'di ni chos so zhes pa dang / 'di ni chos ma yin no zhes @148b pa dang / 'di ni 'dul ba dang / 'di ni 'dul ba ma yin no zhes pa dang / 'di ni nyes pa'o 'di ni nyes pa ma yin no zhes pa dang /
translated: This is the Dharma, this is not the Dharma, this is the Vinaya, this is not the Vinaya, this is an offense, this is not an offense,

original: 'di ni lci ba'o 'di ni yang ba'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni lhag ma lus pa'o 'di ni lhag ma lus pa'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni bsdam par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni lci ba'o 'di ni yang ba'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni lhag ma lus pa'o 'di ni lhag ma lus pa'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni bsdam par bya'o //
translated: this is serious, this is light, this is a remainder, this is not a remainder, this should be restrained,

original: 'di ni bshags par bya'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni 'dul ba las 'das pa'o zhes pa dang /'di ni ngan par smra bar gyur pa'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni dge ba dang 'di ni mi dge ba'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni lung du mi ston par byed pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: 'di ni bshags par bya'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni 'dul ba las 'das pa'o zhes pa dang /'di ni ngan par smra bar gyur pa'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni dge ba dang 'di ni mi dge ba'o zhes pa dang / 'di ni lung du mi ston par byed pa la rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: this should be confessed, this is beyond the Vinaya, this is bad speech, this is virtuous, this is non-virtuous, this is neutral, and there are three types of neutral actions:

original: dge bar 'dod pa dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa dang / gnyi gar mi 'dod pa yang rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dge bar 'dod pa dang / mi dge bar 'dod pa dang / gnyi gar mi 'dod pa yang rim bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: those desired as virtuous, those desired as non-virtuous, and those not desired as either, which should be applied in order.

original: gang 'khrug pa de nyid rtsod pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'khrug pa de nyid rtsod pa ste /
translated: That which is agitated is itself a dispute.

original: rnam pa bzhir sbyar ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir sbyar ro //
translated: The four types of debate are applied to these.

original: rnam pa dang po ni mi mthun par smra ba tsam mo //
analyzed: rnam pa dang po ni mi mthun par smra ba tsam mo //
translated: The first type is mere disagreement.

original: gnyis pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni de las gzhan pa'o //
translated: The second is other than that.

original: gsum pa ni gnyi ga lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni gnyi ga lhan cig pa'o //
translated: The third is both together.

original: bzhi pa ni de rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni de rnams ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that which is not included in those.

original: mi ston pa las rtsod pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
analyzed: mi ston pa las rtsod pa'i gleng gzhi ni /
translated: The basis of debate that is not taught is

original: gang gleng bar mi rigs par gleng ba ste /
analyzed: gang gleng bar mi rigs par gleng ba ste /
translated: that which is not appropriate to be discussed but is discussed.

original: ngan par ma gtogs par glengs pas na mi ston cing klog pa dang / lung la sogs pa ston pa bkag pas na mi ston pa'i rtsod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ngan par ma gtogs par glengs pas na mi ston cing klog pa dang / lung la sogs pa ston pa bkag pas na mi ston pa'i rtsod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since it is discussed without being included in the bad, it is called a debate that is not taught, since it is prohibited to teach and read it, and to give transmission and so on.

original: de yang gang lta bu la bya zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang lta bu la bya zhe na /
translated: What is an example of that?🔽For example, a nun friend accused Gayacara, the son of a wealthy man, of having committed an action of immediate retribution and discussed it, and other monks also discussed it.🔽Since he was ashamed, he said, “I did not do it.”

original: dper na dge slong ma grogs mos gyad bu nor la phas pham pas skur te glengs pa dang / de la dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de nyid glengs pa dang / de yang mnyes pas ngo tsha nas ma byas so zhes zer ba dang / dge slong bye ma can smyo nas ci yang byas te sangs nas /
analyzed: dper na dge slong ma grogs mos gyad bu nor la phas pham pas skur te glengs pa dang / de la dge slong gzhan gyis kyang de nyid glengs pa dang / de yang mnyes pas ngo tsha nas ma byas so zhes zer ba dang / dge slong bye ma can smyo nas ci yang byas te sangs nas /
translated: The monk Samudrakīrti, having gone mad, did everything, but when he recovered, he said, “I did not do it.”

original: dge slong gzhan gyis nyes pa de shogs shig ces byas nas /
analyzed: dge slong gzhan gyis nyes pa de shogs shig ces byas nas /
translated: The other monks said, Confess that fault!

original: ngas ma dran no zhes nas dge slong rnams kyis de la ston pa bkag ste lung mi ster bas /
analyzed: ngas ma dran no zhes nas dge slong rnams kyis de la ston pa bkag ste lung mi ster bas /
translated: He said, I don't remember. The monks stopped him from teaching, saying, You should not teach.

original: sna de lta bu la sogs pas ni mi ston pa las rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sna de lta bu la sogs pas ni mi ston pa las rtsod pa byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because of such a nose, it is called a dispute arose from not teaching.

original: nyes pa las rtsod pa byung na ni ltung ba'i ris lnga las gleng gzhir gyur te /
analyzed: nyes pa las rtsod pa byung na ni ltung ba'i ris lnga las gleng gzhir gyur te /
translated: If a dispute arises from a fault, it is a source of downfalls from the five classes of downfalls.

original: rtsod pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa byung ba'o //
translated: This is a dispute arose.

original: nyes pa'i rtsa ba ni lus dang ngag yid gsum char dang ldan pa las byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rtsa ba ni lus dang ngag yid gsum char dang ldan pa las byung ba yang yod /
translated: The root of a fault may arise from all three: body, speech and mind.

original: gnyis dang ldan pa las byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: gnyis dang ldan pa las byung ba yang yod /
translated: It may arise from two.

original: gsum char la so sor re nas byung ba yang yod /
analyzed: gsum char la so sor re nas byung ba yang yod /
translated: It may arise from each of the three.

original: de la lus gcig pu nas byung ba ni /
analyzed: de la lus gcig pu nas byung ba ni /
translated: A fault arising from the body alone is as follows.

original: dper na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang / khyim gcig tu nyal ba las de yang phyir ma byung ba dang phyir byung bar 'du shes de nyal ba dang / bdag khyim gyi nang na nyal ba las bud med phyis 'ongs te nyal ba las /
analyzed: dper na bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa'i gang zag dang / khyim gcig tu nyal ba las de yang phyir ma byung ba dang phyir byung bar 'du shes de nyal ba dang / bdag khyim gyi nang na nyal ba las bud med phyis 'ongs te nyal ba las /
translated: For example, a person who is not fully ordained, or who is sleeping in the same house, or who has not left, or who thinks he has left, or who is sleeping, or who is sleeping in the house, or who is sleeping after a woman has come later,

original: bdag @149a * //
analyzed: bdag @149a * //
translated: or who is sleeping,

original: gnyid kyis log pa las gzhan gyis mal lam khri chen po'i steng du bzhag pa lta bu ni lus 'ba' zhig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa las gzhan gyis mal lam khri chen po'i steng du bzhag pa lta bu ni lus 'ba' zhig las byung ba'o //
translated: or who is placed on a bed or a high bed by another while asleep.

original: ngag 'ba' zhig las byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: ngag 'ba' zhig las byung ba yang yod de /
translated: There is also that which arises only from speech.

original: ji ltar bud med lam bsams bzhin du tshig lnga drug gam bdun las 'das pas chos bshad pa ni ngag 'ba' zhig las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bud med lam bsams bzhin du tshig lnga drug gam bdun las 'das pas chos bshad pa ni ngag 'ba' zhig las byung ba'o //
translated: For example, a woman who thinks about the path, but explains the Dharma with more than five, six, or seven words.

original: sems gcig pu las nges pa'i mthar 'gyur mi srid do //
analyzed: sems gcig pu las nges pa'i mthar 'gyur mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible for the ultimate to be ascertained from the mind alone.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems la ni skad cig tu 'jug pa las skad cig tu ldog ste sems ni cha phra bas bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: sems la ni skad cig tu 'jug pa las skad cig tu ldog ste sems ni cha phra bas bsdam par bya ba'i nyes byas so //
translated: Because the mind engages in an instant and disengages in an instant. The mind is subtle, so it is a fault to be bound by it.

original: 'dir ma smos so //
analyzed: 'dir ma smos so //
translated: The other two are not mentioned here.

original: lus dang sems gnyis las nyes pa 'byung ba ni ji ltar srog gcod pa dang chang 'thung ba ste /🔽lus dang sems gnyis las nyes pa byung ba yin te tshig tu mi smra ba'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems gnyis las nyes pa 'byung ba ni ji ltar srog gcod pa dang chang 'thung ba ste / lus dang sems gnyis las nyes pa byung ba yin te tshig tu mi smra ba'o //
translated: There are offenses that arise from both body and mind, such as killing and drinking alcohol.

original: tshig dang sems gnyis kyi yang yod de /
analyzed: tshig dang sems gnyis kyi yang yod de /
translated: There are offenses that arise from both speech and mind,

original: ji ltar bsams bzhin du tshig lnga 'am bdun las 'das par bud med la chos bshad pa ni tshig dang sems gnyis las byung ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bsams bzhin du tshig lnga 'am bdun las 'das par bud med la chos bshad pa ni tshig dang sems gnyis las byung ba'o //
translated: such as teaching the Dharma to a woman for more than five or seven words, as one intends.

original: lus dang sems dang tshig gsum char las nyes pa byung ba yang yod de /
analyzed: lus dang sems dang tshig gsum char las nyes pa byung ba yang yod de /
translated: There are offenses that arise from all three, body, speech, and mind.

original: dper na srog gcod pa lta bu sems kyis kyang bsams la /
analyzed: dper na srog gcod pa lta bu sems kyis kyang bsams la /

analyzed: lus kyis kyang sbyar te ngag gis kyang gsod ces smra zhing shi ba legs so zhes smra ba'o //
translated: and it is carried out by the body, and one says, “Kill!” and “Good!”

original: spyi de lta bu las rtsod pa 'byung zhing gong ma'i lus ngag yid gsum lta bu las byung ba las nang 'khrug cing mi mthun par gyur pa las rtsod pa byung ba dang / gzhan yang nyes pa gtan la ma phebs pa las rtsod pa byung ba ste /

analyzed: de yang dper na dge slong slong mos nga can lta bu nyes pa byung ba las dge slong gzhan phan par dga' ba rnams kyis ltung ba shogs shig ces byas na /
translated: Disputes arise from internal conflict and disagreement, such as when a monk who is greedy for alms is accused of a downfall by other monks who delight in helping others.🔽He replies, “I did not see it,” and he is dishonest.

original: ma mthong ngo zhes bka' blo mi bde zhing bsnyon pa dang / ri dags dgra'i bu nag po lta bu mnyan du yod pa na gnas te /
analyzed: ma mthong ngo zhes bka' blo mi bde zhing bsnyon pa dang / ri dags dgra'i bu nag po lta bu mnyan du yod pa na gnas te /

original: de yang tshul dang ldan pas li tstsha b'i rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas pas yangs pa can gyi dge slong dag gis phrag dog skyes te /
analyzed: de yang tshul dang ldan pas li tstsha b'i rnams kyis bsnyen bkur byas pas yangs pa can gyi dge slong dag gis phrag dog skyes te /

analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur par spangs pa'i las byas pa ni mi brtsan no zhes bka' stsal nas spangs so //
translated: The monk said, I did not commit a pārājika offense.

original: dge slong lag pa can ni gzhan gyis glengs na khas blangs so //🔽de nas spang bar bya'i las byas pa dang yang bsnyon te /
analyzed: dge slong lag pa can ni gzhan gyis glengs na khas blangs so //🔽de nas spang bar bya'i las byas pa dang yang bsnyon te /
translated: The monk

analyzed: de bzhin du yang dang yang du bsnyon zhing khas mi len pas nyes pa gtan la mi phebs pa na /
translated: Likewise, if the fault is not established because the opponent repeatedly denies it and does not accept it,

analyzed: de lta bu dag las phyogs su chad cing rtsod pa byung ba ni nyes pa dang ltung ba la rtsod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: then a dispute that arises from such a situation is called a dispute about faults and downfalls.🔽A dispute about actions is when learned, clear, and discerning monks are present and assembled, and they perform a legal procedure that accords with the Dharma and the Vinaya, such as a proposal and a single proclamation,

original: bya ba las rtsod pa ni dge slong mkhas pa gsal bar dpyod pa dag 'dug shing tshogs nas chos dang 'dul ba bzhin du gsol ba dang gnyis sam /
analyzed: bya ba las rtsod pa ni dge slong mkhas pa gsal bar dpyod pa dag 'dug shing tshogs nas chos dang 'dul ba bzhin du gsol ba dang gnyis sam /
translated: a proposal and a twofold procedure,

original: gsol ba dang lan gsum ste bzhi 'am /
analyzed: gsol ba dang lan gsum ste bzhi 'am /
translated: a proposal and a threefold procedure,

original: gsol ba rkyang pa la sogs pa'i las byed pas na /
analyzed: gsol ba rkyang pa la sogs pa'i las byed pas na /
translated: or a simple proposal, and so on.

original: la la na re 'di ni chos ma yin no zhes smras pa dang / la la na re 'di ni chos bzhin no zhes smras pa dang / dge slong 'ga' zhig 'dir ma 'dus pa las rtsod pa dang / kha cig 'phyis nas snga ma byas pa las skyo sngogs byas te rtsod pa dang /
analyzed: la la na re 'di ni chos ma yin no zhes smras pa dang / la la na re 'di ni chos bzhin no zhes smras pa dang / dge slong 'ga' zhig 'dir ma 'dus pa las rtsod pa dang / kha cig 'phyis nas snga ma byas pa las skyo sngogs byas te rtsod pa dang /
translated: Some say, “This is not the Dharma,” and others say, “This is in accordance with the Dharma.” A dispute arises from the monks who are not present, or from those who arrive late and then try to overturn what was done earlier.

original: nang mi mthun pa las rtsod pa dang / chos bzhin ma yin pa las rtsod de 'thab cing rtsod pa las phyogs gnyis su gyed shing chad pa las 'thab mo byung ba ni bya ba las rtsod pa ste rtsod pa bzhi smras zin to //
analyzed: nang mi mthun pa las rtsod pa dang / chos bzhin ma yin pa las rtsod de 'thab cing rtsod pa las phyogs gnyis su gyed shing chad pa las 'thab mo byung ba ni bya ba las rtsod pa ste rtsod pa bzhi smras zin to //
translated: These are the four types of disputes.

original: zhi bar bya ba bdun smra bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhi bar bya ba bdun smra bar bya ste /
translated: There are seven methods for settling disputes.🔽The seven methods for settling disputes are taught in the same way as the four types of disputes.🔽The seven methods for settling disputes are:

original: gong ma'i rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi lta bur bya ba la zhi bar bya ba rnam pa bdun gyis zhi bar bya ba yang so sor kha bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gong ma'i rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi lta bur bya ba la zhi bar bya ba rnam pa bdun gyis zhi bar bya ba yang so sor kha bstan par bya ste /
translated: 1. settling disputes by direct confrontation,🔽2. settling disputes by majority vote,🔽3. settling disputes by granting a formal act of reconciliation,🔽4. settling disputes by referring them to a committee,🔽5. settling disputes by declaring the issue as a point of doctrine,

original: de la 'khrugs pas rtsod pa la ni mngon sum du gdul bar bya ba dang / tshul shing mang po sbyin pa dang / gnyis kyis zhi bar bya zhing 'dul bar 'os te de gnyis kyis zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'khrugs pas rtsod pa la ni mngon sum du gdul bar bya ba dang / tshul shing mang po sbyin pa dang / gnyis kyis zhi bar bya zhing 'dul bar 'os te de gnyis kyis zhi bar bya'o //
translated: 6. settling disputes by excusing an individual, and🔽7. settling disputes by covering over with grass.🔽The first two methods are appropriate for settling disputes that arise from internal discord.

original: mngon sum du 'dul zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: mngon sum du 'dul zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The first method is settling disputes by direct confrontation.

original: rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi lta bu byung ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi lta bu byung ste /
translated: When disputes arise from the three causes,

original: dge 'dun gyi phyogs gnyis su chad par gyur na dge slong rnams kyis dge slong gzu bo zhal che ba bsko bar bya ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyogs gnyis su chad par gyur na dge slong rnams kyis dge slong gzu bo zhal che ba bsko bar bya ste /
translated: When the Saṅgha is divided into two factions, the monks should appoint a monk who is upright and has a sense of shame to be the adjudicator.

original: gang zag gsum mngon du gyur pa ste /
analyzed: gang zag gsum mngon du gyur pa ste /
translated: Three individuals are present:🔽the one who is the object of the dispute, the one who is the respondent, and the one who is the adjudicator.

original: de yang gang zhen rgol ba mngon sum pa dang / lan ldon pa dang mngon sum pa dang / gzu bo mngon sum du gyur pa dang / ston pa'i bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston gyis de las mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: de yang gang zhen rgol ba mngon sum pa dang / lan ldon pa dang mngon sum pa dang / gzu bo mngon sum du gyur pa dang / ston pa'i bstan pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston gyis de las mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: The adjudicator should be someone who teaches the doctrine of the Teacher in accordance with the scriptures and does not contradict them.

original: de la rgol ba pos gnas bcu drug tu don shin tu bsams nas gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la rgol ba pos gnas bcu drug tu don shin tu bsams nas gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The respondent should memorize the case after having reflected on its meaning in terms of sixteen topics.🔽The sixteen topics are:

original: bden pa dang / dus dang / tshod dang / @150a * //
analyzed: bden pa dang / dus dang / tshod dang / @150a * //
translated: the four noble truths, time, occasion,

original: don du dben pa dang mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / grong dang / dgon pa dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin par byas pa dang / lhag ma lus pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa dang /
analyzed: don du dben pa dang mthong ba dang / thos pa dang / dogs pa dang / lus dang / ngag dang / grong dang / dgon pa dang / mtshan mo dang / nyin par byas pa dang / lhag ma lus pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa dang /
translated: purpose, seclusion, seeing, hearing, suspicion, body, speech, village, wilderness, night, day, what has been done, and what has not been done.

original: slong bar nus pa'o /
analyzed: slong bar nus pa'o /
translated: The respondent should be able to respond to the questions on these topics.

original: de'i tshig mi brtsan pa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: de'i tshig mi brtsan pa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: There are five ways in which a monk is not to be considered an authority:

original: don gtan la ma phebs pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu ba'i tshig dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshig las don 'dzin pa dang / mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / gnas mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: don gtan la ma phebs pa dang / gcig nas gcig tu ba'i tshig dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshig las don 'dzin pa dang / mdo sde 'dzin pa dang / gnas mi shes pa'o //
translated: he has not ascertained the meaning; he is reciting from memory a text that he has not mastered; he is reciting a text that he has not memorized; he is reciting a sūtra that he has not memorized; he does not know the location.

original: slar ldog pa lnga ni brtsan no //🔽lan ldon pas kyang rnam pa bcu drug po 'di rnams soms la skabs dbye bar bya'o //🔽ci ste tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin nam /🔽'gyod pa can nam /🔽mang du thos pa'am /
analyzed: slar ldog pa lnga ni brtsan no // lan ldon pas kyang rnam pa bcu drug po 'di rnams soms la skabs dbye bar bya'o // ci ste tshul khrims dang ldan pa yin nam / 'gyod pa can nam / mang du thos pa'am /
translated: There are five ways in which a monk is to be considered an authority:

original: 'dul ba gtan la 'bebs pa yin na /🔽ci mthong ba las gleng bar byed dam zhes pa la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba gtan la 'bebs pa yin na / ci mthong ba las gleng bar byed dam zhes pa la sogs pa bcu gnyis ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The monk who is to be considered an authority should be one who has ascertained the meaning, who is reciting from memory a text that he has mastered, who is reciting a text that he has memorized, who is reciting a sūtra that he has memorized, and who knows the location.

original: rnam pa lngas ni tshig mi brtsan par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ni tshig mi brtsan par bya ste /
translated: The monk who is to be considered an authority should be one who is not of the five kinds who are not to be considered authorities.🔽The monk who is to be considered an authority should be one who is not of the five kinds who are not to be considered authorities.🔽The monk who is to be considered an authority should be one who is not of the five kinds who are not to be considered authorities.🔽The monk who is to be considered an authority should be one who is not of the five kinds who are not to be considered authorities.🔽The monk who is to be considered an authority should be one who is not of the five kinds who are not to be considered authorities.

original: mtshams sbyor ba ni mi smra ba ba dang / gzhan las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / phyogs la bstan te nyes pa khas len pa las kyang mnyes par bsnyon pa dang / dge slong rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dang / rim gro med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams sbyor ba ni mi smra ba ba dang / gzhan las gzhan du 'gyur ba dang / phyogs la bstan te nyes pa khas len pa las kyang mnyes par bsnyon pa dang / dge slong rnams la skur pa 'debs pa dang / rim gro med pa'o //
translated: The monk who is a troublemaker is one who is silent when he should speak, speaks when he should be silent, speaks in a way that is contrary to what he should say, does not admit his faults when they are pointed out, slanders the monks, and is not helpful.

original: slar bzlog pa ni brtsan par bya'o //
analyzed: slar bzlog pa ni brtsan par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is a troublemaker should be corrected.

original: rgol ba dang / lan ldon pa gnyis 'thab mo'i nyes dmigs de zhi ba'i yon tan du snang na gnyis kyis gzu bo chos bcu drug dang ldan pa btsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: rgol ba dang / lan ldon pa gnyis 'thab mo'i nyes dmigs de zhi ba'i yon tan du snang na gnyis kyis gzu bo chos bcu drug dang ldan pa btsal bar bya'o //
translated: If the monk who is a troublemaker and the monk who corrects him see the disadvantages of quarreling and the advantages of peace, then both should seek a monk who has sixteen qualities.

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / slob pa 'dod pa dang / thos pa mang ba dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / gzu bo'i chos bzhin du ma 'dres pa 'dod pa la sogs pa ltar mi 'gro ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa dang / slob pa 'dod pa dang / thos pa mang ba dang / 'dul ba la mkhas pa dang / gzu bo'i chos bzhin du ma 'dres pa 'dod pa la sogs pa ltar mi 'gro ba dang / 'dod chags dang zhe sdang gi ma yin pa dang /
translated: He should be one who has moral discipline, who desires to learn, who is learned, who is skilled in the Monastic Law, who is honest, who does not side with either party, who is not swayed by desire, ill will, confusion, or fear, who is not lazy, who is not distracted, who is not swayed by material gain, who is not swayed by loss, who is not swayed by praise, who is not swayed by criticism, who is not swayed by fame, who is not swayed by lack of fame, who is not swayed by happiness, and who is not swayed by suffering.

original: rgyal ba'i tshig las mi 'da' ba dang / ma bcas pa las mi 'cha' ba dang / bcas pa las mi bsgyur ba dang / chos de zhi bar nus pa dang / slong bar nus pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i tshig las mi 'da' ba dang / ma bcas pa las mi 'cha' ba dang / bcas pa las mi bsgyur ba dang / chos de zhi bar nus pa dang / slong bar nus pa'o //
translated: 1) not transgressing the words of the Victorious One; 2) not creating what has not been created; 3) not changing what has been created; 4) being able to pacify that phenomenon; 5) being able to stop it.

original: gzu bo la gsum ste /
analyzed: gzu bo la gsum ste /
translated: There are three types of accusers:

original: gang lus dang ngag mi sdom par de phyogs gnyi ga'i thad du bdag nyid song nas dkrugs mar byed pa dang / gang ngag bsdams pa ste /
analyzed: gang lus dang ngag mi sdom par de phyogs gnyi ga'i thad du bdag nyid song nas dkrugs mar byed pa dang / gang ngag bsdams pa ste /
translated: 1) those who, without restraining their body and speech, go before both parties and stir up trouble; 2) those who restrain their speech;

original: phrin las sbyor ba dang gnyi ga la yang sdom pa ste /
analyzed: phrin las sbyor ba dang gnyi ga la yang sdom pa ste /
translated: 3) those who restrain both body and speech.

original: de lta bu bskor bar bya'i snga ma gnyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu bskor bar bya'i snga ma gnyis ni ma yin no //
translated: The latter is the one who should be appointed, not the former two.

original: byis pa lta bu lnga ste chos ma yin pa'i phyogs su 'jug pa dang / rtsod par 'gyur bar @150b stobs pa dang / gzu bo gzhan las mdo sde dang so sor thar pas dge slong rnams la sman pa dang / rim gro med pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa lta bu lnga ste chos ma yin pa'i phyogs su 'jug pa dang / rtsod par 'gyur bar @150b stobs pa dang / gzu bo gzhan las mdo sde dang so sor thar pas dge slong rnams la sman pa dang / rim gro med pa'o //
translated: There are five types of childish people: 1) those who engage in what is not Dharma; 2) those who encourage disputes; 3) those who, as accusers, do not serve the monks with the sūtras and the pratimokṣa; 4) those who do not have respect; 5) those who do not have service.

original: slar bzlog pa lnga ni gsal ba'o //
analyzed: slar bzlog pa lnga ni gsal ba'o //
translated: The five types of reversal are clear.

original: gzu bos rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba nyams su blang ba dang / bdag nyid la rnam pa brgyad du brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gzu bos rtsod pa zhi bar bya ba nyams su blang ba dang / bdag nyid la rnam pa brgyad du brtag par bya ste /
translated: One should practice the pacification of disputes with an honest mind and examine oneself in eight ways:

original: ci bdag gis thog ma ci las byung ba shes sam /
analyzed: ci bdag gis thog ma ci las byung ba shes sam /
translated: “Do I know what I have done in the past?

original: bdag ni grogs po gzu bo bzhin nam /
analyzed: bdag ni grogs po gzu bo bzhin nam /
translated: Am I honest like a friend?

original: sngon 'dres par byed pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sngon 'dres par byed pa ma yin nam /
translated: Am I not a past acquaintance?

original: ji bdag gi tshig brtsan nam nyes pa de dag rnam par byang nus sam /
analyzed: ji bdag gi tshig brtsan nam nyes pa de dag rnam par byang nus sam /
translated: Are my words trustworthy? Can I purify that fault?

original: lan glan par nus sam /
analyzed: lan glan par nus sam /
translated: Can I respond?

original: chos bzhin du zhi bar bya nus sam /
analyzed: chos bzhin du zhi bar bya nus sam /

analyzed: khyod @152a * //
translated: You should also take it,”

original: kyis kyang long shig ces bsgo ba dang / mnan pa mang shing dge 'dun gyi dang bzhi'o //
analyzed: kyis kyang long shig ces bsgo ba dang / mnan pa mang shing dge 'dun gyi dang bzhi'o //
translated: and if there is much pressure, then these are the four of the Saṅgha.

original: tshul shing chos bzhin ma yin par 'drim pa bcu ste /
analyzed: tshul shing chos bzhin ma yin par 'drim pa bcu ste /
translated: There are ten ways of distributing voting sticks that are not in accordance with the Dharma:

original: chos bzhin ma yin par len pa dang / 'dul bar mi mthun pa dang / ma 'dus par len pa dang / cung zad cig gis nyes pa dang chung ngu dbye bar dogs pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mthar ma phyin par sbyor ba bzlog pa dang /
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin par len pa dang / 'dul bar mi mthun pa dang / ma 'dus par len pa dang / cung zad cig gis nyes pa dang chung ngu dbye bar dogs pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mthar ma phyin par sbyor ba bzlog pa dang /
translated: Taking the voting stick in a way that is not in accordance with the Dharma, not in accordance with the Vinaya, taking it without being included, fearing a fault from a small cause, fearing division, reversing the application before the end of the elder,

original: shes par ldan pa la sbyur bar mi byed cing 'dul ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi 'dri ba dang / dge 'dun 'byed par 'dod pa dang / dge slong chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba mang por 'dod cing /
analyzed: shes par ldan pa la sbyur bar mi byed cing 'dul ba 'dzin pa la sogs pa mi 'dri ba dang / dge 'dun 'byed par 'dod pa dang / dge slong chos bzhin ma yin par smra ba mang por 'dod cing /
translated: He desires to split the Saṅgha, and desires many monks to speak contrary to the Dharma.

original: dge 'dun la dbye bar 'gyur ro snyam du shes pa dang / chos ma yin par smra bar 'gyur ro snyam du shes so //
analyzed: dge 'dun la dbye bar 'gyur ro snyam du shes pa dang / chos ma yin par smra bar 'gyur ro snyam du shes so //
translated: He knows that the Saṅgha will be split, and knows that they will speak contrary to the Dharma.

original: slar bzlog pa bcu ni chos bzhin yin no //
analyzed: slar bzlog pa bcu ni chos bzhin yin no //
translated: The ten reversals are in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tshul shing 'drim pas tshul shing rnam pa gnyis su ste /
analyzed: tshul shing 'drim pas tshul shing rnam pa gnyis su ste /
translated: The voting sticks are distributed in two ways.

original: chos kyi tshul shing ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang gzugs su ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi tshul shing ni dbyibs dang kha dog dang gzugs su ldan pa'o //
translated: The Dharma voting stick has shape, color, and form.

original: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing slar bzlog pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing slar bzlog pa'o //
translated: The non-Dharma voting stick is reversed.

original: chos kyi tshul shing ni lag pa g-yas par long shig /
analyzed: chos kyi tshul shing ni lag pa g-yas par long shig /
translated: Take the Dharma voting stick with your right hand.

original: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yon pa'o //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni lag pa g-yon pa'o //
translated: The non-Dharma voting stick is in the left hand.

original: de nas mdun du 'dug pa la bsngags pa dang / mi bsngags pa gnyis brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas mdun du 'dug pa la bsngags pa dang / mi bsngags pa gnyis brjod par bya'o //
translated: Then, sitting in front, the praise and the two non-praises should be spoken.

original: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni phyir lag pa brkyang ba dang / tshig dang po gnyis kyi bar du ma byin cig / gsum pa la sbyin te /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing ni phyir lag pa brkyang ba dang / tshig dang po gnyis kyi bar du ma byin cig / gsum pa la sbyin te /
translated: “ Do not give the first two votes. Give the third.🔽“ Make them confess the offense of transgressing the monastic code.

original: 'dul ba las 'das pa'i nyes byas 'chags su chug shig de ste chos kyi tshul shing gcig gis nyung bar gyur nas /
analyzed: 'dul ba las 'das pa'i nyes byas 'chags su chug shig de ste chos kyi tshul shing gcig gis nyung bar gyur nas /
translated: If the “Dharma” voting sticks are one less than the “non-Dharma” ones,

original: kun shes koondi n+ya'i phyir yang gcig long /
analyzed: kun shes koondi n+ya'i phyir yang gcig long /
translated: take back one of the “Dharma” ones for Ājñātakauṇḍinya.

original: de ste chos kyi tshul shing mang por gyur na /
analyzed: de ste chos kyi tshul shing mang por gyur na /
translated: If the “Dharma” voting sticks are more numerous,

original: chos bzhin du rtsod pa de zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: chos bzhin du rtsod pa de zhi ba yin te /
translated: the dispute has been settled in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gang gis bskyod pa de ltung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis bskyod pa de ltung ba'o //
translated: Whoever stirs up the assembly again commits an offense.

original: de ste chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing mang bar gyur na yang /
analyzed: de ste chos ma yin pa'i tshul shing mang bar gyur na yang /
translated: If the “non-Dharma” voting sticks are more numerous,

original: chos bzhin ma yin pas zhi ba yin te /
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin pas zhi ba yin te /
translated: the dispute has been settled in a manner contrary to the Dharma.

original: de yang bskyod na nyes byas so //
analyzed: de yang bskyod na nyes byas so //
translated: Again, whoever stirs up the assembly commits an offense.

original: de ltar gang tshul shing mang po brims pas zhi bar gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar gang tshul shing mang po brims pas zhi bar gyur pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the dispute is settled by the distribution of the voting sticks.

original: mi ston pa'i rtsod pa la zhi bar bya ba rnam pa gsum gyis bya ste /
analyzed: mi ston pa'i rtsod pa la zhi bar bya ba rnam pa gsum gyis bya ste /
translated: “ Disputes in the absence of the Teacher are to be settled by three methods.

original: 'khrugs pas rtsod pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis 'dul ba dang / dran pas 'dul ba dang / ma myos pas 'dul ba sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: 'khrugs pas rtsod pa bzhin du mngon sum gyis 'dul ba dang / dran pas 'dul ba dang / ma myos pas 'dul ba sbyin par bya ste /
translated: One should grant the penance of confession, the penance of recollection and the penance of non-delusion, as if one were to settle a dispute by direct confrontation.

original: mngon sum gyis 'dul ba ni gong ma dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis 'dul ba ni gong ma dang 'dra bar sbyar ro //
translated: The penance of confession is as above.

original: dran pas 'dul ba sbyin pa ni gyad bu nor la dge slong dag gis phas pham pas skur te de la glengs pa dang / ngas byas pa mi dran no zhes zer ba la dran nam mi dran zhes sems su gzhug ste /
analyzed: dran pas 'dul ba sbyin pa ni gyad bu nor la dge slong dag gis phas pham pas skur te de la glengs pa dang / ngas byas pa mi dran no zhes zer ba la dran nam mi dran zhes sems su gzhug ste /
translated: The penance of recollection is granted to Nanda, the son of Sudāsa, who was accused by the monks of having committed a defeating offense. He said, “I do not remember.” They should be made to remember or not remember.

original: gsol ba dang las @152b gnyis kyis dran pas 'dul ba sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba dang las @152b gnyis kyis dran pas 'dul ba sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The penance of recollection is granted by means of a proposal and a single action.

original: ma myos pas 'dul ba ni ji ltar dge slong bye ma can myos pa'i tshe byas pa mi dran pas gnang gis nam dran pa tshun chad snga ma rjes su zhugs te byas pa ni nyes pa bshags dgos kyi nam dran pa'i mtshams soms shig ces ma myos
analyzed: ma myos pas 'dul ba ni ji ltar dge slong bye ma can myos pa'i tshe byas pa mi dran pas gnang gis nam dran pa tshun chad snga ma rjes su zhugs te byas pa ni nyes pa bshags dgos kyi nam dran pa'i mtshams soms shig ces ma myos
translated: The penance of non-delusion is like the case of the monk Bhikṣaṇa, who was granted a penance because he did not remember what he had done while he was insane. He was told, “Remember from now on what you have done.”

original: pa'i 'dul ba gsol ba dang las gnyis kyis sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: pa'i 'dul ba gsol ba dang las gnyis kyis sbyin par bya'o //
translated: and the two actions of requesting and giving.

original: gang mos pa'i tshe glengs pa ni chos bzhin du glengs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang mos pa'i tshe glengs pa ni chos bzhin du glengs pa ma yin no //
translated: When one is not interested in the time of the accusation, the accusation is not in accordance with the Dharma.

original: nyes pa'i rtsod pa la zhi bar bya ba rnam pa bzhis zhi bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyes pa'i rtsod pa la zhi bar bya ba rnam pa bzhis zhi bar bya ste /
translated: In the case of a dispute over a fault, there are four kinds of settlement:

original: mngon sum gyis zhi bar bya ba dang / khas len pas zhi bar bya ba dang / de'i ngo bo nyid tshol bas zhi bar bya ba dang / rtsva bkram pa lta bus zhi bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis zhi bar bya ba dang / khas len pas zhi bar bya ba dang / de'i ngo bo nyid tshol bas zhi bar bya ba dang / rtsva bkram pa lta bus zhi bar bya ba'o //
translated: settlement by direct perception, settlement by acknowledgment, settlement by searching for the essential nature, and settlement by the method of spreading grass.

original: de la mngon sum gyis zhi bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la mngon sum gyis zhi bar bya ba ni /
translated: Settlement by direct perception is as follows.🔽Beginning with the expulsion of Krishna,

original: ri dags dgra'i bu nag po spang ba las brtsams te /
analyzed: ri dags dgra'i bu nag po spang ba las brtsams te /
translated: the son of Ajātaśatru,

original: rgol ba dang / lan ldon pa dang / chos bzhin bya ba mngon sum du gyis shig ces 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba dang / lan ldon pa dang / chos bzhin bya ba mngon sum du gyis shig ces 'byung ba'o //
translated: the Buddha said, “You should settle disputes, respond to objections, and act in accordance with the Dharma by means of direct perception.”

original: khas len pas zhi bar bya ba ni /
analyzed: khas len pas zhi bar bya ba ni /
translated: Settlement by acknowledgment is as follows.

original: nyes pa byas pa pha rol gyis glengs kyang rung ma glengs kyang rung ste /
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa pha rol gyis glengs kyang rung ma glengs kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not the opponent accuses you of a fault,

original: rang gis chos bzhin du bshags shing mthol bas zhi bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gis chos bzhin du bshags shing mthol bas zhi bar bya ba'o //
translated: It is pacified by confessing and revealing in accordance with the Dharma.🔽The pacification of disputes by investigating the nature of the offense is like the case of the monk Hastaka.

original: ngo bo nyid tshol bas zhi bar bya ba ni dge slong lag pa can lta bu yang dang yang smyon cing khas len pa ni nyes pa'i dmigs gtan la ma phebs shing gang yin pa gtol med pas /🔽gang yin pa gtan la 'bebs shing ngo bo nyid tshol ba'i 'dul ba las na sbyin pa yin no //🔽rtsva bkram pa lta bus 'dul ba sbyin pa ni /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid tshol bas zhi bar bya ba ni dge slong lag pa can lta bu yang dang yang smyon cing khas len pa ni nyes pa'i dmigs gtan la ma phebs shing gang yin pa gtol med pas / gang yin pa gtan la 'bebs shing ngo bo nyid tshol ba'i 'dul ba las na sbyin pa yin no // rtsva bkram pa lta bus 'dul ba sbyin pa ni /
translated: The pacification of disputes by the method of spreading grass is like the case of the dispute between the monks of Kauśāmbī.

original: rtsod pa phyogs gnyis su chad de /
analyzed: rtsod pa phyogs gnyis su chad de /
translated: The pacification of disputes by the method of the majority is like the case of the dispute between the monks of Vṛji.🔽The pacification of disputes by the method of the covering over as if with grass is like the case of the dispute between the monks of Vṛji and the monks of Vaiśālī.

original: gnas pa la phyogs gnyis ka'i gtso bo gnyis rang rang gi phyogs la bsgo ste /🔽gcig la gcig bzod par gsol zhing nyes pa bshags te bsdu bas zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa la phyogs gnyis ka'i gtso bo gnyis rang rang gi phyogs la bsgo ste / gcig la gcig bzod par gsol zhing nyes pa bshags te bsdu bas zhi bar bya'o //
translated: The pacification of disputes by the method of the majority is like the case of the dispute between the monks of Vṛji and the monks of Vaiśālī.

original: bya bas rtsod pa ni las brgya rtsa gcig las glengs te /
analyzed: bya bas rtsod pa ni las brgya rtsa gcig las glengs te /
translated: The pacification of disputes by the method of the covering over as if with grass is like the case of the dispute between the monks of Vṛji and the monks of Vaiśālī.

original: ltung ba ris lnga las rtsod pa byung ba na rtsod pa gong ma kun zhi ni 'di yang zhi bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ltung ba ris lnga las rtsod pa byung ba na rtsod pa gong ma kun zhi ni 'di yang zhi bar 'gyur te /
translated: From among the five classes of downfalls, when a dispute arises, all higher disputes are pacified by this, and so it is pacified.
