original: dge 'dun kun mthun zhing 'dum pas zhi ba'i phyir zhi bar bya ba lhag par bya ba med de /
analyzed: dge 'dun kun mthun zhing 'dum pas zhi ba'i phyir zhi bar bya ba lhag par bya ba med de /
translated: Because the entire saṅgha is in agreement and harmony, there is no higher pacification to be done.

original: de ltar na rtsod pa bzhi la zhi bar bya ba bdun te /
analyzed: de ltar na rtsod pa bzhi la zhi bar bya ba bdun te /
translated: Thus, there are seven pacifications for the four disputes.

original: mngon sum dang / tshul shing mang po len pa dang / dran pa dang / ma myos pa dang / ngo bo nyid tshol ba dang / rtsva bkram pa dang / khas blang bar bya ba lta bus zhi bar bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: mngon sum dang / tshul shing mang po len pa dang / dran pa dang / ma myos pa dang / ngo bo nyid tshol ba dang / rtsva bkram pa dang / khas blang bar bya ba lta bus zhi bar bya'o zhe'o //
translated: They are pacified by the seven pacifications: by direct perception, by taking many voting tickets, by recollection, by non-delusion, by investigating the nature, by spreading grass, and by accepting.

original: de dag gi dngos po zhi bar byed pas na zhi bar byed pa bdun po ni phas pham pa man chad nyes byas yan chad kyi nang du ma gtogs so //🔽rtsod pa zhi @153a * //
analyzed: de dag gi dngos po zhi bar byed pas na zhi bar byed pa bdun po ni phas pham pa man chad nyes byas yan chad kyi nang du ma gtogs so // rtsod pa zhi @153a * //
translated: Since they pacify the substance of those, the seven pacifications are not included within the minor infractions and below, down to the defeating offenses.

original: pa mi brjed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: pa mi brjed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: This is the chapter on the pacification of disputes.

original: ming mkhan tsam mo //
analyzed: ming mkhan tsam mo //
translated: It is merely a designation.

original: tshe dang lan pa dag bdag gis yongs su dag pa rig par bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: tshe dang lan pa dag bdag gis yongs su dag pa rig par bya ste zhes bya ba nas /
translated: I should know the purity of life and the purity of speech.

original: de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba yan chad ni yongs su dag cing gtsang bar byas pas bar du gcod par mi 'gyur zhing las su byas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba yan chad ni yongs su dag cing gtsang bar byas pas bar du gcod par mi 'gyur zhing las su byas pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase one should hold it in that way and so forth indicates that it is purified and cleansed, and that it is an action that does not create obstacles.

original: gleng gzhi dang phas pham pa nas /
analyzed: gleng gzhi dang phas pham pa nas /
translated: The Introduction, the Defeats,🔽and the five classes of downfalls have been explained.

original: ltung ba ris lnga po bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni gong du kun smras zin mod kyis /
analyzed: ltung ba ris lnga po bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni gong du kun smras zin mod kyis /
translated: Although they have been mentioned above,

original: 'on kyang g-yeng bas kha cig mgo ba dag yod pas /
analyzed: 'on kyang g-yeng bas kha cig mgo ba dag yod pas /
translated: some people are confused and forgetful.

original: yang bzlas nas bsdus te smras pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang bzlas nas bsdus te smras pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, they are summarized and mentioned again.

original: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: The Blessed One, the Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: yon tan las mtshan du gsol ba ni gong ma dag dang mthun no //
analyzed: yon tan las mtshan du gsol ba ni gong ma dag dang mthun no //
translated: The name is given based on his qualities, as before.

original: de'i mdor gtogs zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'bum gyi mdo so sor thar pa 'di nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i mdor gtogs zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba 'bum gyi mdo so sor thar pa 'di nyid do zhe'o //
translated: The phrase included in his sutras means that this very Sutra on Individual Liberation is in the sutra of the Vinaya in a hundred thousand sections.

original: mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don du 'dus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdus zhes bya ba ni tshig dang don du 'dus pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase in brief refers to the collection of words and meanings.

original: de dag tu zad do zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa la bya'i rgyas par 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / phran tshegs la sogs pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'ang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag tu zad do zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa la bya'i rgyas par 'dul ba rnam par 'byed pa dang / phran tshegs la sogs pa'i nang nas 'byung ba'ang rig par bya'o //
translated: The phrase they are exhausted in those refers to the brief presentation, but one should know that the extensive presentation is found in the Vinaya, the Ksudraka, and so forth.

original: 'o na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos der zad dam zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na bsgrub par bya ba'i chos der zad dam zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If one asks, Are the phenomena to be accomplished exhausted in those? the answer is no.

original: gang gzhan nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang gzhan nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The phrase whatever is found elsewhere and so forth is stated.

original: gzhan nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i dngos po dang gzhung dam pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan nas 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dul ba'i dngos po dang gzhung dam pa la sogs pa la bya'o //
translated: The phrase found elsewhere refers to the Vinaya, the Ksudraka, and so forth.

original: gcig tu mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
analyzed: gcig tu mthun pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni chos ni mya ngan las 'das pa la bya ste /
translated: The phrase the Dharma that is in complete agreement means that the Dharma is nirvana.

original: de dang mthun pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa gang zhe na /
translated: If one asks, What is in complete agreement with that?

original: mdo sde dang ma mo dag las 'byung ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag la yang bslab par bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde dang ma mo dag las 'byung ba bsgrub par bya ba'i chos gang yin pa de dag la yang bslab par bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: The answer is that the phenomena to be accomplished that are found in the sutras and the mātṛkā should also be trained in. This is the teaching.

original: khyed rnams zhes bya ba ni gang bstan pa la zhugs shing 'khor ba na'ang 'dug pa'i nyan thos rnams la bya'o //
analyzed: khyed rnams zhes bya ba ni gang bstan pa la zhugs shing 'khor ba na'ang 'dug pa'i nyan thos rnams la bya'o //
translated: The phrase you who are refers to the disciples who have entered the teaching and who are abiding in cyclic existence.

original: 'dum pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun mi rtsod cing 'phrod pa'o //
analyzed: 'dum pa zhes bya ba ni phan tshun mi rtsod cing 'phrod pa'o //
translated: The phrase in harmony means that they do not quarrel with one another and are in agreement.

original: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang 'tsho ba dang / tshul khrims dang cho ga la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
analyzed: mthun pa zhes bya ba ni lta ba dang 'tsho ba dang / tshul khrims dang cho ga la sogs pa tha dad pa ma yin zhing /
translated: The phrase in concord means that they do not differ in their views, livelihood, morality, ritual, etc.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos dang / rnam par grol ba'i phyogs su bsgrub par mthun pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos dang / rnam par grol ba'i phyogs su bsgrub par mthun pa'o //
translated: They are in concord in that they are dedicated to the Dharma of nirvana and to the attainment of liberation.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs 'phel bar dga' zhing ting nge 'dzin mngon par bsgrub par la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i phyogs 'phel bar dga' zhing ting nge 'dzin mngon par bsgrub par la dga' ba'o //
translated: The phrase in joy means that they delight in the growth of virtue and in the attainment of meditative concentration.

original: mi rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo 'gyed pa'am /🔽shags su rtsod pa'am /
analyzed: mi rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni 'thab mo 'gyed pa'am / shags su rtsod pa'am /
translated: The phrase without quarreling means that they do not engage in disputes,🔽contentions,

original: gcig la gcig ma tshang 'dru zhing rgol ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la gcig ma tshang 'dru zhing rgol ba med pa'o //
translated: or arguments with one another.

original: sems kun du bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: sems kun du bsrung ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase guarding the mind means that they are not attached to their own views.

original: tshangs @153b pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi yid dang mi 'gal bar sems bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: tshangs @153b pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams kyi yid dang mi 'gal bar sems bsrung ba'o //
translated: One should protect one's mind so as not to contradict the minds of one's fellow brahmacarins.

original: dran pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang mi bya ba gnyis las bsams pa'i thog mar gtong zhing blos zin pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba dang mi bya ba gnyis las bsams pa'i thog mar gtong zhing blos zin pa'o //
translated: The term mindfulness means to be aware of what is to be done and what is not to be done, and to be attentive to the beginning of thought.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba la sems spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa dang / tshul khrims bsrung ba la sems spro bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The term joy means to delight the mind in the practice and in the protection of morality.

original: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bstan pa'i gnas rnams la yang bslab cing brtson par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: brtson par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar gong du bstan pa'i gnas rnams la yang bslab cing brtson par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: The term endeavor means to train and to strive in the above-mentioned practices.

original: de la 'di man chad ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la /
analyzed: de la 'di man chad ni sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la /
translated: From here on, the text states: In the past, the disciples of the Tathagata...

original: so sor thar pa mang nyung ngam khyad yod dam med dam de dag gis nyan thos cis 'dul na /
analyzed: so sor thar pa mang nyung ngam khyad yod dam med dam de dag gis nyan thos cis 'dul na /
translated: Were there many or few prātimokṣas, or were there differences? By what were the disciples disciplined?

original: de'i tshe da ltar gyis so sor thar pa 'dra ba med dam /
analyzed: de'i tshe da ltar gyis so sor thar pa 'dra ba med dam /
translated: At that time, were there prātimokṣas like the present ones, or not?

original: de dag gis cis 'dul zhes gang yin pa de dag gis so sor thar pa 'dra ba med cing 'dul ba yang ma bshad ma bstan na ni /
analyzed: de dag gis cis 'dul zhes gang yin pa de dag gis so sor thar pa 'dra ba med cing 'dul ba yang ma bshad ma bstan na ni /
translated: how can they be liberated?

original: de dag kyang ji ltar rnam par grol zhes de lta bu'i rtog pa bsal ba dang / bskal pa bzang po tshun chad de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs nas /
analyzed: de dag kyang ji ltar rnam par grol zhes de lta bu'i rtog pa bsal ba dang / bskal pa bzang po tshun chad de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs nas /
translated: In order to dispel such thoughts, the Buddha taught the pratimoksa of the seven buddhas of the fortunate eon, beginning with Vipashyin.

original: da ltar gyi sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pa phan chad dang / sangs rgyas rabs bdun po de dag gi tshe na sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa lnga pa rnams kyang /🔽de dag cig 'dul ji ltar rnam par grol ba dang / sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i tshe sems can rnams bsod nams dman pa dbang po rtul ba /
analyzed: da ltar gyi sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pa phan chad dang / sangs rgyas rabs bdun po de dag gi tshe na sngon gyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i nyan thos rnams la so sor thar pa lnga pa rnams kyang / de dag cig 'dul ji ltar rnam par grol ba dang / sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i tshe sems can rnams bsod nams dman pa dbang po rtul ba /
translated: He taught the five pratimokshas of the shravakas of the previous tathagatas during the time of the seven buddhas, from Vipashyin up to Shakyamuni.🔽He taught how they were liberated and how they were trained.

original: shes rab zhan pas bslab pa'i gnas ci dang ji ltar bcas ston par bzhed de /
analyzed: shes rab zhan pas bslab pa'i gnas ci dang ji ltar bcas ston par bzhed de /
translated: He taught the present Buddha Shakyamuni how to teach the precepts to sentient beings of the present age, who have little merit, dull faculties, and weak prajna.🔽He taught him how to teach the precepts.

original: bzod pa dka' thub dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston to //
analyzed: bzod pa dka' thub dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston to //
translated: The verse Patience is the highest austerity and so on is taught.

original: de la bzod pa dka' thub dam pa zhes pa nas shlo ka gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs kyi sku ring la /
analyzed: de la bzod pa dka' thub dam pa zhes pa nas shlo ka gcig gis de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs kyi sku ring la /
translated: In that verse, from Patience is the highest austerity up to the end of the verse,

original: dag slong dag dang sems can dag phal cher log pa'i brtul zhugs lus kyi dka' thub la dad nas /
analyzed: dag slong dag dang sems can dag phal cher log pa'i brtul zhugs lus kyi dka' thub la dad nas /
translated: beggars and most sentient beings have faith in the wrong austerities, physical austerities.

original: lta ba de las bzlog cing de'i gnyen por shlo ka gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: lta ba de las bzlog cing de'i gnyen por shlo ka gcig gis bstan to //
translated: That view is refuted and its antidote is taught in one verse.

original: de yang rnam pa bzhi lta bu'i tshul gyis dad de /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa bzhi lta bu'i tshul gyis dad de /
translated: That is also faith in the manner of the four kinds.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: lus kyi dka' thub la dad pa dang / dka' thub kyi nan tan la dad pa dang / dka' thub kyi 'bras bu la dad pa dang / dka' thub ston pa'i gang zag la dad pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dka' thub la dad pa dang / dka' thub kyi nan tan la dad pa dang / dka' thub kyi 'bras bu la dad pa dang / dka' thub ston pa'i gang zag la dad pa'o //
translated: Faith in physical austerities, faith in the practice of austerities, faith in the result of austerities, and faith in the person who teaches austerities.

original: de la lus dka' thub ji ltar 'dra ba dag la spyod cing gnas she na /
analyzed: de la lus dka' thub ji ltar 'dra ba dag la spyod cing gnas she na /
translated: How do they practice and abide in austerities that are similar to the body?

original: chur mchongs pa dang / wa'i brtul zhugs dang / khyi'i brtul zhugs dang / tshe gcig tu thal ba'i nang du 'greng @154a * //
analyzed: chur mchongs pa dang / wa'i brtul zhugs dang / khyi'i brtul zhugs dang / tshe gcig tu thal ba'i nang du 'greng @154a * //
translated: jumping into water,

original: zhing phur bu 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhing phur bu 'dzin pa lta bu'o //
translated: the practice of the jackal, the practice of the dog, and standing in ashes for one’s whole life while holding a dagger.

original: de yang ji ltar de la dad ce na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar de la dad ce na /
translated: How can one have faith in that?

original: mu stegs can gyi log pa'i dka' thub de lta bu dag byas na /
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi log pa'i dka' thub de lta bu dag byas na /
translated: If one performs such wrong austerities of the tīrthikas,

original: las rnying pa ni dka' thub byas pas 'phya zhing zad par 'gyur /
analyzed: las rnying pa ni dka' thub byas pas 'phya zhing zad par 'gyur /
translated: one’s old karma is destroyed by performing austerities.

original: las sar pa ni ma byas ma spyad pas na chu lon bzhin te /
analyzed: las sar pa ni ma byas ma spyad pas na chu lon bzhin te /
translated: One’s new karma is like a dam, because one does not perform or practice it.

original: tshe phyi ma la zag pa zad pas /
analyzed: tshe phyi ma la zag pa zad pas /
translated: In the next life, through the exhaustion of defilements,

original: las zad pas sdug bsngal zad de /
analyzed: las zad pas sdug bsngal zad de /
translated: suffering is exhausted through the exhaustion of karma.

original: sdug bsngal zad pas grol thar cing mthar phyin par gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zad pas grol thar cing mthar phyin par gyur te /
translated: Through the exhaustion of suffering, one is liberated, freed, and perfected.

original: de ltar ston pa ni dge sbyong yon no zhes zer te /
analyzed: de ltar ston pa ni dge sbyong yon no zhes zer te /
translated: Teaching that is called the virtue of the ascetic.

original: de'i gnyen por log pa'i dka' thub rnam pa bzhir lta ba las phral nas /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por log pa'i dka' thub rnam pa bzhir lta ba las phral nas /
translated: As an antidote to that, one should abandon the four kinds of wrong austerities and

original: yang dag pa'i dka' thub lta bu la bsten pa'i bya'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i dka' thub lta bu la bsten pa'i bya'o //
translated: rely on the practice of the correct austerities.

original: zhi gang zhe na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dad pa dang / dka' thub kyi nan tan bden pa bzhi'i yon tan la nan tan byed pa dang / dka' thub kyi 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs nas dgra bcom pa'i bar dag ste /
analyzed: zhi gang zhe na 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la dad pa dang / dka' thub kyi nan tan bden pa bzhi'i yon tan la nan tan byed pa dang / dka' thub kyi 'bras bu ni rgyun du zhugs nas dgra bcom pa'i bar dag ste /
translated: What is tranquility? It is faith in the four noble truths and the practice of austerities.

original: bden pa bzhi'o 'bras bu la bya'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'o 'bras bu la bya'o //
translated: The result of austerities is the fruits of stream-entry, etc., up to arhatship.

original: ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs la dad par bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: ston pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnam par gzigs la dad par bya'o zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: The Teacher is the Tathagata.

original: da lta bas na dka' thub thams cad kyi nang na chos la bzod pa ni dam pa ste /
analyzed: da lta bas na dka' thub thams cad kyi nang na chos la bzod pa ni dam pa ste /
translated: Therefore, in all austerities, the acceptance of the Dharma is the best.

original: de la ji ltar bzod pa zhe na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bzod pa zhe na /
translated: How is it accepted?

original: sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i chos rnams la bzod pa dang de nyid dam par bstan to //
analyzed: sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i chos rnams la bzod pa dang de nyid dam par bstan to //
translated: It is accepted by the mind in the Dharma of the four noble truths.

original: de la bzod pa yang gsum ste /
analyzed: de la bzod pa yang gsum ste /
translated: Acceptance is of three kinds:

original: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa la mi mjed pa'i bzod pa dang / sdug bsngal la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa dang / chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: acceptance of not retaliating against harm, acceptance of not being upset by suffering, and acceptance of ascertaining the Dharma.

original: de ltar bzod pa rnam pa gsum gyi nang na yang chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa dam pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa rnam pa gsum gyi nang na yang chos la nges par rtog pa'i bzod pa dam pa ste /
translated: Thus, from among the three kinds of patience, the patience of the certainty of the Dharma is the highest.

original: de ltar sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la phyin ci ma log par shes par bgyis brtags te /
analyzed: de ltar sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la phyin ci ma log par shes par bgyis brtags te /
translated: Thus, having investigated with the mind the four noble truths without error,🔽one is patient in abiding with one-pointed mind on the phenomena of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and selflessness.

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba dang / bdag med pa'i chos la sems rtse gcig tu gnas par bzod pa de nyid kyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bas dam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba dang / bdag med pa'i chos la sems rtse gcig tu gnas par bzod pa de nyid kyis mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bas dam pa yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Since one attains nirvana through just that patience, it is the highest.

original: lus kyi dka' thub kyis mya ngan las 'da'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dka' thub kyis mya ngan las 'da'o //
translated: Nirvana is attained through physical austerities.

original: zhes sangs rgyas kyis ma gsungs pas na /
analyzed: zhes sangs rgyas kyis ma gsungs pas na /
translated: The Buddha did not say this.

original: lus kyi dka' thub ni mchog dam pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lus kyi dka' thub ni mchog dam pa ma yin te /
translated: Physical austerities are not the highest.

original: de las 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir de'i sems kyi bzod pa de nyid kyis na mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi 'bras bu thob po zhes sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de las 'phags par bstan pa'i phyir de'i sems kyi bzod pa de nyid kyis na mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi 'bras bu thob po zhes sangs rgyas kyis bka' stsal te /
translated: In order to teach that they are inferior, the Buddha said that one attains the highest fruit of nirvana through just that mental patience.

original: sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba ni yid ches par bstan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gsung zhes bya ba ni yid ches par bstan pa'i tshig go //
translated: The phrase “the speech of the Buddha” refers to the words of the Buddha, which are trustworthy.

original: mya ngan las 'das pas zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyun bcad de /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pas zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba'i rgyun bcad de /
translated: The phrase “having attained nirvana” means that the continuum of cyclic existence has been severed.

original: bsgrub @154b par bya ba'i mthar phyin cing /
analyzed: bsgrub @154b par bya ba'i mthar phyin cing /
translated: The goal that is to be accomplished has been reached.

original: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: This is the nirvana in which there are no residual aggregates.

original: de ltar na sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten cing bgrod pas na /🔽mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi 'bras bu dam pa 'thob kyis lus kyi dka' thub dam pa ma yin no zhe'o //🔽mchog ces bya ba ni mu stegs can dag lus shin tu sdug bsngal zhing /
analyzed: de ltar na sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la brten cing bgrod pas na / mya ngan las 'das pa mchog gi 'bras bu dam pa 'thob kyis lus kyi dka' thub dam pa ma yin no zhe'o // mchog ces bya ba ni mu stegs can dag lus shin tu sdug bsngal zhing /
translated: Thus, because the mind is what relies on and traverses the four noble truths,🔽it is the mind that attains the supreme result of nirvana, not the body’s austerities.

original: lus yongs su gdungs par dka' thub byas pas mya ngan las 'da' ba thong po zhes 'chad pa dag kyang yod do //
analyzed: lus yongs su gdungs par dka' thub byas pas mya ngan las 'da' ba thong po zhes 'chad pa dag kyang yod do //
translated: The word “supreme” refers to the fact that there are some non-Buddhists who claim that nirvana is attained by means of the body’s austerities, which are extremely difficult to perform and cause the body to be tormented.

original: de dag gi gtol med par nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa bde zhing skyon med pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rang bzhin thob pas na mya ngan las 'das pa mchog ces smos so //🔽rab tu byung ba gzhan la gnod pa dang // gzhan la 'tshe ba dge sbyong ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi gtol med par nyon mongs pa thams cad spangs pa bde zhing skyon med pa mya ngan las 'da' ba'i rang bzhin thob pas na mya ngan las 'das pa mchog ces smos so // rab tu byung ba gzhan la gnod pa dang // gzhan la 'tshe ba dge sbyong ma yin no //
translated: Since they attain the nature of nirvana, which is blissful and faultless, due to abandoning all afflictions without exception, it is called “supreme nirvana.”

original: zhes pa shlo ka phyed ni lus kyi dka' thub ston pa la dad pa'i gnyen por gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa shlo ka phyed ni lus kyi dka' thub ston pa la dad pa'i gnyen por gsungs te /
translated: The half-verse “One who is ordained but harms others is not an ascetic” is stated as the antidote to faith in the teacher of physical austerities.

original: rab tu byung ba ni khyim gyi gnas thams cad spangs nas /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni khyim gyi gnas thams cad spangs nas /
translated: One who is ordained is one who has abandoned all the states of a householder and

original: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la zhugs pa ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gsol ba dang zhu ba'i las kyis legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la zhugs pa ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: has entered the well-spoken Dharma and Vinaya through the acts of requesting and asking.

original: de lta bur rab tu byung ba ni pha rol po gzhan dag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang phral nas phan pa dang bde ba sbyin zhing bstan pa'i rigs kyi /
analyzed: de lta bur rab tu byung ba ni pha rol po gzhan dag sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos dang phral nas phan pa dang bde ba sbyin zhing bstan pa'i rigs kyi /
translated: One who is ordained in this way should separate others from sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas and should teach them and give them benefit and happiness.

original: ci ste lus kyi dka' thub gzhan la gnod cing don med pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis smad cing bsngags pa ma yin pa de lta bu bya bar ston pa ni gzhan la yang dag par gnod cing gtse ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung dang
analyzed: ci ste lus kyi dka' thub gzhan la gnod cing don med pa de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis smad cing bsngags pa ma yin pa de lta bu bya bar ston pa ni gzhan la yang dag par gnod cing gtse ba yin pas de bzhin gshegs pa'i lung dang
translated: If you say that the ascetic practices of the body are harmful to others and pointless, the Tathagatas have condemned them and do not praise them.

original: 'gal bas na de lta bu ston pa ni dge sbyong ma yin no zhe'o //
analyzed: 'gal bas na de lta bu ston pa ni dge sbyong ma yin no zhe'o //
translated: Since they are in conflict with the scriptures of the Tathagatas, those who teach such practices are not ascetics.

original: 'o na dge sbyong zhes bya ba ji lta bu la bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dge sbyong zhes bya ba ji lta bu la bya zhe na /
translated: What is an ascetic?

original: sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rtog par bzod pa /
analyzed: sems kyis 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la rtog par bzod pa /
translated: He is one who patiently contemplates the four noble truths with his mind.

original: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi mngon par bsgrub cing tshul dbyung ba zhi ba /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi 'bras bu bzhi mngon par bsgrub cing tshul dbyung ba zhi ba /
translated: He is one who accomplishes and demonstrates the four fruits of asceticism.

original: dge ba la gcig tu 'dun cing gnas pa de dag la dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
analyzed: dge ba la gcig tu 'dun cing gnas pa de dag la dge sbyong zhes bya ste /
translated: He is one who is intent and remains in virtue.

original: de bas na de lta bu'i lus kyi dka' thub don med pa la dang bar mi bya'o /
analyzed: de bas na de lta bu'i lus kyi dka' thub don med pa la dang bar mi bya'o /
translated: Therefore, do not have faith in such pointless ascetic practices of the body.

original: sems kyi dka' thub dam pa gang yin pa la dad par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: sems kyi dka' thub dam pa gang yin pa la dad par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Have faith in the supreme ascetic practice of the mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gtsug tor can gyi sku ring la de bzhin gshegs pa de'i nyan thos dang / sems can dag tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / dge ba spyad pa rnams mtho ris bzang 'gror skye ba dang / mtho ris kyi longs spyod thob par shog ces smon lam 'debs shing tshangs par spyad pas na de nyid mi rigs shing 'gal bas na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gtsug tor can gyi sku ring la de bzhin gshegs pa de'i nyan thos dang / sems can dag tshul khrims bsrung ba dang / dge ba spyad pa rnams mtho ris bzang 'gror skye ba dang / mtho ris kyi longs spyod thob par shog ces smon lam 'debs shing tshangs par spyad pas na de nyid mi rigs shing 'gal bas na /
translated: When the Tathagata Sikhin was a bodhisattva, he made this vow: May I, in the presence of the Tathagata, protect the morality of his disciples and sentient beings, and may they practice virtue, be born in the good destinies of the higher realms, and obtain the enjoyments of the higher realms.

original: @155a * // de ltar lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir gnyen por mthu rtsal mig dang ldan par zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gsungs so //
analyzed: @155a * // de ltar lta ba bzlog pa'i phyir gnyen por mthu rtsal mig dang ldan par zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gsungs so //
translated: In order to refute such a view, one verse is stated as an antidote, with the word might.

original: mthu rtsal zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang shes rab kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: mthu rtsal zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang shes rab kyi tshogs te /
translated: The word might refers to the accumulation of merit and wisdom,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthu rtsal yod pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i mthu rtsal yod pa la bya'o //
translated: and it is said to be the might of nirvana.

original: mig dang ldan pa ni shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa la bya ste /
analyzed: mig dang ldan pa ni shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa la bya ste /
translated: The word endowed refers to being endowed with the eye of wisdom,

original: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par byed pa'i mig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: phung po ma lus pa'i mya ngan las 'da' ba thob par byed pa'i mig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: and being endowed with the eye that brings about the attainment of nirvana without remainder.

original: mthu rtsal dang mig ces bya ba ni dper bstan pa ste /
analyzed: mthu rtsal dang mig ces bya ba ni dper bstan pa ste /
translated: The example of strength and eyes is taught.

original: 'jig rten na skye bo mthu rtsal med cing nyam chung ba dang / mig med cing mig dang ldan pa'i mi ni grog po dang tsher ma dang g-yangs dag tu 'gro zhing ltung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten na skye bo mthu rtsal med cing nyam chung ba dang / mig med cing mig dang ldan pa'i mi ni grog po dang tsher ma dang g-yangs dag tu 'gro zhing ltung ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
translated: In the world, a person who is weak and powerless and who is blind, falls into ditches, thorns, and abysses while walking.

original: su mthu rtsal dang mig dang ldan pa'i skye bo ni lam mi bde ba dang nyam nga ba thams cad las 'byol zhing mthu rtsal dang ldan pas na la mnyam nga pa thams cad las 'da' bar byed do /
analyzed: su mthu rtsal dang mig dang ldan pa'i skye bo ni lam mi bde ba dang nyam nga ba thams cad las 'byol zhing mthu rtsal dang ldan pas na la mnyam nga pa thams cad las 'da' bar byed do /
translated: But a person who is strong and has eyes avoids all difficult and dangerous paths and, because he is strong, he crosses over all difficult terrain.

original: mig dang ldan pas na grog por mi ltung zhing lam nyam nga ba las thar bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig dang ldan pas na grog por mi ltung zhing lam nyam nga ba las thar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because he has eyes, he does not fall into ditches and escapes from dangerous paths.

original: de bas na skyes bu mig dang ldan pas lam nyam nga ba spong zhing lam bde bar 'gro ba'i rigs sos //
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu mig dang ldan pas lam nyam nga ba spong zhing lam bde bar 'gro ba'i rigs sos //
translated: Therefore, a person who has eyes should avoid dangerous paths and travel on good paths.

original: de bzhin du bsod nams kyi mthu rtsal dang ldan zhing shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos mtha' yun du bde zhing dpe med pa btang ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsod nams kyi mthu rtsal dang ldan zhing shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pas kyang mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos mtha' yun du bde zhing dpe med pa btang ste /
translated: Likewise, those who have the power of merit and the eye of wisdom should not abandon the Dharma of nirvana, which is ultimately blissful and incomparable.

original: mtho ris bag med pa'i gnas g-yangs dang 'dra ba zad pa'i mtha' can 'khor ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i gnas ji ltar lam nyal nga zhing mi bde ba de lta bur mkhas pa'i skyes bu dam pa dag der sgrub cing smon pa ni shin tu mi rigs so
analyzed: mtho ris bag med pa'i gnas g-yangs dang 'dra ba zad pa'i mtha' can 'khor ba'i rgyu nyon mongs pa'i gnas ji ltar lam nyal nga zhing mi bde ba de lta bur mkhas pa'i skyes bu dam pa dag der sgrub cing smon pa ni shin tu mi rigs so
translated: It is utterly unreasonable for those who are wise and holy to practice and aspire to the higher realms, which are like a precipice and end in exhaustion, and to the afflictions, which are the cause of cyclic existence.

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: This is taught.

original: nyam nga ba dag yod pa ni de ltar ma tho ris su smon lam 'debs pa nyid khams gsum du 'khor bar 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: nyam nga ba dag yod pa ni de ltar ma tho ris su smon lam 'debs pa nyid khams gsum du 'khor bar 'gyur bas na /
translated: The existence of danger is as follows: Those who aspire to the higher realms will cycle in the three realms.

original: de ltar sgrub cing smon pa nyid nyam nga ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar sgrub cing smon pa nyid nyam nga ba'o //
translated: Thus, practicing and aspiring to that is itself dangerous.

original: yod pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: yod pa ni nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: Existence is the afflictions.

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang / 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: They are the three sufferings and the suffering of formations.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal te /
translated: The suffering of change is in the formless realm.

original: gzugs yod pa'i lha man chad 'dod pa'i khams mo yan chad do //
analyzed: gzugs yod pa'i lha man chad 'dod pa'i khams mo yan chad do //
translated: The gods who have form are below, and the desire realm is above.

original: sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i yang sdug bsngal ba ste /
translated: The suffering of suffering is

original: byol song dang yi dags dang sems can dmyal ba'o //
analyzed: byol song dang yi dags dang sems can dmyal ba'o //
translated: the animal realm, the ghost realm, and the hell realm.

original: sdug bsngal brgyad ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / gnyen sdug pa dang bral ba dang / dgra sdang ba dang phrad pa dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dang / phung po lnga rgyas pa'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal brgyad ni skye ba dang / rga ba dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / gnyen sdug pa dang bral ba dang / dgra sdang ba dang phrad pa dang / 'dod pa mi rnyed pa dang / phung po lnga rgyas pa'i sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: The eight sufferings are birth, old age, sickness, death, separation from what is dear, encountering what is not dear, not obtaining what one wants, and the suffering of the increase of the five aggregates.

original: mkhas pa'i 'tshe ba 'jig rten 'dir zhes bya ba mkhas pa ni bsod nams dang @155b shes rab dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud ldan zhing thob pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa'i 'tshe ba 'jig rten 'dir zhes bya ba mkhas pa ni bsod nams dang @155b shes rab dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dam pa mya ngan las 'das pa'i rgyud ldan zhing thob pa'i thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The harm of the wise in this world is as follows. The wise are holy beings who possess merit and wisdom, who have the lineage of nirvana, and who are skilled in the means of attaining it.

original: 'tsho ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang ldan zhing 'jig rten gnas pa'i gang zag nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga dang ldan zhing 'jig rten gnas pa'i gang zag nyid la bya'o //
translated: Life is the five appropriated aggregates, and it is the person who abides in the world.

original: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni mtho ris su smon lam 'debs pa nyid khams gsum gyi longs spyod la chags pas na /
analyzed: sdig pa zhes bya ba ni mtho ris su smon lam 'debs pa nyid khams gsum gyi longs spyod la chags pas na /
translated: Sin is the aspiration for the higher realms, because one is attached to the enjoyments of the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa dang 'khor ba las nams kyang thar bar mi 'gyur bas de nyid sdig pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang 'khor ba las nams kyang thar bar mi 'gyur bas de nyid sdig pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Since one is never liberated from afflictions and cyclic existence, that is sin.

original: yongs su spong ba ni mig dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yongs su spong ba ni mig dang ldan pas nyon mongs pa spangs nas mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: Abandonment is the abandonment of afflictions by one who has eyes, and then one attains nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyob kyi sku ring la dge sbyong dag phal cher rang gi tshul khrims yongs su sdom pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyob kyi sku ring la dge sbyong dag phal cher rang gi tshul khrims yongs su sdom pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin te /
translated: In the presence of the Tathagata Sarvarakshita, most of the ascetics were content with merely restraining their own ethical discipline.

original: gzhan du mu stegs can gyi dge slong la 'phyas 'dogs shing skur ba 'debs pa na /
analyzed: gzhan du mu stegs can gyi dge slong la 'phyas 'dogs shing skur ba 'debs pa na /
translated: Elsewhere, they disparaged and slandered the ascetics of other traditions.

original: dge sbyong gi don dag kyang chud zos par gyur pas na /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi don dag kyang chud zos par gyur pas na /
translated: Since the meaning of asceticism was wasted,

original: de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyob kyis /
analyzed: de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad skyob kyis /
translated: As an antidote to that, the Tathagata Sarvarakshita🔽said the following half-verse:

original: skur ba mi gdab gnod mi bya //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs te /🔽shlo ka phyed dang gnyis gsungs so //
analyzed: skur ba mi gdab gnod mi bya // zhes bya ba la sogs te / shlo ka phyed dang gnyis gsungs so //
translated: Do not revile, do not harm.

original: skur pa mi gdab pa ni rab tu byung bas mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong la ngag gi sgo nas skur ba mi gdab par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: skur pa mi gdab pa ni rab tu byung bas mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong la ngag gi sgo nas skur ba mi gdab par bstan pa'o //
translated: Do not revile means that a monk should not revile non-Buddhist ascetics verbally.

original: gnod par mi bya ba ni lus kyis mi gtse zhing yid kyis ngan du mi bsams pa ste /
analyzed: gnod par mi bya ba ni lus kyis mi gtse zhing yid kyis ngan du mi bsams pa ste /
translated: Do not harm means that one should not harm them physically or think ill of them mentally.

original: mdor na sgo gsum nas mu stegs can dang skye bo kun la gnod par mi byed cing mi 'tshe ba'o //
analyzed: mdor na sgo gsum nas mu stegs can dang skye bo kun la gnod par mi byed cing mi 'tshe ba'o //
translated: In brief, one should not harm or injure non-Buddhists and all beings in any of the three doors.

original: so sor thar pa'i ni 'gro brgyud lnga las thar par byed pas na thar pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i ni 'gro brgyud lnga las thar par byed pas na thar pa'o //
translated: Liberation is so called because it liberates one from the five classes of beings.

original: bsdam par bya ba ni ltung ba ris lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba ni ltung ba ris lnga la bya ste /
translated: What is to be restrained refers to the five classes of downfalls.

original: de ma ral mi nyams mi 'jig cing shin tu sdoms shig pa'o //
analyzed: de ma ral mi nyams mi 'jig cing shin tu sdoms shig pa'o //
translated: Do not break means that one should not violate, damage, or destroy them, but should restrain oneself very well.

original: zas kyi tshod kyang rig par bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pas zas kyi tshod rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zas kyi tshod kyang rig par bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pas zas kyi tshod rig par bya ste /
translated: The practitioner should know the proper amount of food.🔽If one eats too much, it becomes an obstacle to striving; if one eats too little, one falls to the extreme of being tormented by hunger.

original: ha cang 'grangs ches na brtson 'grus kyi dri mar 'gyur ba dang / ha cang bkres na ni nyon mongs pa mthar ltung bar 'gyur bas brtson 'grus nus shing sems yang ba dang / zas ran par bza'o zhe'o //
analyzed: ha cang 'grangs ches na brtson 'grus kyi dri mar 'gyur ba dang / ha cang bkres na ni nyon mongs pa mthar ltung bar 'gyur bas brtson 'grus nus shing sems yang ba dang / zas ran par bza'o zhe'o //
translated: One should eat the proper amount of food, so that one can strive and the mind remains light.

original: bas mtha'i gnas su gnas par bya //
analyzed: bas mtha'i gnas su gnas par bya //
translated: One should live in a remote place.

original: zhes bya ba ni dgon pa la bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dgon pa la bya ste /
translated: This refers to a forest.

original: de lta bu'i gnas dben par gnas par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gnas dben par gnas par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: One should live in such a solitary place.

original: de ltar na dge slong dag tshul khrims gyis mgu zhing tshul khrims 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig gis chog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na dge slong dag tshul khrims gyis mgu zhing tshul khrims 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig gis chog par mi bya'o //
translated: Thus, monks, one should not be satisfied with just being pleased with morality and observing morality.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa yang sgrub cing bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig tu /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa yang sgrub cing bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tshig tu /
translated: One should also accomplish and cultivate concentration, etc.

original: lhag pa'i sems la yang dag 'jug / ces smos te /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la yang dag 'jug / ces smos te /
translated: The text says, “One should correctly engage the higher mind.”

original: lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sreg pa dang bral ba @156a * //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i sreg pa dang bral ba @156a * //
translated: The so-called higher thought is free from the burning of the defilements.

original: ste / lhag pa'i shes rab dang / lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims la bya'o //
analyzed: ste / lhag pa'i shes rab dang / lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin dang / lhag pa'i tshul khrims la bya'o //
translated: It is the higher wisdom, the higher concentration, and the higher morality.

original: skabs 'dir lhag pa'i skras ni bslab pa gsum char yongs su bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: skabs 'dir lhag pa'i skras ni bslab pa gsum char yongs su bsgrub par bya ba bstan to //
translated: In this context, the higher thought teaches the complete accomplishment of the three trainings.

original: yang gcig tu na tshul khrims kyis mgu zhing chog par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por bstan pas lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya'o zhes kyang 'chad de /
analyzed: yang gcig tu na tshul khrims kyis mgu zhing chog par 'dzin pa'i gnyen por bstan pas lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin 'ba' zhig bsgrub par bya'o zhes kyang 'chad de /
translated: Moreover, it is explained that the higher concentration alone should be accomplished, since it is taught as the antidote to the contentment and satisfaction with morality.

original: de bas na lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ma bsgrubs sam /
analyzed: de bas na lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis ma bsgrubs sam /
translated: Therefore, if one does not accomplish the higher concentration,

original: btsal na mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob ste /
analyzed: btsal na mya ngan las 'das pa mi thob ste /
translated: or if one seeks it, one will not attain nirvana.🔽For it is said:

original: tshul khrims ma god ma ral te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ma god ma ral te /
translated: Even if one’s morality is not impaired or broken,

original: brgyar thub tu zin gyis kyang mtho ris bzang 'gror skye'o zhes 'byung bas na /
analyzed: brgyar thub tu zin gyis kyang mtho ris bzang 'gror skye'o zhes 'byung bas na /
translated: and one is able to endure a hundred hardships, one will be reborn in a good destiny in the higher realms.

original: de bas na lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi sgrub tu mi rung bas de'i gnyen por /
analyzed: de bas na lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin mi sgrub tu mi rung bas de'i gnyen por /
translated: Therefore, since it is not suitable to not accomplish superior meditative stabilization, the antidote to that is stated:

original: lhag pa'i sems la yang dag 'jug / ces smos so //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la yang dag 'jug / ces smos so //
translated: Also, correctly engage in superior mind.

original: yang dag 'jug ces bya ba ni dge slong dgon pa bas bslab pa gsum la gnas shing brtson pa dang spyad par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: yang dag 'jug ces bya ba ni dge slong dgon pa bas bslab pa gsum la gnas shing brtson pa dang spyad par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Correct engagement means that a monk in retreat should abide in and exert himself in the three trainings and practice them.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba ni yid ches par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yid ches par bstan pa'o //
translated: This is taught for the sake of instilling confidence.

original: de de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyi sku ring la de'i nyan thos dag phal cher khe dang bkur sti dang rnyed pa la chags shing grong la lta bar gyur nas 'du 'dzin mang po la spyod pas na /
analyzed: de de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyi sku ring la de'i nyan thos dag phal cher khe dang bkur sti dang rnyed pa la chags shing grong la lta bar gyur nas 'du 'dzin mang po la spyod pas na /
translated: When the Tathagata Vipaśyin was alive, his śrāvakas were mostly attached to gain, honor, and profit and became attached to towns. Since they engaged in much socializing,

original: tshul khrims bsrung zhing ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa la g-yel zhing gnod par gyur nas de ltar lta ba de bzlog cing de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyis gsungs pa /
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung zhing ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa la g-yel zhing gnod par gyur nas de ltar lta ba de bzlog cing de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa log par dad sel gyis gsungs pa /
translated: they neglected to guard moral discipline and to accomplish meditative stabilization. Since they were harmed in that way, in order to reverse that view, the antidote to that, the Tathāgata Vipaśyin taught:

original: ji ltar bung ba me tog ces bya ba shlo ka gcig bstan to //
analyzed: ji ltar bung ba me tog ces bya ba shlo ka gcig bstan to //
translated: Just as a bee, in seeking a flower,

original: bung ba me tog ces bya ba ni dper bstan to //
analyzed: bung ba me tog ces bya ba ni dper bstan to //
translated: The bee is a metaphor.

original: bung ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bya'o //
analyzed: bung ba zhes bya ba ni gang zag la bya'o //
translated: The bee refers to the person.

original: me tog ces bya ba ni grong la bya'o //
analyzed: me tog ces bya ba ni grong la bya'o //
translated: The flower refers to the village.

original: kha dog ni tshul khrims la bya'o //
analyzed: kha dog ni tshul khrims la bya'o //
translated: The color refers to morality.

original: dri ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rol bya'o //
analyzed: dri ni ting nge 'dzin gyi rol bya'o //
translated: The scent refers to the enjoyment of meditative stabilization.

original: yang na kha dog ni skye bo'i longs spyod nor rdzas la bya'o //
analyzed: yang na kha dog ni skye bo'i longs spyod nor rdzas la bya'o //
translated: Alternatively, the color refers to the wealth of the people.

original: dri ni 'phral gyi zas la bya ste /
analyzed: dri ni 'phral gyi zas la bya ste /
translated: The scent refers to the immediate food.

original: mi gnod ces bya ba ni dper na ji ltar bung bas me tog gi khu ba gzhi bas te /
analyzed: mi gnod ces bya ba ni dper na ji ltar bung bas me tog gi khu ba gzhi bas te /
translated: Not harming means, for example, just as a bee, in seeking a flower, takes its nectar and departs without harming the color or scent of the flower.

original: 'gro yang me tog gi dri dang kha dog la mi gnod par 'gro ba bzhin du gang de bzhin gshegs pa yang tshul khrims las mi 'gal zhing ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa la bar chad du mi 'gyur ba dang / skye bo'i longs spyod dang 'phral gyi kha zas la mi chags shing skye bo'i longs spyod la mi gnod par de 'dra ba'i tshul du bsod snyoms la gshegs shing spyod do //
analyzed: 'gro yang me tog gi dri dang kha dog la mi gnod par 'gro ba bzhin du gang de bzhin gshegs pa yang tshul khrims las mi 'gal zhing ting nge 'dzin bsgrub pa la bar chad du mi 'gyur ba dang / skye bo'i longs spyod dang 'phral gyi kha zas la mi chags shing skye bo'i longs spyod la mi gnod par de 'dra ba'i tshul du bsod snyoms la gshegs shing spyod do //
translated: Just as when going, the fragrance and color of the flowers are not harmed, in the same way, the Tathāgata does not violate morality and does not create obstacles to the attainment of concentration, and he is not attached to the enjoyments and immediate food of people and does not harm the enjoyments of people. In that way, he goes and practices for alms.

original: de bas na nyan thos khyed rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su slob pa dang / @156b tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin las mi nyams shing skye bo'i longs spyod la mi gnod cing mi chags par bsod snyoms la rgyu zhing spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na nyan thos khyed rnams kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rjes su slob pa dang / @156b tshul khrims dang ting nge 'dzin las mi nyams shing skye bo'i longs spyod la mi gnod cing mi chags par bsod snyoms la rgyu zhing spyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'o //
translated: Therefore, you disciples should also follow the Tathāgata, and without violating morality and concentration, and without harming and being attached to the enjoyments of people, you should go and practice for alms.

original: yang na thub pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag nyid la bya ste /
analyzed: yang na thub pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag nyid la bya ste /
translated: Or, the one called “sage” is to be taken as referring to the person himself.

original: rang gi rgyud la nyon mongs pas mi 'khor zhing lus dang ngag yid gsum thub pas grong du rgyu ba ni sgo gsum nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar thub pa rnams kyi grong du rgyu bar bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud la nyon mongs pas mi 'khor zhing lus dang ngag yid gsum thub pas grong du rgyu ba ni sgo gsum nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar thub pa rnams kyi grong du rgyu bar bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Since one’s mind is not distracted by afflictions and one’s body, speech, and mind are disciplined, one should wander in the village.

original: de bas na dge slong bsod snyoms blangs nas grong du mi gnas par dgon pa la gnas par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de bas na dge slong bsod snyoms blangs nas grong du mi gnas par dgon pa la gnas par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, a monk who has received alms should not stay in the village, but should stay in the wilderness.

original: des na khe dang bkur sti'i mtha' spangs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: des na khe dang bkur sti'i mtha' spangs par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one should abandon the extremes of gain and honor.

original: bsod snyoms chog pa tsam las lhag par mi len pas ni khe spangs par 'gyur /
analyzed: bsod snyoms chog pa tsam las lhag par mi len pas ni khe spangs par 'gyur /
translated: By not taking more than just enough alms, one abandons gain.🔽By staying in the wilderness in solitude, one abandons honor.

original: dgon pa na dben par gnas pas ni bkur sti spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dgon pa na dben par gnas pas ni bkur sti spangs par 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: This is what is taught.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gser thub kyi sku ring la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gser thub kyi sku ring la /
translated: During the lifetime of the Tathāgata Kanakamuni,

original: de'i nyan thos dag thos pa'i longs spyod la zhugs shing /
analyzed: de'i nyan thos dag thos pa'i longs spyod la zhugs shing /
translated: his disciples engaged in the enjoyment of learning

original: tshul khrims kyi gtam gtan la 'bebs pas na /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi gtam gtan la 'bebs pas na /
translated: and settled the teachings on ethics.

original: kha cig gis yon tan bsngags shing gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba dang / skye bo dag la kha zer zhing 'phyas 'dogs pas na /
analyzed: kha cig gis yon tan bsngags shing gzhan mu stegs can gyi rab tu byung ba dang / skye bo dag la kha zer zhing 'phyas 'dogs pas na /
translated: Some praise his good qualities, others slander him and revile him.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul ma yin pa cher spyod de de'i gnyen por gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul ma yin pa cher spyod de de'i gnyen por gsungs so //
translated: He is a great practitioner of the conduct of holy beings, and this is taught as the antidote to that.

original: bdag gi rigs dang mi rigs dang // zhes shlo ka gcig de bzhin gshegs pa gser thub kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gi rigs dang mi rigs dang // zhes shlo ka gcig de bzhin gshegs pa gser thub kyis gsungs te /
translated: One verse on the analysis of what is proper and improper: What is proper and improper for me?

original: de la rigs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba bsgrub cing spyod pa'i rigs pa'o //
analyzed: de la rigs pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba bsgrub cing spyod pa'i rigs pa'o //
translated: Here, proper means what is proper to practice and cultivate, which is virtue.

original: mi rigs pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spyod par mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos spyod par mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Improper means what is improper to practice and cultivate, which is evil, nonvirtue.

original: brtag par bya ba ni gong ma'i dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis bdag gis dge ba ni ci byas zhes bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la brtag par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: brtag par bya ba ni gong ma'i dge ba dang mi dge ba gnyis bdag gis dge ba ni ci byas zhes bdag gi sems kyi rgyud la brtag par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: What is to be examined is the examination of one's own mindstream, thinking, What virtues and evils have I practiced?

original: gzhan rnams kyis mi mthun pa zhes pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba 'di ni dge slong dang / mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong dang skye bo spyod pa dag bdag gi yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyis mi mthun pa zhes pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba 'di ni dge slong dang / mu stegs can gyi dge sbyong dang skye bo spyod pa dag bdag gi yid du mi 'ong ba'o //
translated: “ Unfavorable” means that others do not agree with me.

original: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyis bdag dang mi mthun pa'i chos gzhan gyis sdig pa byas pa dang / dge ba byas pa la bdag gis 'di ni byas pa legs so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnams kyis bdag dang mi mthun pa'i chos gzhan gyis sdig pa byas pa dang / dge ba byas pa la bdag gis 'di ni byas pa legs so //
translated: They have done evil and I have done good.

original: 'di ni ma byas pas nyes shing 'phyas gdags shing smad par mi bya ba'i phyir /🔽gzhan gyis byas dang ma byas rnams la min //
analyzed: 'di ni ma byas pas nyes shing 'phyas gdags shing smad par mi bya ba'i phyir / gzhan gyis byas dang ma byas rnams la min //
translated: I should not praise them for what they have done, nor should I criticize them for what they have not done.

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: “ I will not be concerned with what others have done or have not done.”

original: mdor na bdag gis nyes pa ci byas legs pa ni gang byas ci yod /
analyzed: mdor na bdag gis nyes pa ci byas legs pa ni gang byas ci yod /
translated: In brief, I should examine and analyze my mind to see what faults I have committed and what good I have done.

original: legs pa ni ji ltar sgrub /
analyzed: legs pa ni ji ltar sgrub /
translated: How can I accomplish what is good?

original: nyes pa ni ji ltar spang /
analyzed: nyes pa ni ji ltar spang /
translated: How can I get rid of my faults?

original: thabs kyis dor ba sems la brtags shing dpyad par ni rigs kyi /
analyzed: thabs kyis dor ba sems la brtags shing dpyad par ni rigs kyi /
translated: It is right to examine and analyze my mind in order to discard them by means of the antidotes.

original: gzhan gyi legs pa nyes pa la 'phyas gdab pa ni mi rigs so zhes de bzhin gshegs pa gser @157a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi legs pa nyes pa la 'phyas gdab pa ni mi rigs so zhes de bzhin gshegs pa gser @157a * //
translated: It is not right to disparage the good qualities of others or to praise their faults.

original: thub kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: thub kyis gsungs so //
translated: Thus spoke the Tathagata Kanakamuni.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi sku ring la //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyi sku ring la //
translated: During the lifetime of the Tathagata Kasyapa,

original: de'i nyan thos phal cher 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi'i rol chags shing mngon par zhen nas /
analyzed: de'i nyan thos phal cher 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi'i rol chags shing mngon par zhen nas /
translated: the majority of his disciples were attached to and fixated on the taste of the worldly four dhyanas.

original: gong du thar pa mi tshol gnyen po la mi brten /
analyzed: gong du thar pa mi tshol gnyen po la mi brten /
translated: They did not seek liberation above that, did not rely on the antidotes,

original: rnam par grol ba snga ma'i sa dag tu rtsom zhing sgrub par mi byed nas /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba snga ma'i sa dag tu rtsom zhing sgrub par mi byed nas /
translated: and did not begin and accomplish the liberation of the earlier stages.

original: de ltar lta ba spang ba'i phyir gnyen por /
analyzed: de ltar lta ba spang ba'i phyir gnyen por /
translated: In order to abandon such views, the antidote

original: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems la bag bya ste //
translated: is to exert oneself in the higher mind.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gnyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyis gsungs te /🔽lhag pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dang mu stegs can la sogs pa lhag pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gnyis de bzhin gshegs pa 'od srungs kyis gsungs te / lhag pa zhes bya ba ni so so'i skye bo dang mu stegs can la sogs pa lhag pa ste /
translated: Thus, two slokas were spoken by the Tathagata Kasyapa.

original: 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi'o //
translated: The higher is the worldly four dhyanas, which are higher than ordinary beings, tirthikas, and so forth.

original: bag bya ba ni dper na tshig tu 'ong gis me la bag byos shig ces ring du spang ba'i don to //
analyzed: bag bya ba ni dper na tshig tu 'ong gis me la bag byos shig ces ring du spang ba'i don to //
translated: Caution means, for example, Caution! Do not get burned by the fire! It means to avoid [harm] from afar.

original: 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi la bag byas na khams gsum gyi khri mon du mi 'khor ro zhe'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi la bag byas na khams gsum gyi khri mon du mi 'khor ro zhe'o //
translated: If one is cautious about the worldly four concentrations, one will not be bound in the prison of the three realms.

original: 'o na de ltar 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi la bsrings shing bag byas na gang la bslab cing bsten par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi la bsrings shing bag byas na gang la bslab cing bsten par bya zhe na /
translated: Well then, if one extends and is cautious about the worldly four concentrations in that way, what should one train in and rely upon?

original: thub pa'i gnas la bslab par bya'o //🔽zhe'o // thub pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag yid gsum thub pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa'i gnas la bslab par bya'o // zhe'o // thub pa zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag yid gsum thub pa ste /
translated: One should train in the Sage's domain.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la bya'o //
translated: As for Sage, it refers to the Tathāgata, who is a sage of body, speech, and mind.

original: de'i gnas ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la bya ste /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad la bya ste /
translated: His domain refers to the four noble truths and the eightfold noble path.

original: de rnams la bslabs shing zhugs na /
analyzed: de rnams la bslabs shing zhugs na /
translated: If one trains in and enters those,

original: 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan ring du spong ba dang / de las 'phags pa rnams byung zhing skye bas na /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan ring du spong ba dang / de las 'phags pa rnams byung zhing skye bas na /
translated: one will avoid the worldly concentrations from afar, and since the noble ones arise and are born from that,

original: thub pa'i skye mched ces bya ste /
analyzed: thub pa'i skye mched ces bya ste /
translated: it is called the Sage's domain.

original: de las rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las rnam par grol ba'i 'bras bu skye zhing 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the result that is complete freedom arises and occurs from that.

original: de bas na nyon mongs pa dang ring du gyur pa'i phyir nyer zhi zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bas na nyon mongs pa dang ring du gyur pa'i phyir nyer zhi zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is called “complete peace” because it is far removed from the mental afflictions.

original: nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa ste de la nyer zhi ni sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad zhi ba la bya'o //
analyzed: nyer zhi rtag tu dran ldan pa ste de la nyer zhi ni sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad zhi ba la bya'o //
translated: “Always mindful of complete peace” means that complete peace refers to the pacification of the three or eight types of suffering.

original: yang na khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa brgyad zhi ba'o //
analyzed: yang na khams gsum gyi mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa brgyad zhi ba'o //
translated: Alternatively, it refers to the pacification of the eighty-eight mental afflictions that are to be abandoned during the path of seeing in the three realms.

original: rtag tu dran ldan pa ni 'bri ba dang gang ba med par rang bzhin gyis shes bzhin dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rtag tu dran ldan pa ni 'bri ba dang gang ba med par rang bzhin gyis shes bzhin dang ldan pa'am /
translated: “Always mindful” means that one is naturally endowed with introspection, without any decrease or increase, or else,

original: bden pa bzhi dang 'phags pa'i lam la sems rtse gcig par gnas pas na rtag tu dran ldan par gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi dang 'phags pa'i lam la sems rtse gcig par gnas pas na rtag tu dran ldan par gnas pa'o //
translated: one is always mindful because one’s mind remains focused on the four noble truths and the noble path.

original: skyob ba mya ngan mi mnga' zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dag kyang de 'dra ba'i thub pa'i gnas la brten te mya ngan mi mnga' zhing nyon mongs pa med pa yin pa de bas na skyob pa zhes yon tan gyis mtshan du gsol te /
analyzed: skyob ba mya ngan mi mnga' zhes bya ba de bzhin gshegs pa dag kyang de 'dra ba'i thub pa'i gnas la brten te mya ngan mi mnga' zhing nyon mongs pa med pa yin pa de bas na skyob pa zhes yon tan gyis mtshan du gsol te /
translated: The Tathagatas are also like that. They are called the protector because they are without sorrow and without affliction, based on the state of the Muni.

original: de'i phyir de'i rjes su dong zhing zhugs pa'i nyan thos dag gis kyang de 'dra bar byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rjes su dong zhing zhugs pa'i nyan thos dag gis kyang de 'dra bar byas te /
translated: Therefore, the Sravakas who follow and enter that state do the same.

original: lhag pa'i sems kyi @157b ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa de spong ngo //
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems kyi @157b ting nge 'dzin gyi ro la chags pa de spong ngo //
translated: They abandon attachment to the taste of the samadhi of superior mind.🔽Or else, the protector is the one who is without sorrow.

original: yang na skyob pa ni gang zad de nyid la bya ste thub pa'i ngas la slob pa'i gang zag gang yin pa des ni rang gi rgyud la nyon mongs pa ldang zhing 'byung bar skyob par nus pas skyob pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: yang na skyob pa ni gang zad de nyid la bya ste thub pa'i ngas la slob pa'i gang zag gang yin pa des ni rang gi rgyud la nyon mongs pa ldang zhing 'byung bar skyob par nus pas skyob pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The person who trains in the Muni's state is able to protect his own mindstream from the arising and occurrence of affliction, so he is called the protector.

original: de nyid skyob pa mya ngan mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de nyid skyob pa mya ngan mi mnga'o //
translated: That very protector is the one without sorrow.

original: zhe'o // tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsum gyis 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi'i ro la chags pa ni mngon par spangs /
analyzed: zhe'o // tshigs su bcad pa 'di gsum gyis 'jig rten gyi bsam gtan bzhi'i ro la chags pa ni mngon par spangs /
translated: The three verses show that attachment to the taste of the worldly four dhyanas is abandoned.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i chos la brten cing bsgoms pas /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i chos la brten cing bsgoms pas /
translated: Relying on and cultivating the Dharma of the four noble truths,

original: mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa brgyad yongs su spangs pas na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam gyis spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa brgyad cu rtsa brgyad yongs su spangs pas na rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: one attains the fruit of stream-entry by completely abandoning the eighty-eight afflictions to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: de lta bu'i gang zag de'i yon tan ni 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i gang zag de'i yon tan ni 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: The qualities of such a person will be as follows.

original: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus it is taught.

original: byis pa bsod nams rab tu 'phel //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gcig bstan te /
analyzed: byis pa bsod nams rab tu 'phel // zhes bya ba la sogs pa shlo ka gcig bstan te /
translated: The child's merit greatly increases.

original: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gnas pas na 'jungs pa dang / ser sna'i dri shin tu spangs te phral bas na /
analyzed: de ltar 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la gnas pas na 'jungs pa dang / ser sna'i dri shin tu spangs te phral bas na /
translated: Thus, by abiding in the four noble truths, the stains of stinginess and miserliness are completely abandoned and removed.

original: bdag gi longs spyod la ma chags shing gtong ba skyong zhing sbyin par byed pa dang / gzhan gyi longs spyod la mi lta bas na ma byin par mi len to //
analyzed: bdag gi longs spyod la ma chags shing gtong ba skyong zhing sbyin par byed pa dang / gzhan gyi longs spyod la mi lta bas na ma byin par mi len to //
translated: He does not take what is not given because he does not covet the wealth of others.

original: ma byin par mi len pas na bsod nams rab tu 'phel lo zhe'o //
analyzed: ma byin par mi len pas na bsod nams rab tu 'phel lo zhe'o //
translated: Since he does not take what is not given, his merit increases.🔽This first verse shows how he abandons the attachment to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the desire realm.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags spong bar 'gyur ro / bsdams pas dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags spong bar 'gyur ro / bsdams pas dgra sogs mi 'gyur ro //
translated: He is restrained, so he has no enemies and so forth.

original: zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong bas na bsdams pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong bas na bsdams pa zhes bya ste /
translated: He is called “restrained” because he sees the four noble truths.

original: bsdams pa ni lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas nyes pa mi 'byung zhing shin tu sdom pa ste /
analyzed: bsdams pa ni lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi sgo nas nyes pa mi 'byung zhing shin tu sdom pa ste /
translated: Restraint means that he is well restrained and does not commit faults by means of body, speech, and mind.

original: tshul khrims bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrung ba'o //
translated: It is the protection of morality.

original: tshul khrims bsrungs pas na gzhan gyi srog mi gcod do //
analyzed: tshul khrims bsrungs pas na gzhan gyi srog mi gcod do //
translated: Since he protects morality, he does not kill other living beings.

original: srog ma bcad pas na sems la byams pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: srog ma bcad pas na sems la byams pa dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: Since he does not kill, he becomes full of love for sentient beings.

original: byams pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas khong khro ba med do //
analyzed: byams pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pas khong khro ba med do //
translated: Since he has become the embodiment of love, he is without anger.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khong khro ba spangs par ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i khong khro ba spangs par ston to //
translated: This first verse shows the abandonment of anger, which is to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the realm of desire.

original: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //
analyzed: dge dang ldan pas sdig pa spong //
translated: By being virtuous, he abandons evil.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sems rtse gcig par yongs su bsgoms pas na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la sems rtse gcig par yongs su bsgoms pas na /
translated: Since he has thoroughly cultivated one-pointedness of mind with regard to the four noble truths,

original: sdig pa mi spyod de de bas na dge ba dang ldan pa nyid do zhe'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi spyod de de bas na dge ba dang ldan pa nyid do zhe'o //
translated: he does not engage in evil. Therefore, he is said to be virtuous.

original: tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nga rgyal dang ma rig pa spong bar ston to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba 'dis ni 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nga rgyal dang ma rig pa spong bar ston to //
translated: This first verse shows the abandonment of pride and ignorance, which are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the realm of desire.

original: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel //🔽zhes bya ba man chad tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba @158a * //
analyzed: sbyin pas bsod nams rab tu 'phel // zhes bya ba man chad tshigs su bcad pa rtsa ba @158a * //
translated: By generosity, merit increases.

original: 'di gsum gyis /
analyzed: 'di gsum gyis /
translated: The following three verses🔽show the abandonment of the fetters that are to be abandoned by the path of cultivation in the realm of desire.

original: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa bzhi gcig tu bsdus nas gsum du bsdoms te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa bzhi gcig tu bsdus nas gsum du bsdoms te /
translated: The four afflictions of desire realm objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation—attachment, anger, pride and ignorance—are combined into one and then combined with the three of the form realm and the three of the formless realm.

original: chen po dang 'bring po dang chung ngu gsum la gcig gsum gsum ste /
analyzed: chen po dang 'bring po dang chung ngu gsum la gcig gsum gsum ste /
translated: Each of those three—great, medium and small—is divided into three.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rim pa rnam pa dgu la drug man chad spangs pa ni phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rim pa rnam pa dgu la drug man chad spangs pa ni phyir 'ong ba'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: Those who abandon six or more of the nine levels of affliction are called persons who are once returners.

original: dgu char spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag ces bya'o //
analyzed: dgu char spangs pa ni phyir mi 'ong ba'i gang zag ces bya'o //
translated: Those who abandon all nine are called persons who are nonreturners.🔽The sutra states:

original: nyon mongs zad pa mya ngan 'da' //🔽zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pa mya ngan 'da' // zhes bya ba tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni /
translated: Those who exhaust the afflictions attain nirvana.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang gsum khams gnyis na gsum gsum ste /🔽drug la yang thum po gcig tu byas la /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i khams kyi bsgom pas spang bar bya 'dod chags dang nga rgyal dang ma rig pa dang gsum khams gnyis na gsum gsum ste / drug la yang thum po gcig tu byas la /
translated: This verse shows that those who abandon the three afflictions of attachment, pride and ignorance of the two higher realms, the form and formless realms, which are to be abandoned by the path of meditation, are combined into one group.

original: chen po dang / 'bring po dang / chung ngu gsum ste /
analyzed: chen po dang / 'bring po dang / chung ngu gsum ste /
translated: Each of those three—great, medium and small—is divided into three.

original: gcig la yang gsum gsum du bya ste /
analyzed: gcig la yang gsum gsum du bya ste /
translated: Each of the three is threefold.

original: nyon mongs pa'i rim pa dgu ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i rim pa dgu ste /
translated: The nine degrees of defilement are

original: dgu char spangs pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
analyzed: dgu char spangs pa ni dgra bcom pa'o //
translated: The arhat is the one who has abandoned all nine degrees.

original: de bas na gang zag brgyad la bzhi ni dngos su bshad pas bzhi ni nyon mongs pa'i rim pa spong ba la 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na gang zag brgyad la bzhi ni dngos su bshad pas bzhi ni nyon mongs pa'i rim pa spong ba la 'jug pa ste /
translated: Thus, the eight persons are explained in terms of the four direct realizations and the four entrances to the abandonment of the degrees of defilement.

original: rgyun du 'jug pa spangs zin pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: rgyun du 'jug pa spangs zin pa ni rgyun du zhugs pa ste /
translated: The stream-enterer is the one who has already abandoned the three degrees of defilement that are to be abandoned by means of the path of seeing.

original: gong ma gsum yang 'di dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gong ma gsum yang 'di dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the three higher ones.

original: de bas na gang zag brgyad kyi rim pa ni 'dir bstan zin to //
analyzed: de bas na gang zag brgyad kyi rim pa ni 'dir bstan zin to //
translated: Thus, the eight persons are taught in this treatise.

original: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku ring la 'du la ba la bslab pa'i gnas ma bcas te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das sh'akya thub pa'i sku ring la 'du la ba la bslab pa'i gnas ma bcas te /
translated: In the presence of the Lord Sakyamuni, the rules of training were not established for the assembly.

original: 'dul ba 'bum dag ma bstan pa'i tshe dge slong nyes pa la mig che zhing mi dge ba'i chos la nye bar gnas pa dang / dge ba cung zad spyad pa tsam gyis kyang thar par 'gyur ro zhes bsnyems pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dul ba 'bum dag ma bstan pa'i tshe dge slong nyes pa la mig che zhing mi dge ba'i chos la nye bar gnas pa dang / dge ba cung zad spyad pa tsam gyis kyang thar par 'gyur ro zhes bsnyems pa'i phyir /
translated: When the Vinaya was not taught in a hundred thousand sections, the monks were heedless of their faults and were attached to unwholesome dharmas, and they became arrogant, thinking that they would be liberated by merely practicing a little virtue.

original: 'di lta bu'i lta ba bzlog cing de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub bas /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i lta ba bzlog cing de'i gnyen por de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub bas /
translated: The Tathagata Sakyamuni taught this verse in order to counteract such a view.

original: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: Do not commit any evil

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhis bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed dang bzhis bstan to //
translated: The first half of this verse teaches the antidote to the fault of being overscrupulous.🔽Do not commit any evil🔽This one verse teaches the antidote to being overscrupulous.

original: de la / sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la / sdig pa thams cad mi bya'o //
translated: Do not commit any evil

original: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis nyes pa la mig che ba'i gnyen por bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis nyes pa la mig che ba'i gnyen por bstan to //
translated: This one verse teaches the antidote to being overscrupulous.🔽Do not commit any evil🔽This one verse teaches the antidote to being overscrupulous.🔽Do not commit any evil🔽This one verse teaches the antidote to being overscrupulous.
