original: bya ba mi rigs pa thams cad mi bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba mi rigs pa thams cad mi bya'o //
translated: Do not commit any evil🔽This one verse teaches the antidote to being overscrupulous.

original: mkhas par bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lung gis gnang zhing rab tu 'byung du rung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par gnang ba de lta bus bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: mkhas par bsnyen par rdzogs zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi lung gis gnang zhing rab tu 'byung du rung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs par gnang ba de lta bus bsnyen par rdzogs par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: “Ordained by the wise” means ordained by the permission of the Blessed One, suitable for going forth, and ordained by the permission of full ordination.

original: yang na mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang ldan pa la bya /
analyzed: yang na mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes rab dang ldan pa la bya /
translated: Or, “wise” means endowed with wisdom.

original: bsnyen pa ni dge @158b ba rdzogs par bya ba'i don yin pas ngag gis mi bya ba bzhi ste /
analyzed: bsnyen pa ni dge @158b ba rdzogs par bya ba'i don yin pas ngag gis mi bya ba bzhi ste /
translated: “Ordination” means the purpose of full ordination. There are four things not to be done with speech:

original: brdzun dang phra ma dang / byung rgyal gyi tshig dang / zhe gcod par mi smra zhing lhag pa'i shes rab kyi phung po dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la rab tu 'jug pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: brdzun dang phra ma dang / byung rgyal gyi tshig dang / zhe gcod par mi smra zhing lhag pa'i shes rab kyi phung po dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la rab tu 'jug pa'o zhe'o //
translated: not speaking lies, not speaking divisively, not speaking frivolously, and not speaking harshly. One engages in the aggregate of superior wisdom and superior wisdom.

original: rang gi sems kyang yongs su gdul //
analyzed: rang gi sems kyang yongs su gdul //
translated: “Also taming one’s own mind”

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: means

original: yid kyis mi bya ba gsum ste /
analyzed: yid kyis mi bya ba gsum ste /
translated: the three things not to be done with the mind:

original: chags par mi bsams pa dang / ngan du mi bsams pa dang / log par mi lta ba'o //
analyzed: chags par mi bsams pa dang / ngan du mi bsams pa dang / log par mi lta ba'o //
translated: not thinking with attachment, not thinking with aversion, and not viewing wrongly.

original: gzhan du na ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang / lhag pa'i ting nge 'dzin la rab tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: Otherwise, it would be the aggregate of concentration and the entrance into higher concentration.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches par bya ba'i phyir sh'akya thub pas bstan pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa zhes bya ba ni yid ches par bya ba'i phyir sh'akya thub pas bstan pa'o zhe'o //
translated: This is called the teaching of the Buddha, because it is taught by Shakyamuni in order to inspire confidence.

original: des ni nyes pa la mig che ba bzlog pa'i gnyen por bshad do //
analyzed: des ni nyes pa la mig che ba bzlog pa'i gnyen por bshad do //
translated: This explains the antidote to the fault of being overly critical.

original: nyes pa ni spang ba'i thabs bshad de /
analyzed: nyes pa ni spang ba'i thabs bshad de /
translated: The method of abandoning faults is explained.

original: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
analyzed: lus kyi sdom pa legs pa ste //
translated: Restraint of the body is good,

original: zhes bya ba shlo ka phyed dang gnyis smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba shlo ka phyed dang gnyis smos te /
translated: he says, referring to one and a half verses.

original: lus dang ngag yid gsum sdom pa ni gong ma dag dang yang sbyar /
analyzed: lus dang ngag yid gsum sdom pa ni gong ma dag dang yang sbyar /
translated: Restraint of the body, speech, and mind is also connected with the above.

original: yang na lus kyi nyes pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa dang / yid kyi nyes pa 'di bsdams na sdig pa mi 'phel bas na /
analyzed: yang na lus kyi nyes pa dang / ngag gi nyes pa dang / yid kyi nyes pa 'di bsdams na sdig pa mi 'phel bas na /
translated: Or, if one restrains these faults of the body, speech, and mind, evil does not increase.

original: de'i phyir bsdam par bya'o zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsdam par bya'o zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, One should restrain them.

original: de bas na lus kyi sdom pa gang legs na /
analyzed: de bas na lus kyi sdom pa gang legs na /
translated: Therefore, if restraint of the body is good,

original: ngag gi lta ci smos /
analyzed: ngag gi lta ci smos /
translated: what need is there to mention restraint of speech?

original: ngag gis sdom pa yang legs pa yin no /
analyzed: ngag gis sdom pa yang legs pa yin no /
translated: Restraint of speech is also good.

original: yid kyi sdom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: yid kyi sdom pa lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: What need is there to mention mental vows?

original: de'i phyir thams cad bsdom par bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir thams cad bsdom par bya'o zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, all should be restrained.

original: thams cad sdom pa legs pa ni dus gsum du lus dang ngag yid gsum sngom pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad sdom pa legs pa ni dus gsum du lus dang ngag yid gsum sngom pa'o //
translated: The virtue of restraining all is restraining body, speech, and mind in the three times.

original: kun du bsdoms pa'i dge slong ni yul dang / dus dang gang zag la chad pa med par tshul khrims bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: kun du bsdoms pa'i dge slong ni yul dang / dus dang gang zag la chad pa med par tshul khrims bsrung ba'o //
translated: The monk who is completely restrained guards morality without exception in regard to place, time, and person.

original: sdug bsngal gsum las rab tu grol //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum las rab tu grol //
translated: He is completely liberated from the three sufferings.

original: zhes bya ba sdug bsngal ni gsum dang / brgyad dang / khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad las rnam par grol zhing 'khor ba'i btson ra nas thar par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba sdug bsngal ni gsum dang / brgyad dang / khams gsum gyi nyon mongs pa dgu bcu rtsa brgyad las rnam par grol zhing 'khor ba'i btson ra nas thar par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Suffering is threefold, eightfold, and completely liberated from the afflictions of the three realms, which are ninety-eight in number. He is liberated from the prison of cyclic existence.

original: des ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs su bshad do //
analyzed: des ni nyon mongs pa spong ba'i thabs su bshad do //
translated: This explains the method of abandoning afflictions.

original: ngag rnams bsrung zhing yid kyis rab bsdams zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis dran pa mi brjed pa'i thabs su ston te /
analyzed: ngag rnams bsrung zhing yid kyis rab bsdams zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis dran pa mi brjed pa'i thabs su ston te /
translated: Guarding speech and thoroughly restraining the mind. This one verse teaches the method of not forgetting mindfulness.

original: ngag gi srung ba ni ngag gis mi bya ba bzhi dang / gzhan du na rang gi ltung ba lci yang ci byung na dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis glengs shing bstan na /
analyzed: ngag gi srung ba ni ngag gis mi bya ba bzhi dang / gzhan du na rang gi ltung ba lci yang ci byung na dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis glengs shing bstan na /
translated: If one has committed a downfall, whether serious or not, and a spiritual teacher points it out,

original: slar 'khyal zhing mi smra bar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khar gus par nyan pa'o //
analyzed: slar 'khyal zhing mi smra bar dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi khar gus par nyan pa'o //
translated: one should not respond with abuse, but listen respectfully to the spiritual teacher.

original: yid kyis bsdams pa ni 'gyod tshangs byed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yid kyis bsdams pa ni 'gyod tshangs byed pa'i tshe /
translated: The vow of mind is to confess one’s faults with a sincere mind.

original: tshig gis smras pa ma zad kyis /
analyzed: tshig gis smras pa ma zad kyis /
translated: When one confesses verbally, one should not only speak the words,

original: yid kyis sems thag pa nas mthol ba'o //
analyzed: yid kyis sems thag pa nas mthol ba'o //
translated: but confess from the bottom of one’s heart.

original: yang na yid kyis mi bya ba de gsum phyin chad mi byed par yid @159a * //🔽dam du 'cha' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na yid kyis mi bya ba de gsum phyin chad mi byed par yid @159a * // dam du 'cha' ba'o //
translated: Or, one should vow with one’s mind never to commit the three nonvirtues of body, speech, and mind again.

original: lus kyis mi dge ba mi byed //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: lus kyis mi dge ba mi byed // ces bya ba ni /
translated: Do not do any physical nonvirtue.

original: lus kyis mi bya ba ni gsum ste /
analyzed: lus kyis mi bya ba ni gsum ste /
translated: There are three nonvirtues of body:

original: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: srog mi gcod pa dang / ma byin par mi len pa dang / 'dod pas log par mi spyod pa'o //
translated: not taking life, not taking what is not given, and not engaging in sexual misconduct.

original: yang na lus snyogs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'tshog pa la sogs pa'i las rnams mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: yang na lus snyogs pa dang / 'tshe ba dang / 'tshog pa la sogs pa'i las rnams mi byed pa'o //
translated: Or, one should not engage in any action that harms the body, such as beating, striking, or injuring it.

original: rnam pa gzhan du na lus kyi spyod yul ma yin pa lnga spang bar ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du na lus kyi spyod yul ma yin pa lnga spang bar ston te /
translated: Otherwise, it shows the abandonment of the five that are not the domain of the body.

original: de yang gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de yang gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: rgyal po'i pho brang dang / rigs ngan gyi khyim dang / chang 'tshong ba dang rol mo mkhan gyi khyim dang / smad 'tshong gi khyim rnams su mi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i pho brang dang / rigs ngan gyi khyim dang / chang 'tshong ba dang rol mo mkhan gyi khyim dang / smad 'tshong gi khyim rnams su mi spyod pa'o //
translated: Not engaging in the palace of the king, the house of the low caste, the house of the liquor seller and musician, and the house of the prostitute.

original: las lam gsum po 'di dag rab sbyangs nas //
analyzed: las lam gsum po 'di dag rab sbyangs nas //
translated: Having well trained in these three paths of action,

original: drang srong gsungs pa'i lam ni thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: drang srong gsungs pa'i lam ni thob par 'gyur //
translated: one attains the path taught by the Sage.

original: zhes bya ba lam zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba lam zhes bya ba ni dpe ste /
translated: Here, “path” is a metaphor.

original: 'di ltar lam la skye bo kun rgyu zhing 'gro ba ltar lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi lam la yang /
analyzed: 'di ltar lam la skye bo kun rgyu zhing 'gro ba ltar lus dang ngag yid gsum gyi lam la yang /
translated: Just as all people travel on a path, so too, on the path of body, speech, and mind,

original: dge sdig gi dngos po rgyu zhing 'gro bar byed pas lam dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: dge sdig gi dngos po rgyu zhing 'gro bar byed pas lam dang 'dra ste /
translated: the entities of virtue and evil travel and go. Therefore, it is like a path.

original: de gsum rab tu sbyangs pas na dri ma dang / skyon med par sbyangs pas drang po'i lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de gsum rab tu sbyangs pas na dri ma dang / skyon med par sbyangs pas drang po'i lam zhes bya ste /
translated: Since one has well trained in those three, since one has trained without stains and faults, it is called the straight path.

original: des thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' yin pas na /
analyzed: des thob pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bka' yin pas na /
translated: Since one attains that, it is the word of the Tathāgata.

original: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la lung dang mthun par spyad pas na /
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam gyi yan lag brgyad la lung dang mthun par spyad pas na /
translated: By practicing the eightfold noble path in accordance with the scriptures,

original: gang zag brgyad kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gang zag brgyad kyi 'bras bu thob par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: one will attain the fruits of the eight persons.

original: de bas na sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i tshe'i nyan thos ni /
analyzed: de bas na sangs rgyas sh'akya thub pa'i tshe'i nyan thos ni /
translated: Therefore, the śrāvakas of Buddha Śākyamuni

original: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du shlo ka 'di rnams kyis 'dul zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing spyod do //
analyzed: lo bcu gnyis kyi bar du shlo ka 'di rnams kyis 'dul zhing rnam par grol bar 'gyur zhing spyod do //
translated: were disciplined and liberated by these verses for twelve years.

original: lo bcu gsum du gyur nas ni 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
analyzed: lo bcu gsum du gyur nas ni 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gnas bcas so //
translated: After thirteen years, the precepts of the Vinaya were established.

original: de la sangs rgyas rabs bdun po smos pa ni bsdu ba'i tshig ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas rabs bdun po smos pa ni bsdu ba'i tshig ste /
translated: Here, the mention of the seven generations of Buddhas is a summarizing statement.

original: gong du smras pa'i tshig 'og tu 'di'o zhes bsdus nas yang dag par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gong du smras pa'i tshig 'og tu 'di'o zhes bsdus nas yang dag par bstan pa'o //
translated: Having summarized the words spoken above, it is taught again.

original: sh'akya thub pa goo tam //
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa goo tam //
translated: Śākyamuni Gautama

original: zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs nas bstod pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni khyim pa'i phyogs nas bstod pa ste /
translated: This is praise from the perspective of a householder.

original: thub pa ni sgo gsum nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar thub pa'o //
analyzed: thub pa ni sgo gsum nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar thub pa'o //
translated: Sage means being restrained, not giving rise to faults through the three doors.

original: goo tam zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi rnam grangs kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
analyzed: goo tam zhes bya ba ni yon tan gyi rnam grangs kyi sgo nas bstod pa'o //
translated: Gautama is a praise in terms of a synonym of his qualities.

original: lha'i lha zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi lha dang rnam par grol ba'i lha gnyis yod pa las /
analyzed: lha'i lha zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi lha dang rnam par grol ba'i lha gnyis yod pa las /
translated: The god of gods means that there are two kinds of gods: worldly gods and liberated gods.

original: sh'akya thub pa rigs kyi 'jig rten gyi lha chen po brjed pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa rigs kyi 'jig rten gyi lha chen po brjed pa'i tshe /
translated: When Shakyamuni, the great worldly god of the Shakya clan, was forgotten,

original: rgyal bud don grub pa btsas nas rgyal bu don grub kyis lha de la phyag byas pa dang / lha de mgo tshal pa bdun du gas pas /
analyzed: rgyal bud don grub pa btsas nas rgyal bu don grub kyis lha de la phyag byas pa dang / lha de mgo tshal pa bdun du gas pas /
translated: when Prince Siddhartha was born, Prince Siddhartha paid homage to that god, and the god's head split into seven pieces.

original: de bas kyang 'phags par gyur pas na lha'i lha zhes sh'akya thub pa la mtshan du gsol /
analyzed: de bas kyang 'phags par gyur pas na lha'i lha zhes sh'akya thub pa la mtshan du gsol /
translated: Since he was even more exalted than that, Shakyamuni was given the name god of gods.

original: mi 'dul ba ni sh'akya thub pa 'jig rten du gshegs pa'i tshe dus ngan te /
analyzed: mi 'dul ba ni sh'akya thub pa 'jig rten du gshegs pa'i tshe dus ngan te /
translated: As for tamer of men, when Shakyamuni came to the world, it was a degenerate age.

original: skye bo rnams shin tu gdul dka' ba'i phyir de lta bu gdul bas na mi gdul gdul ba'o //
analyzed: skye bo rnams shin tu gdul dka' ba'i phyir de lta bu gdul bas na mi gdul gdul ba'o //
translated: Since beings were very difficult to tame, he tamed such beings, so he is the tamer of men to be tamed.

original: @159b yang na mi gdul ba ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa mdzes dga' dang / zhe sdang dang ldan pa sor mo'i phreng ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung lta bu shin tu gdul dka' ba yang /
analyzed: @159b yang na mi gdul ba ni 'dod chags dang ldan pa mdzes dga' dang / zhe sdang dang ldan pa sor mo'i phreng ba dang / gti mug dang ldan pa lteng rgyas 'od srung lta bu shin tu gdul dka' ba yang /
translated: Or else, the untamed are those who are very difficult to tame, such as the lustful Sundari, the hateful Angulimala, and the deluded Uruvilva Kasyapa.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis btul nas dge ba la gzhag pas na mi 'dul ba'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis btul nas dge ba la gzhag pas na mi 'dul ba'o //
translated: But the Lord tamed them and established them in virtue, so he is the untamed.

original: yang rnyog pa lnga ni sems can dang lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bskal pa dang / tshe'i rnyog pa'o //
analyzed: yang rnyog pa lnga ni sems can dang lta ba dang / nyon mongs pa dang / bskal pa dang / tshe'i rnyog pa'o //
translated: Or else, the five turbidities are the turbidities of sentient beings, views, afflictions, aeons, and life.

original: rnyog pa lnga'i tshe mi 'dul bas na mi 'dul ba'o zhe'o //
analyzed: rnyog pa lnga'i tshe mi 'dul bas na mi 'dul ba'o zhe'o //
translated: Since he does not tame sentient beings when the five turbidities are present, he is the untamed.

original: kha lo sgyur ba ni khams gsum gyi sems can nyon mongs pa las 'phags pa'i lam du kha lo sgyur bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha lo sgyur ba ni khams gsum gyi sems can nyon mongs pa las 'phags pa'i lam du kha lo sgyur bar byed pa'o //
translated: The charioteer is the one who turns the minds of sentient beings of the three realms away from afflictions and toward the path of the noble ones.

original: bla na med pa ni nyan thos man chad tshangs pa dang / brgya byin gyis gdul ba rgya chung ngu lta bu ma yin te /
analyzed: bla na med pa ni nyan thos man chad tshangs pa dang / brgya byin gyis gdul ba rgya chung ngu lta bu ma yin te /
translated: Unsurpassed means that he is not like Brahma or Indra, who tame those below the sravakas, but whose taming is of limited scope.

original: rgya che zhing gong na med pas bla na med pa'o //
analyzed: rgya che zhing gong na med pas bla na med pa'o //
translated: He is unsurpassed because his taming is of vast scope and is supreme.

original: 'jig rten mgon po skyob pa'i mchog / ces bya ba 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten mgon po skyob pa'i mchog / ces bya ba 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la bya'o //
translated: The world's protector, the supreme refuge means that the world refers to the five appropriated aggregates.

original: mgon po ni sems can thams cad kyi mgon du gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa la bya'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni sems can thams cad kyi mgon du gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa la bya'o //
translated: The protector refers to the Tathagata, who has become the protector of all sentient beings.

original: de skyob ba ni skye bo ngan par spyad cing ngan song du 'gro ba las skyob cing thar par 'dren pas skyob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de skyob ba ni skye bo ngan par spyad cing ngan song du 'gro ba las skyob cing thar par 'dren pas skyob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The refuge is called refuge because it protects beings from engaging in evil conduct and from going to the lower realms, and leads them to liberation.

original: mchog ni skyob par byed pa mang mod kyi sangs rgyas kyi skyob pa lta bu gzhan la med pas na /
analyzed: mchog ni skyob par byed pa mang mod kyi sangs rgyas kyi skyob pa lta bu gzhan la med pas na /
translated: The supreme means that although there are many who provide refuge, none other than the Buddha's refuge exists, so...

original: sangs rgyas kyi skyob pa ni mchog go zhes bstan to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi skyob pa ni mchog go zhes bstan to //
translated: The Buddha's refuge is supreme is taught.

original: sangs rgyas bdun po zhes smos pa dang / skabs 'dir kha cig the tshom du gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdun po zhes smos pa dang / skabs 'dir kha cig the tshom du gyur te /
translated: Regarding the mention of the seven Buddhas, some had doubts in this context, thinking...

original: sangs rgyas bdun por zas kyis phyis 'byung ngam mi 'byung snyam pa la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bdun por zas kyis phyis 'byung ngam mi 'byung snyam pa la /
translated: Will food appear for the seven Buddhas or not?

original: phyis sangs rgyas 'byung bar bstan pa'i gleng gzhi ni mdo sde bzang po zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba bskal pa gsum yod de /
analyzed: phyis sangs rgyas 'byung bar bstan pa'i gleng gzhi ni mdo sde bzang po zhes bya ba'i nang nas 'byung ba bskal pa gsum yod de /
translated: There are three eons:

original: me dang rlung dang / chu'i bskal pa'o //
analyzed: me dang rlung dang / chu'i bskal pa'o //
translated: the eon of fire, the eon of wind, and the eon of water.

original: de la chu'i bskal pa bdo zhing 'gyur ba'i tshe /
analyzed: de la chu'i bskal pa bdo zhing 'gyur ba'i tshe /
translated: When the eon of water is about to end and change,

original: 'od gsal lha'i ris su 'di lta bu'i ltas byung ste /
analyzed: 'od gsal lha'i ris su 'di lta bu'i ltas byung ste /
translated: the following signs appear in the realm of the gods of clear light:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba de snyed kyi pad mo rdzing las skyes te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'jig rten du 'byung ba de snyed kyi pad mo rdzing las skyes te /
translated: The number of lotuses that arise from the pond is equal to the number of Tathagatas who will appear in the world.

original: de'i tshe rdzing chen po las pad ma stod rtsa bdun byung nas /
analyzed: de'i tshe rdzing chen po las pad ma stod rtsa bdun byung nas /
translated: At that time, seven hundred lotuses arise from the great pond.

original: lha dag na re ae ma'o //
analyzed: lha dag na re ae ma'o //
translated: The gods say, Oh!

original: de bzhin gshegs pa stong rtsa bdun 'byung ba'i ltas shig ces zer te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa stong rtsa bdun 'byung ba'i ltas shig ces zer te /
translated: This is a sign that seven hundred Tathagatas will appear.

original: de dag las sangs rgyas rabs bdun 'das zin te /
analyzed: de dag las sangs rgyas rabs bdun 'das zin te /
translated: Among them, seven generations of Buddhas have already passed,

original: rnam par gzigs nas sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs nas sh'akya thub pa bzhugs pa'i bar du'o //
translated: from Vipashyin up to Shakyamuni.

original: stod rtsa bdun las bdun gshegs zin pas ltag pa stong gdod gshegs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: stod rtsa bdun las bdun gshegs zin pas ltag pa stong gdod gshegs par 'gyur te /
translated: Since seven of the seven hundred have already come, only six hundred remain to come.

original: tha mar ni phyag na rdo rje bzhed pa can zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: tha mar ni phyag na rdo rje bzhed pa can zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the end, he will become the Tathagata called Vajrapāṇi-abhiprasanna.

original: sems can gyi don mdzad do zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems can gyi don mdzad do zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: He will work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba la mi skyo mi ldog pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi dgra rnams 'joms par byed pas @160a * //🔽na dpa' bo'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba la mi skyo mi ldog pa dang / nyon mongs pa dang bdud kyi dgra rnams 'joms par byed pas @160a * // na dpa' bo'o //
translated: The word “hero” means that he is not discouraged or turned back from working for the welfare of sentient beings, and that he conquers the enemies of afflictions and demons.

original: yang na bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du sems can gyi don mdzad pas na dpa' bo zhe'o //
analyzed: yang na bskal pa grangs med pa'i bar du sems can gyi don mdzad pas na dpa' bo zhe'o //
translated: Or, he is a hero because he works for the welfare of sentient beings for the duration of three countless eons.

original: bdun po ni rnam par gzigs nas sh'akya thub pa'i bar du sngar byung ba rnams kyi grangs so //🔽grags ldan ni sangs rgyas bdun po'i yon tan te /
analyzed: bdun po ni rnam par gzigs nas sh'akya thub pa'i bar du sngar byung ba rnams kyi grangs so // grags ldan ni sangs rgyas bdun po'i yon tan te /
translated: The seven are the seven buddhas who appeared before him, beginning with Vipaśyin and ending with Śākyamuni.

original: bdud bzhi bcom nas bsod nams dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan no zhes 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom nas bsod nams dang / ye shes phun sum tshogs pa dang ldan no zhes 'jig rten du grags pa'o //
translated: The word “renowned” means that the qualities of the seven buddhas are renowned in the world, in that they have conquered the four demons and are endowed with the perfection of merit and wisdom.

original: so sor thar pa ni sangs rgyas bdun pos bshad pa'i so sor thar ba /
analyzed: so sor thar pa ni sangs rgyas bdun pos bshad pa'i so sor thar ba /
translated: The word “prātimokṣa” means the prātimokṣa taught by the seven buddhas.

original: bzod ba dka' thub dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bzod ba dka' thub dam pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Patience is the highest austerity” and so on.

original: de ni rab tu rgyas par bshad //
analyzed: de ni rab tu rgyas par bshad //
translated: This is explained in detail.

original: ces bya ba ni de ltar tshig nyung ngu zin gyis kyang don kun 'dir 'dus pas na de dag gi tshe de tsam dag gis kyang nyan thos de dag rnam par grol zhing bslab pa las mi 'da' bar rgyas pa dang 'dra bar 'bras bu thob pas na
analyzed: ces bya ba ni de ltar tshig nyung ngu zin gyis kyang don kun 'dir 'dus pas na de dag gi tshe de tsam dag gis kyang nyan thos de dag rnam par grol zhing bslab pa las mi 'da' bar rgyas pa dang 'dra bar 'bras bu thob pas na
translated: Thus, even with few words, since all the meanings are included here, at that time, even with just that much, those śrāvakas are liberated and do not transgress the training.

original: rgyas pa zhes bshad do //🔽'di la sangs rgyas rnams dang gang //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bshad do // 'di la sangs rgyas rnams dang gang //
translated: Therefore, it is explained as “extensive.”🔽Here, the qualities of the seven buddhas

original: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis sangs rgyas bdun gyi yon tan dang / 'bras bu bsngags pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig gis sangs rgyas bdun gyi yon tan dang / 'bras bu bsngags pa ston te /
translated: and the praise of the result are taught in one verse.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bdun gyis gsungs pa'i so sor thar pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas bdun gyis gsungs pa'i so sor thar pa 'di la'o //
translated: “Here” refers to this individual liberation taught by the seven buddhas.

original: sangs rgyas nyan thos dag kyang gus //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyan thos dag kyang gus //
translated: The buddhas and śrāvakas also have respect.

original: zhes bya ba snga ma 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bdun po dag kyang so sor thar pa la bsrung zhing gus pa dang bcas te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba snga ma 'das pa'i sangs rgyas bdun po dag kyang so sor thar pa la bsrung zhing gus pa dang bcas te /
translated: The seven buddhas of the past also guarded the individual liberation and had respect.

original: bla mar byas shing yongs su bsrung bas na bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob po //
analyzed: bla mar byas shing yongs su bsrung bas na bla na med pa'i 'bras bu thob po //
translated: Since they revere and fully protect the precepts, they attain the unsurpassed result.

original: de bzhin du nyan thos rnams kyang gus par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du nyan thos rnams kyang gus par byed do //
translated: Similarly, the śrāvakas also revere them.

original: de la gus bcas gyur pa dang // zhes gus pa dang bcas pa ni tshul khrims sdom zhing nan tan du bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: de la gus bcas gyur pa dang // zhes gus pa dang bcas pa ni tshul khrims sdom zhing nan tan du bsrung ba'o //
translated: Here, those who have reverence are those who are restrained by the precepts and diligently protect them.

original: 'dus ma byas pa thob par 'gyur //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa thob par 'gyur //
translated: They will attain the unconditioned.

original: zhes pa 'dus ma byas pa ni brag pa med pa'i chos te /
analyzed: zhes pa 'dus ma byas pa ni brag pa med pa'i chos te /
translated: The unconditioned is the dharmas without outflows.

original: 'gog pa dang lam la bya'o //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam la bya'o //
translated: It should refer to cessation and the path.

original: de yang ji ltar thob ce na so sor thar pa bsrung zhing yongs su bsdams pas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ni spangs /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar thob ce na so sor thar pa bsrung zhing yongs su bsdams pas sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ni spangs /
translated: Moreover, how is it attained? By protecting and fully restraining the prātimokṣa, suffering and its origin are abandoned.

original: 'gog pa dang lam ni mngon sum du byas shing yongs su bsgoms pas 'du byed thams cad yongs su spang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam ni mngon sum du byas shing yongs su bsgoms pas 'du byed thams cad yongs su spang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By manifesting and fully cultivating cessation and the path, all conditioned things are abandoned.

original: brtsam par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
analyzed: brtsam par bya zhing 'byung bar bya //
translated: One should undertake and emerge.

original: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig ni slob dpon au p'a lis rab tu byung ba dang khyem ba'i phyogs dge ba'i phyogs la gzhen bskul gdab pa dang / dad pa skyed cing spro bar bya ba'i phyir thabs bstan pa ston te /🔽brtsam par bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dad cing mos nas /🔽de la 'jug cing bslab par brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba shlo ka gcig ni slob dpon au p'a lis rab tu byung ba dang khyem ba'i phyogs dge ba'i phyogs la gzhen bskul gdab pa dang / dad pa skyed cing spro bar bya ba'i phyir thabs bstan pa ston te / brtsam par bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dad cing mos nas / de la 'jug cing bslab par brtsams pa'o //
translated: One verse to teach the method of encouraging and inspiring those who have gone forth and those who are householders to the virtuous side, as taught by Master Upagupta:🔽One should undertake it.🔽One should enter it and begin training in it.

original: 'byung ba ni brtan pa la bslabs nas don go ba dang khyim spong zhing rab byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni brtan pa la bslabs nas don go ba dang khyim spong zhing rab byung ba'o //
translated: One should emerge from it.

original: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bstan la 'jug par bya //
translated: One should enter the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni bden pa bzhi dang @160b so sor thar pa nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni bden pa bzhi dang @160b so sor thar pa nyid la bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the Buddha should be understood as the four noble truths and the code of monastic discipline.

original: khyim nas byung phan chad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni bden pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam brgyad dang / so sor thar pa yang dag par 'jug pa zhe'o //
analyzed: khyim nas byung phan chad sangs rgyas kyi bstan pa ni bden pa bzhi dang / 'phags pa'i lam brgyad dang / so sor thar pa yang dag par 'jug pa zhe'o //
translated: After leaving the home life, one should enter the teaching of the Buddha, which is the four noble truths, the eightfold noble path, and the code of monastic discipline.

original: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bskyed do //
analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i lam gyis bskyed do //
translated: It is generated by the path of seeing.

original: 'dom bu'i khyim na glang chen bzhin //
analyzed: 'dom bu'i khyim na glang chen bzhin //
translated: Like an elephant in a house of reeds,

original: 'chi bdag sde rnams gzhom par bya //
analyzed: 'chi bdag sde rnams gzhom par bya //
translated: he destroys the forces of the Lord of Death.

original: zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam gyis bskyed pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba bsgom pa'i lam gyis bskyed pa ste /
translated: This is generated by the path of meditation.

original: gong du bden pa bzhi dang 'phags pa'i lam brgyad yongs su bsgoms pas 'chi bdag gi ste skye rgan 'chi rnams so sor thar pas bsdams pa dang / bden pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i mthus gzhom par byed pa'o //🔽dper na khyim rtsva'i 'am /
analyzed: gong du bden pa bzhi dang 'phags pa'i lam brgyad yongs su bsgoms pas 'chi bdag gi ste skye rgan 'chi rnams so sor thar pas bsdams pa dang / bden pa bzhi bsgoms pa'i mthus gzhom par byed pa'o // dper na khyim rtsva'i 'am /
translated: By thoroughly cultivating the four noble truths and the eightfold noble path, he binds the forces of the Lord of Death, that is, birth, aging and death, with the fetters of liberation and destroys them through the power of cultivating the four noble truths.

original: 'dom bu'i khyim snying po med cing mi brten pa la glang pos bcom pa bzhin du skye rga na 'chi'i sde rtsva khyim dang 'dra ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi glang po dang 'dra bas 'joms par byed pa'o //🔽gang zhig rab tu bag yod pa //
analyzed: 'dom bu'i khyim snying po med cing mi brten pa la glang pos bcom pa bzhin du skye rga na 'chi'i sde rtsva khyim dang 'dra ba la bsod nams dang ye shes kyi glang po dang 'dra bas 'joms par byed pa'o // gang zhig rab tu bag yod pa //
translated: For example, just as an elephant destroys a house of reeds, which is insubstantial and unstable, he destroys the forces of birth, aging, sickness and death, which are like a house of reeds, with the elephant of merit and wisdom.

original: zhes pa shlo ka gnyis kyis ni bslab pa la nan tan byed pa'i brjod pa ston te /
analyzed: zhes pa shlo ka gnyis kyis ni bslab pa la nan tan byed pa'i brjod pa ston te /
translated: The two verses beginning with “Whoever is very heedful” show the expression of assiduous practice of the precepts.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni skye bo dge ba can la bya /
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni skye bo dge ba can la bya /
translated: The one who is called a virtuous person.

original: bag yod pa ni dge ba can te /
analyzed: bag yod pa ni dge ba can te /
translated: The one who is heedful is virtuous.

original: nyon mongs pa la bag byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la bag byed pa'o //
translated: He is heedful with regard to the afflictions.

original: chos 'dul 'di la spyod 'gyur ba //
analyzed: chos 'dul 'di la spyod 'gyur ba //
translated: He will practice this Dharma and Vinaya.

original: zhes pa chos 'dul ba ni so sor thar pa dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la bya'o spyod par 'gyur ba ni skye bo dge can 'di la spyod par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa chos 'dul ba ni so sor thar pa dang 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi la bya'o spyod par 'gyur ba ni skye bo dge can 'di la spyod par 'jug pa'o //
translated: This Dharma and Vinaya refers to the Pratimoksha and the four noble truths. To practice is for the virtuous person to engage in this practice.🔽He will abandon birth and cyclic existence.

original: skye ba'i 'khor bar ba spangs zhes pa zhes pa skye ba rnam pa bzhi la bya'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i 'khor bar ba spangs zhes pa zhes pa skye ba rnam pa bzhi la bya'o //
translated: Birth refers to the four types of birth.

original: 'khor ba ni lam rgyud lnga la bya ste /
analyzed: 'khor ba ni lam rgyud lnga la bya ste /
translated: Cyclic existence refers to the five paths of cyclic existence.

original: gang du so sor thar pa dang bden pa la bsgoms pas rnam pa de dgu spangs par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gang du so sor thar pa dang bden pa la bsgoms pas rnam pa de dgu spangs par 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: By meditating on the Pratimoksha and the four noble truths, he will abandon those nine types.

original: sdug bsngal tha mar phyin par 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar phyin par 'gyur //
translated: He will reach the end of suffering.

original: zhes pa gong du skye ba dang / 'khor ba yongs su spangs pas na /
analyzed: zhes pa gong du skye ba dang / 'khor ba yongs su spangs pas na /
translated: Since he has abandoned birth and cyclic existence,

original: sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad las thar bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum dang brgyad las thar bar 'gyur te /
translated: he will be liberated from the three and eight types of suffering.

original: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthar phyin pa de 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang bsgom pa'i lam gyi mthar phyin pa de 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: That is the culmination of the paths of seeing and cultivation.

original: phan tshun khrims srung ba zhes bya ba tshul khrims srung ba ni sgo gsum nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pa dang / nyes pa byung na yang gcig la gcig bshags shing mthol dang nyes pa gsol ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun khrims srung ba zhes bya ba tshul khrims srung ba ni sgo gsum nas nyes pa mi 'byung bar bsdams pa dang / nyes pa byung na yang gcig la gcig bshags shing mthol dang nyes pa gsol ba'o //
translated: Mutual protection of morality means that, since one is restrained by not letting faults arise in the three doors, and even if faults do occur, one confesses and reveals them to one another, and requests purification of faults.

original: bstan pa 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyes pa mthol zhing gsol bas na /
analyzed: bstan pa 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni nyes pa mthol zhing gsol bas na /
translated: The teaching will flourish means that, since one confesses and reveals faults,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab mi 'grib cing rgyas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung rab mi 'grib cing rgyas pa dang 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: the scriptures of the Tathagata will not decline, but will spread and flourish.

original: so sor thar pa bshad pas ni //
analyzed: so sor thar pa bshad pas ni //
translated: By explaining the Pratimoksha,

original: dge 'dun gyis ni gso sbyong byas //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ni gso sbyong byas //
translated: the Sangha performs the Poṣadha.

original: zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa phan tshun tshul khrims mig bzhin du bsrung ba dang / bstan pa rgyas par bya ba'i phyir so sor thar pa bshad cing gso sbyong bya'o zhe'o //🔽gang @161a * //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gong du smos pa phan tshun tshul khrims mig bzhin du bsrung ba dang / bstan pa rgyas par bya ba'i phyir so sor thar pa bshad cing gso sbyong bya'o zhe'o //🔽gang @161a * //
translated: This means that, as mentioned above, in order to protect morality like one's eyes and to make the teaching flourish, one should explain the Pratimoksha and perform the Poṣadha.

original: gi phyir ni mdo bshad ces bya ba shlo ka gcig gis yang dag par bsrung ba ston te /
analyzed: gi phyir ni mdo bshad ces bya ba shlo ka gcig gis yang dag par bsrung ba ston te /
translated: One verse on the teaching of perfect protection.

original: srog mi phangs par tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o zhe'o //
analyzed: srog mi phangs par tshul khrims bsrung bar bya'o zhe'o //
translated: One should protect morality even at the risk of one's life.🔽Why is the Sravakayana taught?

original: gang gi phyir ni mdo bshad ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo bshad ces bya ba'i don to //🔽gang phyir gso spyod byas gyur zhes pa tshul khrims dam du srung zhing bsrung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir ni mdo bshad ces bya ba ni ci'i phyir so sor thar pa'i mdo bshad ces bya ba'i don to // gang phyir gso spyod byas gyur zhes pa tshul khrims dam du srung zhing bsrung bar bya ba'o //
translated: Because it is the basis of the Bodhisattva canon.

original: tshul khrims de ni bsrung byas zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong byas pas chog pa ma yin gyi tshul khrims bsrung ba la nan tan spyod du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims de ni bsrung byas zhes bya ba ni gso sbyong byas pas chog pa ma yin gyi tshul khrims bsrung ba la nan tan spyod du gzhug pa'o //
translated: One should protect that morality, and not be satisfied with just the observance of the purificatory fast.

original: g-yag rnga'i rtse mo ji bzhin no //
analyzed: g-yag rnga'i rtse mo ji bzhin no //
translated: One should practice the morality as if it were the tip of a yak's tail.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims mig bzhin du phangs shing srog gi phyir yang mi dral ba'i dpe ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims mig bzhin du phangs shing srog gi phyir yang mi dral ba'i dpe ste /
translated: This shows the analogy of the eye, in that one should value morality as one does one's eyes, and not violate it even at the risk of one's life.

original: gzhan kha cig na re nags stug po'i nang na gnas pa'i tshe rnga ma shing la mi thogs shing mi zin pa dang mi zegs mi gong cing /
analyzed: gzhan kha cig na re nags stug po'i nang na gnas pa'i tshe rnga ma shing la mi thogs shing mi zin pa dang mi zegs mi gong cing /
translated: Some say: When a rabbit lives in a dense forest, its tail does not touch or cling to trees and it does not break or fall.🔽When it touches or clings to trees, it fears breaking or falling and is cautious.

original: shing la thogs shing zin na yang god cing zegs su dogs nas bag byed pa ltar bslab pa la zhugs pa'i gang zag kyang tshul khrims srog gi phyir yang mi dral lo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: shing la thogs shing zin na yang god cing zegs su dogs nas bag byed pa ltar bslab pa la zhugs pa'i gang zag kyang tshul khrims srog gi phyir yang mi dral lo zhes bstan to //
translated: Similarly, when a person who has entered the training does not violate ethics even for the sake of life, this is taught.

original: so sor thar pa bshad pa 'di nas 'phags pa la au p'a lis dang po rtsom pa'i tshe bgegs dang bar chad kyis mi tshugs par bya ba dang / brtsams pa rnams mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir rang gi lha yid du 'ong ba la brten nas /
analyzed: so sor thar pa bshad pa 'di nas 'phags pa la au p'a lis dang po rtsom pa'i tshe bgegs dang bar chad kyis mi tshugs par bya ba dang / brtsams pa rnams mthar phyin par bya ba'i phyir rang gi lha yid du 'ong ba la brten nas /
translated: From this explanation of the pratimokṣa, when Ārya Upagupta first began composing, he relied on his pleasing deity to prevent obstacles and hindrances and to complete his compositions.

original: brtsams pa rnams kyi mthar yang phyin /
analyzed: brtsams pa rnams kyi mthar yang phyin /
translated: He completed his compositions.

original: bgegs dang bar chad zhi nas skye bo so so'i smon lam btab ba'o //
analyzed: bgegs dang bar chad zhi nas skye bo so so'i smon lam btab ba'o //
translated: After obstacles and hindrances were pacified, individuals made aspirations.

original: so sor thar pa bshad pa ni so sor thar pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: so sor thar pa bshad pa ni so sor thar pa bshad pa'o //
translated: The explanation of the pratimokṣa is the explanation of the pratimokṣa.

original: bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa bsod nams grub pa ni de'i bsod nams bdag gis cung zad ci thob pa la bya'o //
analyzed: bsod nams grub pa gang yod pa bsod nams grub pa ni de'i bsod nams bdag gis cung zad ci thob pa la bya'o //
translated: Whatever merit has been accomplished, the accomplishment of merit is what one's own merit is.

original: des ni 'jig rten ma lus par de'i bsod nams ma lus pa de nyid kyis so //
analyzed: des ni 'jig rten ma lus par de'i bsod nams ma lus pa de nyid kyis so //
translated: By that, the entire world, by that very merit of the world,

original: 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po ma lus pa ni khams gsum mo /
analyzed: 'jig rten ni nye bar len pa'i phung po ma lus pa ni khams gsum mo /
translated: the world is the three realms without exception.

original: thub dbang go 'phang thob par shog / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: thub dbang go 'phang thob par shog / ces bya ba ni /
translated: May they attain the state of the Lord of Sages.

original: thub dbang ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste /🔽nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang po'o //
analyzed: thub dbang ni de bzhin gshegs pa ste / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi dbang po'o //
translated: The Lord of Sages is the Tathagata.

original: go 'phang ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang thabs so //
analyzed: go 'phang ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan dang thabs so //
translated: The state is the qualities and means of the Tathagata.

original: thob par shog ces bya ba ni khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyang 'di ltar gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: thob par shog ces bya ba ni khams gsum gyi sems can thams cad kyang 'di ltar gyur cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: May they attain is for all beings of the three realms to become like this.

original: so sor thar pa'i mdo rdzogs pa ni brtsams pa mthar phyin te /
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i mdo rdzogs pa ni brtsams pa mthar phyin te /
translated: The completion of the Pratimoksha Sutra is the completion of the composition.

original: nyan pa rnams dbugs phyin pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: nyan pa rnams dbugs phyin pa'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: It is said that in order to reassure the listeners.

original: so sor thar pa'i bshad pa mi brjed dran byed tsam du bris pa rdzogs so //
analyzed: so sor thar pa'i bshad pa mi brjed dran byed tsam du bris pa rdzogs so //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the Pratimokṣa, written down merely to remind myself.

original: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dz'a ran dha ra dang zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur ci la zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: rgya gar gyi mkhan po dz'a ran dha ra dang zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong rin chen bzang pos bsgyur ci la zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: It was translated, edited, and finalized by the Indian preceptor Jārandhara and the great editor and translator-monk Rinchen Zangpo.
